member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: Using the methods SetConfiguration(), SetMeasurementType() and SetDetector() the internal settings of the measurement device are changed. This function reads the current configuration from the internal software and returns all those settings for read-only access. All settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the Channel Power Receiver settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. @note The result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above shall be used.
member.return: a structure filled with the currently valid values or NULL if the call was not processed successfully.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the number of channels and the table of frequencies. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. the measurement result.
member.param: Contains the channel configuration that shall be measured. The configuration consists of a set of frequencies and bandwidths, for which a measurement time and attenuation is specified.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwMeasRatePer1000Sec
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.GetChannelCountLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: Returns reference to basic interface object implementation. The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.CViComCWScanInterface
member.summary: Interface to perform channel power measurements (also called CW measurements). Channel power measurements do not perform any RAT specific measurements like demodulation or others. In this way they can easily be adopted to new technologies and can be used to perform the first, generic measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SSettings
member.summary: This structure contains all the currently active settings stored in the ViComCWScan interface, which are used to actually perform the measurement. All the content has either been set by related Set methods of the CViComCWScanInterface, or they are still in their default values. @note The values in this structures cannot be changed, they are read-only. Even if they are modified after the structure is requested by the GetSettings() method, the changes will not be reflected in the internal settings.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SAttenuation.eAttenuation
member.summary: Attenuation used during measurement. Only valid for bAutoAttenuation set to false;

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SAttenuation.bAutoAttenuation
member.summary: Receiver attenuation settings. Set to true for auto attenuation, false for fixed attenuation. Attention: It's highly recommended to use auto attenuation mode. Fixed attenuation mode shall only be used if absolutely necessary! Applying high power in a low attenuation mode scenario can drive the receiver into compression. Level accuracy stated in the receiver data sheet can't be guaranteed for fixed attenuation mode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SAttenuation.Attenuation.Type.HIGH
member.summary: Preamplifier OFF, Attenuation 15dB.

member.summary: Preamplifier OFF, Attenuation 0dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SAttenuation.Attenuation.Type.SMALL
member.summary: Preamplifier ON, Attenuation 0dB.

member.summary: Definition of attenuation modes.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SAttenuation
member.summary: Container for attenuation settings.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CWScan.SMeasurementTimeDetector.dwMeasTimeInNs
member.summary: The channel measurement time in nsec. The time span for measuring a CW channel relates to the number of samples and the chosen sampling rate which are internally determined for a given channel bandwidth. For TDD signals it might be necessary to override the automatically chosen setting. Set to 1 for automatic mode.

member.summary: Peak detector (detects the maximum value)

member.summary: Definition of measurement time detector modes.

member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of a CDMA 2000 measurement and holds the message data that shall be decoded.
Unless specified, the default timeout value to use.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration, internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings, all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current R&S TSM settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (specific demodulation requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. To enable or disable BTS related demodulation, this can only be achieved using this method.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.GetChannelState(System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetChannelState returns the current status of the configurable settings from the channel.
member.param: Specifies the 0-based channel index to be queried.
member.return: an object of SChannelState which contains the current state for the channel. The items in SChannelState can be modified during a running measurement using the ModifyChannel method. SChannelState and ModifyChannel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.ModifyChannel(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SChannelState!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.AddChannel(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
When set to true, indicates the channel type is EVDO. When set to false, indicates the channel type is CDMA.
member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.
member.param: when adding a CDMA channel and at least one CDMA channel was not configured prior to starting measurements.
when adding an EVDO channel and at least one EVDO channel was not configured prior to starting measurements.

member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. Each frequency has a table of PN Offset Arbitrary Limitation settings attached. The frequency or channel index is 0-based and is referenced in other data. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the Message Identifiers that should be read by the R&S TSM when the BCH is demodulated. Different sets of messages may be read from different BCH channels. Once a demodulation is requested, the R&S TSM device tries to serve the command as soon as possible. The demodulation settings can be changed during the measurement using the IssueDemodRequests() method below.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

eMode can have the following values: ONCE, ALL or FAST. eMode determines how often the Scanner will demodulate the Forward Synchronization Channel (F-SYNC) and decode the information elements in the synchronization message. The synchronization message is demodulated at least once per measured frequency. A smaller F-SYNC demodulation rate has no impact on the measurement but can considerably reduce the amount of result data.
rEvdoControlSettings used to set scan attributes for the EVDO channels. Note that these settings only apply if at least one of the channels has its EVDO scanning attribute set to TRUE.
Max speed of the test vehicle to adjust fading channel limitation in the measurement algorithms. rMaxVelocity.dMaxVelocityInKmPerHour gives the maximum expected speed in the test drive.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.summary: Limits The resulting meas rate limits are specified for the SMeasurementRate::dwValuePer1000Sec setting. The maxmimum rating for EVDO is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.GetDemodThresholdLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_CDMA and SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_EVDO
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterface
member.summary: The following functions are specific to the ViComCdma interface, which is used when measuring CDMA2000 signals (including 1xEV-DO).

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.CViComCdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of a CDMA 2000 measurement and holds the message data that shall be decoded.
Unless specified, the default timeout value to use.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration, internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings, all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current R&S TSM settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (specific demodulation requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. To enable or disable BTS related demodulation, this can only be achieved using this method.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetChannelState(System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetChannelState returns the current status of the configurable settings from the channel.
member.param: Specifies the 0-based channel index to be queried.
member.return: an object of SChannelState which contains the current state for the channel. The items in SChannelState can be modified during a running measurement using the ModifyChannel method. SChannelState and ModifyChannel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.ModifyChannel(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.SChannelState!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.AddChannel(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
When set to true, indicates the channel type is EVDO. When set to false, indicates the channel type is CDMA.
member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.
member.param: when adding a CDMA channel and at least one CDMA channel was not configured prior to starting measurements.
when adding an EVDO channel and at least one EVDO channel was not configured prior to starting measurements.

member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. Each frequency has a table of PN Offset Arbitrary Limitation settings attached. The frequency or channel index is 0-based and is referenced in other data. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the Message Identifiers that should be read by the R&S TSM when the BCH is demodulated. Different sets of messages may be read from different BCH channels. Once a demodulation is requested, the R&S TSM device tries to serve the command as soon as possible. The demodulation settings can be changed during the measurement using the IssueDemodRequests() method below.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

eMode can have the following values: ONCE, ALL or FAST. eMode determines how often the Scanner will demodulate the Forward Synchronization Channel (F-SYNC) and decode the information elements in the synchronization message. The synchronization message is demodulated at least once per measured frequency. A smaller F-SYNC demodulation rate has no impact on the measurement but can considerably reduce the amount of result data.
rEvdoControlSettings used to set scan attributes for the EVDO channels. Note that these settings only apply if at least one of the channels has its EVDO scanning attribute set to TRUE.
Max speed of the test vehicle to adjust fading channel limitation in the measurement algorithms. rMaxVelocity.dMaxVelocityInKmPerHour gives the maximum expected speed in the test drive.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.summary: Limits The resulting meas rate limits are specified for the SMeasurementRate::dwValuePer1000Sec setting. The maxmimum rating for EVDO is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetDemodThresholdLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_CDMA and SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_EVDO
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetChannelCountLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.CDMA.ICViComCdmaInterface
member.summary: The following functions are specific to the ViComCdma interface, which is used when measuring CDMA2000 signals (including 1xEV-DO).

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

Use this function to issue commands (specific demodulation requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. To enable or disable BTS related demodulation, this can only be achieved using this method.
@param[in] rDemodRequests When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

Limits The resulting meas rate limits are specified for the SMeasurementRate::dwValuePer1000Sec setting. The maxmimum rating for EVDO is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_CDMA and SDemodulationSettings::lEcToIoThresholdInDB100_for_EVDO
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.
The following functions are specific to the ViComCdma interface, which is used when measuring CDMA2000 signals (including 1xEV-DO). \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.CViComGsmInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the function: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the GSM Network-Scanner may be changed and with the functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface basic settings are changed. All settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the GSM Network-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. @note The result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above shall be used.
member.return: a structure filled with the currently valid values or NULL if the call was not processed successfully.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.CViComGsmInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (demodulation requests, reset commands) for the System Information Type demodulator during measurement. SI Types may be acquired for certain BTSs. Demodulation for BTSs or for channels may be reset. Any SI Type requested here for a specific channel must have been registered for that channel before start of measurement in the SetDemodulationSettings() method, for example with mode SITYPE_DEMOD_ON_CMD.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. Each frequency has a table of PN Offset Arbitrary Limitation settings attached. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and is referenced in other data. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the Message Identifiers that should be read by the R&S TSM when the BCH is demodulated. Different sets of messages may be read from different BCH channels. Once a demodulation is requested, the R&S TSM device tries to serve the command as soon as possible. The demodulation settings can be changed during the measurement is active using the IssueDemodRequests() method below.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure contains one completely decoded L3 System Information Message terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "->CRLF" and terminated by "<-CRLF". For instance, a SI Type 3 will be decoded as follows: member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.summary: Request for the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the System Information.

member.summary: This list gives Info about time slot clusters.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListExecutedMeasSpec
member.summary: This list gives a report of executed measurement detail orders for specific channels.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListPowerResultsOfFailedTrials
member.summary: This list contains measured power values for trials of measurements which would occur in the ListPowerResults if we had enough sensitivity. The power results are not valid power values but the besides some correlation noise it is an upper limit for the received power of the measured signal.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: If a PDU was measured then the pointer to the PDU result for this PDU measurement is valid (!= NULL)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.bLastOfScan
member.summary: If true this measurement is the last of the scan number given in dwScanCount.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.pdwScanCount
member.summary: ScanCount: A scan is a measurement for all channels. The Network Scanner tries to fill a scan as soon as possible before starting to measure channels of another scan. But in the case the PC cannot handle all result, the TSMU is forced to throw away some result. In this case the measurement of this channel is repeated as soon as possible but measurements of different scans can interleave with each other.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListCellIdentResults
member.summary: List of CellIdent measurement results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListSCHInfoResults
member.summary: List of SCH Info measurement results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.ListPowerResults
member.summary: List of Power measurement results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: If available the device time in ns is reported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: The device time of start of the RF measurement which was used to produce the result. The dwPcTimeStampInMs is a conversion of this device time to the PC system time obtained with the GetTickCount() function. The adjustment of possible time drift between device time and GetTickCount() as well as the resolution of GetTickCount() causes a conversion error of a few milliseconds. dwPcTimeStampInMs may be used to synchronize results with other measurement data in the system or to determine the age of the result which is GetTickCount() - dwPcTimeStampInMs;

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDriftResult.bDriftIsOutOfSpec
member.summary: The drift of the measured SCH is out of spec, e.g. the measured drift is far greater than what the spec allows.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDriftResult.fDriftErrorInPpm
member.summary: The estimated error of the fDriftInPpm value. The drift can only be calculated when the SCH has been demodulated. If the latter is not the case, then we may still be able to give a very rough estimate of the drift, for example 2.5ppm with an error of +/-1ppm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDriftResult.fDriftInPpm
member.summary: The drift of the measured SCH in ppm.

member.summary: Indicator: References to an demodulated SCH Measurement (SCHInfo) on the same frequency which is stored in this or an earlier MeasResult.

member.summary: Index of the measured frequency

member.summary: Contains a drift measurement in ppm of a particular SCH.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bEstimatedSlotAlignmentWeak
member.summary: Estimated Slot Alignment Weak: Same a above but also possible slot alignments with smaller likelihood are indicated. Using the same bit coding as above.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bSlotAlignmentFillBit_3
member.summary: used for slot alignment with fill bit before slot 3

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bSlotAlignmentFillBit_2
member.summary: used for slot alignment with fill bit before slot 2

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bSlotAlignmentFillBit_1
member.summary: used for slot alignment with fill bit before slot 1

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bSlotAlignmentFillBit_0
member.summary: used for slot alignment with fill bit before slot 0

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bSlotAlignmentEquidistant
member.summary: Used for equidistant slot alignment. Estimated Slot Alignment: For a downlink channel the slot alignment is either equidistant with a slot length of 156.25 bits or a fill bit is used before each forth slot and the slot length is 156 bits. So there are 5 possibilities for the time slot cluster: equidistant, or fill bit before the first, second, third or forth time slot. The 4 mentioned slots are adjacent and start at dTimeOfFirstSlotInSec and are probably not all measured. The estimation may give more then one of the 5 possibilities if they have the same likelihood. E.g. if only one time slot ist measured or only time slots with equal time slot number, then we have the same probability for all 5 possibilities. For uplink channels the scanner may do an estimation but this should be ignored as the mobiles have other types of slot alignment. The alignments possibilities are coded as bits, see the following constants, and can be used also in combination as noted above.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.wPowerRangeInDB100
member.summary: The time slot power in 0.01dBm for the byte value bPower is: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 bPower) >> 8)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.sMinPowerInDBm100
member.summary: minimum measured time slot power

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.dTimeOfFirstSlotInSec
member.summary: Time Of First Slot: Average time calculated for the first slot in this cluster. Each slot measurement may have a time shift to this time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.bTsc
member.summary: 0..7 or invalid byte (0xff)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.dwFrequencyIndex
member.summary: Index of the measured frequency

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.STimeSlotPowerValuesResult.bSlotDistanceFromPrevTimeSlot
member.summary: Number of time slots this time slot is behind the previous time slot. It should be 0 for the first time slot measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.STimeSlotPowerValuesResult.scTimeShiftIn100ns
member.summary: The max peak is shifted for this time from the average time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.STimeSlotPowerValuesResult.bOffsetToTotalPowerInDB10
member.summary: The total power for this time slot in 0.01dBm is: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 bPower) >> 8) + 10 bOffsetToTotalPowerInDB10

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.STimeSlotPowerValuesResult.bPower
member.summary: The time slot power in 0.01dBm for this byte value bPower uses values from the STimeSlotPowerClusterResult: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 bPower) >> 8)

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.STimeSlotPowerValuesResult
member.summary: Specific values for time slots belonging to the cluster

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult.etTimeSlotType
member.summary: Time Slot Type

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.STimeSlotPowerClusterResult
member.summary: Values for GSM time slot power measurements. Time slot power measurements are done for clusters. In a cluster results from different time slots are used to get results (e.g. the training sequence code) and to collect the results. The time slot measurements of the cluster are in the ListTimeSlotPowerValuesResult.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.pbBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.dwCountOfBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes in the buffer. PowerValueBuffer: For each channel dwCountOfResultsPerChannel are stored. The first power value is taken at dStartTimeInSec. Each value bValue represents a power 0.5 bValue dB above sMinPowerInDBm100.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.dStartTimeInSec
member.summary: Time of the first power values per channel. The power sequences for all channels are taken in the same time interval.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.sMinPowerInDBm100
member.summary: Power value in 0.01dBm to calculate the power over time. See PowerValueBuffer.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.wRMSLengthIn40ns
member.summary: Each power value is averaged over a short time interval given in this value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.wCountOfResultsPerGSMTimeSlot
member.summary: The time distance between adjacent results is always a fraction of a GSM time slot. This value gives the time distance dT/us = 12 625 / (13 wCountOfResultsPerGSMTimeSlot)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.dwCountOfResultsPerChannel
member.summary: Number of result bytes in the power result buffer per channel. It is equal for each channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult.dwCountOfChannels
member.summary: Number of channels we have channel power measurements for. The channels itself can be retrieved from the list of ListPowerExecutedMeasSpec.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SChannelPowerResult
member.summary: Inband power value description for all or a subset of measured channels. The channels itself can be retrieved from the list of ListPowerExecutedMeasSpec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.pbBuffer
member.summary: Pointer to the buffer

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.dwCountOfBytes
member.summary: Number of bytes in the buffer. Power values for all sub spectrum entries. For each sub spectrum the buffer contains wCountOfPowerValuesPerSubSpec power value offsets in 0.5dB from sMinPowerValueInDBm100 lower power limit. The frequency spacing is 200kHz/wCountOfPowerValuesPerChannel within one channel. The channels for which spectrum measurements have been done are listed in structure SExecutedMesurements in the same order as in they occur in the sub spectrum. This order is from low to high frequencies but the channel list may have gaps e.g. channel 1,2,3,7,8. In this case (GSM900) we have a subspectrum from 935.1 .. 935.7MHz and 936.3 .. 936.7MHz. Note that center frequency for each channel index has to be taken from the start command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.sMinPowerValueInDBm100
member.summary: Minimum power value which can be reported in 0.01dBm. It is chosen, that the maximum power (byte Value 255) can be expressed in the possible dynamic range of 128 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wResolutionBandwidthInHz
member.summary: resolution bandwidth of the internal filter

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wTimeBetweenFFTsIn100ns
member.summary: It is an FFT spectrum and the time distance of 2 adjacent FFTs is given. Each FFT may use a longer signal section for filtering.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wCountOfFFTsInLastSubSpectrum
member.summary: this is the count of FFTs we have used in the last sub spectrum

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wCountOfFFTsPerSubSpectrum
member.summary: For each sub spectrum we may use one or more FFTs. This is the number of FFTS in the sub spectrum except the last one which may use less FFTs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wCountOfPowerValuesPerSubSpec
member.summary: Is the count of used channel times the count of power values per channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wCountOfPowerValuesPerChannel
member.summary: Count of power values per channel per spectrum. Count of frequency intervals per channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult.wSubSpectrumCount
member.summary: This is the number of subspectrums stored in this structure.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SSpectrumResult
member.summary: Spectrum for all or a subset of the measured GSM channels. The channels for which spectrum measurements have been done are listed in structure SExecutedMesurements in the same order as in they occur in the sub spectrum.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8 than some tail bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] should be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount
member.summary: count of bits the PDU consists of Bytes of demodulated sequence

member.summary: PDU that has been measured.

member.summary: Frame number of the FCCH in the last used M51 Frame

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.wBCCHAccumulationCount
member.summary: Number of accumulated signals

member.summary: This dwIndicatorOfFirstSCHInfo is the indicator of a previous SCHInfoResult which is related to the current SCHInfoResult. For the GSM network scanner two SCH measurements belong together, if the arrival time does not differ for more than 20 us reflections plus 0.30 ppm time drift and in total not more than 2 GSM Slots (1.15ms).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasResult.SPowerResult.bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10
member.summary: Difference between total inband power during the power measurement to the measured power. If sPowerInDBm100 refers to a code power measurement and reflections as well as measurement impacts due to frequency offsets, phase noise and correlation errors are neglected then the following two relations hold: bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 = 10 (-Ec/I0 in dB) and bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 = 100 log10(1 + 1/(C/I)). The value 255 is defined as an saturation value i.e. when Saturation is reached the measured value of bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 is >= 255. The accuracy of bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 is typically better than 0.5dB for the case that reflections and frequency offsets can be neglected.

member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the GSM-Network-Scanner may be changed and with the functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterfaceData change basic settings. Except of frequency settings all other settings have default values. This structure bundles these settings and will be returned as result from the GetSettings() method.

member.summary: The requests for the general start measurement command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SDemodulationSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SDemodulationSettings.lTotalPowerOffsetInDB10
member.summary: Maximum threshold for demodulation trials in 0.1dB. The scanner monitors BTSs with SCH measurements. Each SCH power measurement has a certain offset to the total GSM inband power during SCH arrival time (e.g. the SCH power is 3 dB below the total inband power). If the magnitude of the offset is higher, the demodulation probability drops. This is the limit for this offset. BTSs measured with a higher total power offset will not be demodulated.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH System Information Type demodulation request, therefore different SITypes can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel SI Types 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SI Types 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SI Type 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (100100 ms) and SI Type 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>SITYPE_3,<sp></sp>ONCE,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(0,<sp></sp>SITYPE_4,<sp></sp>ONCE,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SITYPE_3,<sp></sp>ONCE,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SITYPE_5,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>100,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SITYPE_7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 SI Types demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by dwSCHIndicator 2 and on the the second channel SI Type 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by dwSCHIndicator 3 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (10100ms): (0,<sp></sp>PDU_SITYPE_NULL,<sp></sp>BTS_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>2)(1,<sp></sp>SITYPE_7,<sp></sp>BTS,<sp></sp>10,<sp></sp>3) Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure System Information Type demodulation requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH System Information Type demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SI Type demodulation requests on demand or to reset SI Type demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.BTS_OLD_FORCE
member.summary: Equal to BTS_FORCE but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.BTS_OLD
member.summary: Equal to BTS but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: All demodulation results for each BTS on the specified channel will be deleted and the demodulation for this channel starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.BTS_RESET
member.summary: All demodulation results for a special BTS will be deleted and the demodulation for this BTS starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.BTS_FORCE
member.summary: Equal to BTS but the limitation in receiver resource usage will be ignored and the demodulation will be be done until the PDU has been demodulated or timeout occurred.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: The demodulation is only for a BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the delay time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command requests the demodulation. Only to be used in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method CViComGsmInterface::IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose. PDUs configured with this setting can be decoded using one of BTS, BTS_FORCE, BTS_OLD, BTS_OLD_FORCE modes.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: The PDU is demodulated only once for each BTS. Only to be used in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SMeasurementDetails
member.summary: SMeasurementDetails contains parameters for certain measurement functions and a selection for measurements for a list of individual channels. All channels which are not given in the list will remain with their default setting. If this structure is not used at the start command, the default measurements (SCH Power measurement and SCH demodulation) is done for all channels. By using this structure in the "RedefineMeasurementDetails" function, it is possible to redefine measurements between the start and stop command during measurement. Note that the redefinition will not allow to set a new frequency list but it will refer to the initial frequency list given with the first start command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_REPORT_FAILED_TRIALS
member.summary: Failed SCH meas trials will be reported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_SPECTRUM
member.summary: Spectrum measurement for this channel as defined in SSpectrumSpec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_CHANNEL_POWER
member.summary: This measurement will do the channel power measurement as defined in SChannelPowerSpec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_TSC
member.summary: Trainings Sequence Code Measurement. This is a time slot measurement for normal GSM bursts. It is applicable for up- and downlink.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_DB_POWER
member.summary: Power measurement for dummy bursts. This can produce much more power results for C0 carriers than the SCH measurement. It shall be used for downlink only.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_DB_REMOVAL
member.summary: Detection of dummy bursts and removal of dummy bursts from the GSM signal before further analysis. This can make SCH and TCH measurements significantly more sensitive. It should be used for downlink channels only.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_CARRIER_TO_INTERFERENCE
member.summary: Carrier to Interference measurement. This is only valid for SCH related measurements and downlink. The C/I is measured using an equalizer on the Extended Training Sequence within the SCH.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GSM.SChannelMeasSpec.bMEAS_SCH
member.summary: If a following switch is set then the measurement will be done, else it will be stopped for this channel. SCH related measurements. (SCH, ETS power, BSIC, FN demodulation) Should be used for downlink only.

member.summary: Each sub spectrum is calculated from a few FFTs. The processing will collect a constant number of FFTs to produce a sub spectrum. This number is chosen in a way that the Collection Time will be approximated as good as possible. The result value for each frequency interval after collecting some FFTs is defined by the Time Detector below.

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

Use this function to issue commands (demodulation requests, reset commands) for the System Information Type demodulator during measurement.
SI Types may be acquired for certain BTSs. Demodulation for BTSs or for channels may be reset.
Any SI Type requested here for a specific channel must have been registered for that channel before start of measurement in the SetDemodulationSettings() method, for example with mode SITYPE_DEMOD_ON_CMD.
@param[in] rDemodRequests When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

Limits for Parameter SMeasurementRate::dwValuePer1000Sec.
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::lTotalPowerOffsetInDB10
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.
GSM measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all GSM related measurement tasks. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]
Request for the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the System Information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This list gives Info about time slot clusters.
The drift of the measured SCH is out of spec, e.g. the measured drift is far greater than what the spec allows.

The estimated error of the fDriftInPpm value. The drift can only be calculated when the SCH has been demodulated. If the latter is not the case, then we may still be able to give a very rough estimate of the drift, for example 2.5ppm with an error of +/-1ppm.
The drift of the measured SCH in ppm.
Indicator: References to an demodulated SCH Measurement (SCHInfo) on the same frequency which is stored in this or an earlier MeasResult.
The scanner timestamp when the drift measurement was performed.
Index of the measured frequency
Contains a drift measurement in ppm of a particular SCH. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This list gives Info about time slot clusters.
This list gives the times slot power values of the cluster
Number of time slots this time slot is behind the previous time slot. It should be 0 for the first time slot measurement.
The max peak is shifted for this time from the average time.
The total power for this time slot in 0.01dBm is: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 * bPower) >> 8) + 10 * bOffsetToTotalPowerInDB10
The time slot power in 0.01dBm for this byte value bPower uses values from the STimeSlotPowerClusterResult: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 * bPower) >> 8)
Specific values for time slots belonging to the cluster \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Estimated Slot Alignment Weak: Same a above but also possible slot alignments with smaller likelihood are indicated. Using the same bit coding as above.

Estimated Slot Alignment: For a downlink channel the slot alignment is either equidistant with a slot length of 156.25 bits or a fill bit is used before each forth slot and the slot length is 156 bits. So there are 5 possibilities for the time slot cluster: equidistant, or fill bit before the first, second, third or forth time slot. The 4 mentioned slots are adjacent and start at dTimeOfFirstSlotInSec and are probably not all measured. The estimation may give more then one of the 5 possibilities if they have the same likelihood. E.g. if only one time slot ist measured or only time slots with equal time slot number, then we have the same probability for all 5 possibilities. For uplink channels the scanner may do an estimation but this should be ignored as the mobiles have other types of slot alignment. The alignments possibilities are coded as bits, see the following constants, and can be used also in combination as noted above.
The time slot power in 0.01dBm for the byte value bPower is: sMinPowerInDBm100 + (short)(((dword)wPowerRangeInDB100 * bPower) >> 8)
minimum measured time slot power
Time Of First Slot: Average time calculated for the first slot in this cluster. Each slot measurement may have a time shift to this time.
0..7 or invalid byte (0xff)
Time Slot Type
Index of the measured frequency

Values for GSM time slot power measurements. Time slot power measurements are done for clusters. In a cluster results from different time slots are used to get results (e.g. the training sequence code) and to collect the results. The time slot measurements of the cluster are in the ListTimeSlotPowerValuesResult. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

PowerValueBuffer: For each channel dwCountOfResultsPerChannel are stored. The first power value is taken at dStartTimeInSec. Each value bValue represents a power 0.5 * bValue dB above sMinPowerInDBm100.
Time of the first power values per channel. The power sequences for all channels are taken in the same time interval.
Power value in 0.01dBm to calculate the power over time. See PowerValueBuffer.
Each power value is averaged over a short time interval given in this value.
The time distance between adjacent results is always a fraction of a GSM time slot. This value gives the time distance dT/us = 12 * 625 / (13 * wCountOfResultsPerGSMTimeSlot)
Number of result bytes in the power result buffer per channel. It is equal for each channel.
Number of channels we have channel power measurements for. The channels itself can be retrieved from the list of ListPowerExecutedMeasSpec.
Inband power value description for all or a subset of measured channels. The channels itself can be retrieved from the list of ListPowerExecutedMeasSpec. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Power values for all sub spectrum entries. For each sub spectrum the buffer contains wCountOfPowerValuesPerSubSpec power value offsets in 0.5dB from sMinPowerValueInDBm100 lower power limit. The frequency spacing is 200kHz/wCountOfPowerValuesPerChannel within one channel. The channels for which spectrum measurements have been done are listed in structure SExecutedMesurements in the same order as in they occur in the sub spectrum. This order is from low to high frequencies but the channel list may have gaps e.g. channel 1,2,3,7,8. In this case (GSM900) we have a subspectrum from 935.1 .. 935.7MHz and 936.3 .. 936.7MHz. Note that center frequency for each channel index has to be taken from the start command.
Minimum power value which can be reported in 0.01dBm. It is chosen, that the maximum power (byte Value 255) can be expressed in the possible dynamic range of 128 dB.
resolution bandwidth of the internal filter
It is an FFT spectrum and the time distance of 2 adjacent FFTs is given. Each FFT may use a longer signal section for filtering.
this is the count of FFTs we have used in the last sub spectrum
For each sub spectrum we may use one or more FFTs. This is the number of FFTS in the sub spectrum except the last one which may use less FFTs
Is the count of used channel times the count of power values per channel.
Count of power values per channel per spectrum. Count of frequency intervals per channel.
This is the number of subspectrums stored in this structure.

Spectrum for all or a subset of the measured GSM channels. The channels for which spectrum measurements have been done are listed in structure SExecutedMesurements in the same order as in they occur in the sub spectrum. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This list gives a report of executed measurement detail orders for specific channels.

This list contains measured power values for trials of measurements which would occur in the ListPowerResults if we had enough sensitivity. The power results are not valid power values but the besides some correlation noise it is an upper limit for the received power of the measured signal.
Bytes of demodulated sequence
PDU that has been measured.
Frame number of the FCCH in the last used M51 Frame
Number of accumulated signals
BCCH type
Demodulation status
Indicator: References to an demodulated SCH Measurement (SCHInfo) on the same frequency which is stored in this or an earlier MeasResult.
Index of the measured frequency
Results of BCCH demodulations * \@attribute[type="serializable"]

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.
If true this measurement is the last of the scan number given in dwScanCount.

ScanCount: A scan is a measurement for all channels. The Network Scanner tries to fill a scan as soon as possible before starting to measure channels of another scan. But in the case the PC cannot handle all result, the TSMU is forced to throw away some result. In this case the measurement of this channel is repeated as soon as possible but measurements of different scans can interleave with each other.
List of CellIdent measurement results
Mobile network code: 0..0xfff the hexadecimal output of this number gives the decimal code or any digits > 9 if a wrong number was transmitted
Mobile country code: 0..0xfff the hexadecimal output of this number gives the decimal code or any digits > 9 if a wrong number was transmitted
location area code
cell identity
Indicator: Referenced by SCHInfo measurements.
Index of the measured frequency
Global Cell Identifier from demodulated and decoded ST3 (SYTEM INFORMATION TYPE 3) * \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of SCH Info measurement results
Indicator: If other than SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE it references to a CellIdent measurement on the same frequency which is stored in this or a later MeasResult.
Decoded frame number
Decoded BSIC code

This dwIndicatorOfFirstSCHInfo is the indicator of a previous SCHInfoResult which is related to the current SCHInfoResult. For the GSM network scanner two SCH measurements belong together, if the arrival time does not differ for more than 20 us reflections plus 0.30 ppm time drift and in total not more than 2 GSM Slots (1.15ms).
Indicator: Referenced by SCH power results and CellIdent.
Index of the measured frequency
SCH(Synchronization channel) demodulated BTS info results * \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of Power measurement results
Carrier to Interference in 0.01dB This pointer is NULL if the result contains no C/I value.

Difference between total inband power during the power measurement to the measured power. If sPowerInDBm100 refers to a code power measurement and reflections as well as measurement impacts due to frequency offsets, phase noise and correlation errors are neglected then the following two relations hold: bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 = 10 * (-Ec/I0 in dB) and bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 = 100 * log10(1 + 1/(C/I)). The value 255 is defined as an saturation value i.e. when Saturation is reached the measured value of bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 is >= 255. The accuracy of bTotalPowerOffsetInDB10 is typically better than 0.5dB for the case that reflections and frequency offsets can be neglected.
Indicator: If other than SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE it references to a demodulated SCH Measurement (SCHInfo) on the same frequency which is stored in this or an earlier MeasResult.
Measured power in dBm 100th
Carrier to Interference measurement The C/I is measured using an equalizer on the Extended Training Sequence within the SCH.
SCH power measurement for a BTS which was measured before, but the measurement failed.
SCH power measurement is from active set 2
SCH power measurement is from active set 1
SCH power has been demodulated
SCH power has been measured with the ETS only
Detailed power measurement mode is unknown.
Mode of power measurement
Carrier to Interference measurement The C/I is measured using an equalizer on the Extended Training Sequence within the SCH.
SCH power. Please consider eMeasMode for further information.
Total inband power. Maximum average power for one GSM time slot length. Valid independent from eMeasMode.
Invalid power
Type of power measurement
Index of the measured frequency
SCH(Synchronization channel) power or Total inband power measurement result \@attribute[type="serializable"]
If available the device time in ns is reported.

The device time of start of the RF measurement which was used to produce the result.
The dwPcTimeStampInMs is a conversion of this device time to the PC system time obtained with the GetTickCount() function. The adjustment of possible time drift between device time and GetTickCount() as well as the resolution of GetTickCount() causes a conversion error of a few milliseconds. dwPcTimeStampInMs may be used to synchronize results with other measurement data in the system or to determine the age of the result which is GetTickCount() - dwPcTimeStampInMs;

This structure holds a measurement result from the result buffer. Please refer to the manual for a detailed discussion of how to interpret the results. @note that the result data are for reading only and available until the next interface function is called.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]

By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the GSM-Network-Scanner may be changed and with the functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterfaceData change basic settings. Except of frequency settings all other settings have default values.
This structure bundles these settings and will be returned as result from the GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

Maximum threshold for demodulation trials in 0.1dB. The scanner monitors BTSs with SCH measurements. Each SCH power measurement has a certain offset to the total GSM inband power during SCH arrival time (e.g. the SCH power is 3 dB below the total inband power). If the magnitude of the offset is higher, the demodulation probability drops. This is the limit for this offset. BTSs measured with a higher total power offset will not be demodulated.
This structure is used to configure the BCH System Information Type demodulation process. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH System Information Type demodulation request, therefore different SITypes can be measured on different channels.
Example for start measurement: On the first channel SI Types 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SI Types 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SI Type 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (100*100 ms) and SI Type 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: @code (0, SITYPE_3, ONCE, 0, 0) (0, SITYPE_4, ONCE, 0, 0) (1, SITYPE_3, ONCE, 0, 0) (1, SITYPE_5, REPETITION, 100, 0) (1, SITYPE_7, ON_CMD, 0, 0) @endcode
Example during measurement: On channel 0 SI Types demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by dwSCHIndicator 2 and on the the second channel SI Type 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by dwSCHIndicator 3 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (10*100ms): @code (0, PDU_SITYPE_NULL, BTS_RESET, 0, 2) (1, SITYPE_7, BTS, 10, 3) @endcode
Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0. * \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This structure is used to configure System Information Type demodulation requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH System Information Type demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SI Type demodulation requests on demand or to reset SI Type demodulation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This enumeration defines modes for the demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This enumeration defines the System Information Types which can be demodulated from the BCH. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Each frequency index shall occur only once in this array. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
Number of selected channels. Same as SChannelSettings::dwCount.

SMeasurementDetails contains parameters for certain measurement functions and a selection for measurements for a list of individual channels. All channels which are not given in the list will remain with their default setting. If this structure is not used at the start command, the default measurements (SCH Power measurement and SCH demodulation) is done for all channels.
By using this structure in the "RedefineMeasurementDetails" function, it is possible to redefine measurements between the start and stop command during measurement. Note that the redefinition will not allow to set a new frequency list but it will refer to the initial frequency list given with the first start command. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Failed SCH meas trials will be reported.
Spectrum measurement for this channel as defined in SSpectrumSpec.
This measurement will do the channel power measurement as defined in SChannelPowerSpec.
Trainings Sequence Code Measurement. This is a time slot measurement for normal GSM bursts. It is applicable for up- and downlink.
Power measurement for dummy bursts. This can produce much more power results for C0 carriers than the SCH measurement. It shall be used for downlink only.

Detection of dummy bursts and removal of dummy bursts from the GSM signal before further analysis. This can make SCH and TCH measurements significantly more sensitive. It should be used for downlink channels only.
Carrier to Interference measurement. This is only valid for SCH related measurements and downlink. The C/I is measured using an equalizer on the Extended Training Sequence within the SCH.

If a following switch is set then the measurement will be done, else it will be stopped for this channel.
SCH related measurements. (SCH, ETS power, BSIC, FN demodulation) Should be used for downlink only.
Frequency index for the new measurement set.
SChannelMeasSpec defines a new set of measurements for a channel (as given by frequency index). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The time distance between adjacent results is always a fraction of a GSM time slot. This value gives the time distance dT/us = 12 * 625 / (13 * wCountOfResultsPerGSMTimeSlot)
the power is averaged over a time interval given in this value
SChannelPowerSpec contains a definition of the channel power graph which applies for all channels with channel power measurement enabled. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Time detector mode.
Choice of detector mode in the time domain. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Frequency detector mode.
Choice of detector mode in the frequency domain. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Each sub spectrum is calculated from a few FFTs. The processing will collect a constant number of FFTs to produce a sub spectrum. This number is chosen in a way that the Collection Time will be approximated as good as possible. The result value for each frequency interval after collecting some FFTs is defined by the Time Detector below.
Each GSM channel of 200kHz bandwidth will be divided in wCountOfPowerValues per Channel frequency intervals of equal length. Minimum should be 1 and maximum is 100.
SSpectrumSpec contains a definition of channel spectrum measurements which applies for all channels with spectrum measurement enabled. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The maximum number of used GSM scanner instances. Possible value range: 1...32.
The maximum detectable drift range is +/-fMaxDetectableDriftInPpm. Possible value range: 0...8.

Pointer to an array containing the settings of the selected frequencies. The number of members in the array is defined by dwCount (above).
\@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
The desired measurement rate value. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits(). The limits are dependent from the currently set eMeasurementMode.
Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits(). *
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in Hz. The selection of new frequencies (with SetConfiguration) automatically resets the demodulation requests. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Center frequency of the channel
Frequency settings \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom GSM interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.DisableMarkerSignal
member.summary: Disables any previously enabled Marker signal activated either by EnableMarkerSignal() or EnablePpsMarkerSignal().

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.EnablePpsMarkerSignal
member.summary: Once enabled uses TSME/6 AUX2 port to output a marker signal with the following properties: Pulse frequency 1 Hz, 50% duty cycle, starting with a rising edge synchronised to the internal PPS signal of the recevier. The first found receiver will be used to output the marker signal. The EnableMarkerSignal() and EnablePpsMarkerSignal() are to be used mutually exclusive.
member.param: reserved, ignored for now. The first found receiver will be used to output the marker signal.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.EnableMarkerSignal(System.UInt64,System.Double,System.Byte)
member.summary: Once enabled uses a TSME/6 AUX port to output a marker signal with the following properties: Pulse frequency 1/dPulsePeriodInS Hz, 50% duty cycle, starting with a rising edge at the given receiver timestamp. The first found receiver will be used to output the marker signal. The EnableMarkerSignal() and EnablePpsMarkerSignal() functions are to be used mutually exclusive.
member.param: start time for the marker signal with respect to the receiver clock. If the given time is in the past the marker will be started immediately to an arbitrary time.
pulse period of the marker signal in seconds.
number of the AUX port to be used for the maker signal. Possible values: 2 and 4.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: Using the methods SetConfiguration()the internal settings of the measurement device are changed. This function reads the current configuration from the internal software and returns all those settings for read-only access. All settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the Channel Power Receiver settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. @note The result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above shall be used.
member.return: a structure filled with the currently valid values or NULL if the call was not processed successfully.

member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the number of channels and the table of frequencies. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. the measurement result.
member.param: Contains the channel configuration that shall be measured. The configuration consists of a set frequency and bandwidths.

member.summary: Returns reference to basic interface object implementation. The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.CViComBlockIqInterface
member.summary: Interface to perform IQ data measurements. Channel power measurements do not perform any RAT specific measurements like demodulation or others. In this way they can easily be adopted to new technologies and can be used to perform the first, generic measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.BLOCKIQ.SSettings
member.summary: This structure contains all the currently active settings stored in the ViComCWScan interface, which are used to actually perform the measurement. All the content has either been set by related Set methods of the CViComCWScanInterface, or they are still in their default values. @note The values in this structures cannot be changed, they are read-only. Even if they are modified after the structure is requested by the GetSettings() method, the changes will not be reflected in the internal settings.
