members.member: Disables any previously enabled Marker signal activated either by EnableMarkerSignal() or EnablePpsMarkerSignal().

Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

SChannelSettings contains the number of channels and the table of frequencies. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. the measurement result.
@param[in] rChannelSettings Contains the channel configuration that shall be measured. The configuration consists of a set frequency and bandwidths.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwBandwidthInHz
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwSampleRateInHz
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwMeasRatePer1000Sec
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Interface to perform IQ data measurements.
Channel power measurements do not perform any RAT specific measurements like demodulation or others. In this way they can easily be adopted to new technologies and can be used to perform the first, generic measurements. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]
Measurement rate for all channels.
Actual iq data if pIqData is not NULL.
Actual buffer for dwCountOfSamples iq samples. Use dIqGainInDB for conversion to RF signal power in dBm. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfSamples" sizeismember="true"]
Number of elements in pfTransferFunction if pIqSamples is not NULL.
Gain applied to the IQ samples. RF signal power in dBm = 10 * log10( re^2 + im^2 ) - dIqGainInDB.
The actual sampling rate used for acquisition of iq values might differ a little bit from the specification in SChannelSettings::dwSampleRateInHz.
This is true if any of the IQ samples hit by an ADC overflow. *

The time when the signal was started to being measured on the device, with a higher resolution than the default PC clock. E.g. device time of the first IQ sample. This time is relative to the last restart of the device.
Container for iq data. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Actual filter response used for acquisition of iq samples if pFilterResponse is not NULL. Only provided with the very first measurement result (SMeasResult).
Actual buffer for dwCountOfSamples filter values in frequency domain. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfSamples" sizeismember="true"]
Number of elements in pfTransferFunction if pfTransferFunction is not NULL.
If true filter values are priodic, e.g. value[k] = value[k + dwCountOfValues].
Spacing of the frequency grid, e.g. frequency resolution.
Container for filter response functions. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The CWScan measurement result returned by CViComCWScanInterface::GetResult(). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The measurement rate. For default value and range see CViComIqInterface::GetMeasRateLimits().
Number of iq samples per measurement block.
Data format of the iq samples.
Definition of data formats for IQ samples. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Measurement bandwidth in Hz.
Sample rate in Hz. The default is to use a oversampling factor of 1.15, e.g. SampleRateInHz = 1.15 * BandwidthInHz;
Channel center frequency in Hz.
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Iq tasks are not allowed to use multiple FE's.
This structure contains paramters to specify the block of iq data which shall be measured. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom BLOCKIQ interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an WiMax measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
Unless specified, the default timeout value to use.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: Configuration() and SetMeasurementMode() internal settings of the WiMAX Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the WiMAX Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. PDUs may be acquired for certain BTS. PDU demodulation for BTS or for channels may be reset.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodulationSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: CViComWcdmaInterfaceData::SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. BCH demodulation settings. The selection of new frequencies causes default settings for the BCH demodulation. Use this function to set the general BCH demodulation properties. Different sets of PDUs may be read from different BCH channels.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.CViComWimaxInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv.szValue
member.summary: NULL-terminated string describing the value contents.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv.pValue
member.summary: pValue is a pointer to the value contents. It normally points to an array of bytes. There are several exceptions:-For DCD/UCD PDU, if the type of the TLV is Downlink/Uplink Burst Profile (bType == 1), pValue actually points to the above SDownlinkBurstProfile/SUplinkBurstProfile structure. The user needs a cast to the appropriate structure type. -If the value part of the TLV is not a "simple" value in the L3 decode tree, i.e. It contains sub-fields (This can be examined through the pcStringPDU string), Then this pValue will be NULL and szValue will contain the text description of the value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv.szType
member.summary: NULL-terminated string describing the type.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv.SUplinkBurstProfile
member.summary: Uplink Burst Profile is special because it contains an embedded TLV.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv.SDownlinkBurstProfile
member.summary: Downlink Burst Profile is special because it contains an embedded TLV.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult.STlv
member.summary: This struct holds a TLV entry. The maximum length can be represented is 4294967295 (0xFFFFFFFF), which is large enough for practical cases.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is indented text describing the contents of one completely decoded PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If m_dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest.dwFlags
member.summary: Flags for additional information about the PDU contained.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated,. etMacManagementPDU.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. It is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure. The values from SDemodResult are normally used for input data.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.pDlfp
member.summary: This is NULL if no DLFP information is available.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: PC local time when the signal was measured (or was started to being measured) on the device.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: The channel to which all the data relates is specified using this index. The index refers to the position in the SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting array.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.u64ArrivalTimeInNs
member.summary: Start time of the radio frame which contained the MAC Management PDU. If the PDU was assembled from multiple fragments, it's the arrival time of the first radio frame. Concatenated PDUs are provided with the same arrival time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwFlags
member.summary: Flags for additional information about the PDU contained. The flags depend on the technology.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwPDU_FLAG_NO_HEADER
member.summary: The PDU has no header, i.e. it is only payload. E.g. WIMAX MAC Management Message Payload.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwPDU_FLAG_MSG_FRAGMENT
member.summary: The PDU contains a fragment of a message, e.g. fragment of a WIMWAX DCD or UCD message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwPDU_FLAG_SHORT_HEADER
member.summary: The message uses a special short headers, e.g. GSM RR Short Header Messages.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwPDU_FLAG_COMPRESSED
member.summary: The PDU contains compressed DL/UL-MAPs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwPDU_FLAG_NOT_SET
member.summary: Flags constants. "Normal" PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated,. etMacManagementPDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwOperatorID
member.summary: Operator ID. Most significant 3 bytes of the Base Station ID. In case of a compressed DL-MAP, only the least significant byte of this 3 byte Operator ID is filled in.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.bSectorID
member.summary: Sector ID. Least significant byte of Base Station ID.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.barBaseStationID
member.summary: Base Station ID. 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF if unknown. The Base Station ID (BS ID) is a 48-bit (i.e 6 byte) long field identifying the BS. The barBaseStationID array is filled beginning with the most significant byte at index 0 down to the least significant byte at index 5. Example: BS ID = 0x010203040506 barBaseStationID[0] = 0x01 barBaseStationID[1] = 0x02 barBaseStationID[2] = 0x03 barBaseStationID[3] = 0x04 barBaseStationID[4] = 0x05 barBaseStationID[5] = 0x06 This leads to bSectorID = 0x06 in case of an uncompressed DL-MAP dwOperatorID = 0x00010203 and in case of a compressed MAP dwOperatorID = 0x00000003

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.bSegment
member.summary: Segment number (0, 1 2). 0xFF if invalid.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.bPreambleIndex
member.summary: Preamble index, value 0 - 131. 0xFFFF if invalid.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the demodulator. Each time the demodulator is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known BTS, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same BTS could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single BTS.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwTimeStampInMs
member.summary: The time stamp of the PDU result retrieval.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: The channel index from which channel the PDU result is retrieved.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDemodResult
member.summary: BCH demodulator results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDlfp.bDlmapLength
member.summary: Length of the DL-MAP in bytes.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDlfp.bDlmapCoding
member.summary: Indicates the FEC encoding code used for the DL-MAP in case of OFDMA DL Frame. Prefix format for all FFT sizes except 128

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDlfp.bRepetitionCoding
member.summary: Indicates the repetition code used for the DL-MAP.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDlfp.bSubchannelGroups
member.summary: Sub-channel group. Bitmask identifying the subchannel groups present. Bit0 for group 0 .... Bit5 for group 5. Default 0

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SDlfp
member.summary: Downlink Frame Prefix.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.ListOfPeaks
member.summary: List of CIR peaks found in the signal.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.pPowerDelayProfile
member.summary: Optional power profile measurement further detailing the CIR measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: Time when the first CIR sample has been measured, related to the device internal clock.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: Calculated time of the first CIR sample based on start of the.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPeak.fDelayInSec
member.summary: Delay in seconds related to the first sample. This normally provides a higher resolution than the sampling time from the power delay measurement results (see above).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPeak.sDopplerInHz
member.summary: Main part of a Doppler frequency. Is not necessarily available and may be set to SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPeak.fPeakPowerInDBm
member.summary: The actual power of the impulse peak.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPeak.fInbandPowerInDBm
member.summary: Inband power of the signal from which the CIR was extracted.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPeak
member.summary: Contains information about the single peaks in the Channel Impulse Response.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.fSamplingTimeInSec
member.summary: Sampling time for a CIR measurement. This is also the time between two CIR measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.fNoiseFloorInDBm
member.summary: Estimated noise level. Power values which are in the vicinity of this value can be considered to be caused or influenced by noise.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.dCINR
member.summary: Signal to interference and noise ratio of the preamble of the Wimax basestation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.fAggregatePowerInDBm
member.summary: Power of the preamble of a certain Wimax cell, characterized by it's Cell ID and Segment ID. It excludes noise and interference.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.fInbandPowerInDBm
member.summary: Total power, including noise and interference, measured at the same time and frequency as the preamble.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.SPowerDelayProfileValues.psValuesInDBm100
member.summary: Array that holds dwCountOfValues elements, each specifying a power delay value in 100th dBm (e.g. a value of -6719 is to be read as -67.19 dBm). Can be SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE when a value could not be measured

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.SPowerDelayProfileValues.dwCountOfValues
member.summary: number of elements available in the psValuesInDBm100 array

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.SPowerDelayProfileValues
member.summary: A (possibly empty) set of power delay values. This list contains the CIR power values, where each power value has been measured fSamplingTimeInSec seconds after the previous one. The first sample in here has been measured at u64DeviceTimeInNs resp. dwPcTimeStampInMs. The list may contain invalid values, which denote that at that specific time there was no CIR measurement possible.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile
member.summary: Structure containing the actual CIR measurement results combined with delay information.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SCir
member.summary: Optional data container that holds information about the channel impulse responses measured in this cycle. The CIR consists of an optional power delay profile, and a list of peaks. Channel impulse responses are calculated from a 100ms block.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult.SSegmentMeas
member.summary: Segment measurement results.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SMeasResult
member.summary: The WiMax measurement result for a single channel returned by GetResult().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SSettings.DemodulationSettings
member.summary: Configuration of the BCH demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SSettings.ChannelSettings
member.summary: The set of frequencies that shall be measured.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SSettings.dwReceiverIndex
member.summary: Index to SConnectedReceiverTable::Receiver of the currently selected receiver.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SSettings
member.summary: This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom WiMax scanner module. It is a result of the GetSettings() method.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodulationSettings.sStartMeasurementRequests
member.summary: The requests for the general start measurement command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodulationSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodulationSettings.sCINRThresholdInDB100
member.summary: CINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dB. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodulationSettings
member.summary: This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.pDemodRequests
member.summary: Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be NULL, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.dwCountOfRequests
member.summary: Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the demodulator. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwRepetitionTimeOutInMs
member.summary: Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.eDemodulationMode
member.summary: The mode used for BCH demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.ePDU
member.summary: The PDU to be demodulated.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel DL-MAP shall be decoded, on the the second channel UL-MAP and DCD shall be decoded. UL-MAP shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and DCD shall be decoded on demand. This requires three structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>DL_MAP,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>0,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>UL_MAP,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>10000,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>DCD,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>0,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel DL-MAP shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): (0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>CHANNEL_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>3)(1,<sp></sp>DL_MAP,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>1000,<sp></sp>4) Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU only for a specific BTS. The BTS is specified in the S_PDU_Request::dwBtsId field. This demodulation mode is only valid during a running measurement (i.e. on demand).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. This is only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command for demodulation requests the demodulation. Only to be used in start measurement. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. This is only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.MOB_PAG_ADV
member.summary: Decode MOB_PAG-ADV.

member.summary: Decode MOB_BSHO-RSP.

member.summary: Decode MOB_BSHO-REQ.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.MOB_NBR_ADV
member.summary: Decode MOB_NBR-ADV.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.REG_RSP
member.summary: Decode REG-RSP.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.RNG_RSP
member.summary: Decode RNG-RSP.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.UL_MAP
member.summary: Decode UL-MAP.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.DL_MAP
member.summary: Decode DL-MAP.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.DCD
member.summary: Decode DCD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu.Type.UCD
member.summary: Decode UCD.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.Pdu
member.summary: BCH demodulation This enumeration defines the MAC Management PDU types. Use this in the S_PDU_Request structure to specify which PDUs inside the MAC Management message shall be decoded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SChannelSettings.pTableOfFrequencySetting
member.summary: This array of structures can be filled with single frequency configurations. Only dwCount entries from this table will actually be used.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SChannelSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SChannelSettings.dwCount
member.summary: Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.dwTraceMeasPer1000Sec
member.summary: As soon as a signal was found for a certain BS, then it is traced with the given rate. This will appear as a measurement rate for the scanner. For one measurement we need the receiver for about (5 + 32 1000 / SMeasResult::dwFrameRateInHz) milliseconds. E.g. for 50Hz frame rate we need 645ms. So we can measure this channel with not more than 1500mHz (1.5 measurements per second) if we have full receiver capacity for this channel. So a maximum MeasRate for the trace measurement can be achieved when the WiMAX Frame Rate is 500Hz. Then we can get 14.5Hz (dwTraceMeasPer1000Sec = 14500) in case that the receiver time used for synchronization is neglected. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.dwSyncTrialsPer1000Sec
member.summary: Rate to perform a sync regarding the given constrains. The unit is per 1000 seconds. For one measurement, we need the receiver for about (5 + 2000 / dwFrameRateRangeMinInHz) milliseconds. This is the measurement rate used for sync scanning. The resources used for sync scanning cannot be used for measurement scanning. If we measure a network that doesn't change, this rate could be very low. If we expect changes in the network, we have to set this value to an appropriate higher value. dwSyncTrialsPer1000Sec = 1000 means, one sync trial per second, which is high enough for a drive test.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.dwOptSyncTrialsPer1000Sec
member.summary: Normal rate for 'dwSyncTrialsPer1000Sec', i.e. 1/sec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.dFrameDelayToPpsInSec
member.summary: Delay of the first WiMAX frame after an PPS. It is only used if bGpsPpsSync is TRUE.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.bUseForRecSync
member.summary: TRUE if the measurement results of this channel shall be used for synchronization of the receiver. If FALSE then the measurement results on this channel are ignored for the receiver sync.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WIMAX.SFrequencySetting.bGpsPpsSync
member.summary: TRUE if all signals on the channel are assumed synchronized to the PPS of the GPS.

member.summary: Maximum frame repetition rate in Hertz.

member.summary: Minimum frame repetition rate in Hertz.

member.summary: FFT Size mask matching different FFT Size. At least one bit shall be set.

member.summary: The nominal bandwidth in Hz.

member.summary: Maximum possible nominal bandwidth (inclusive).

member.summary: Minimum possible nominal bandwidth (inclusive).

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

By means of the functions: Configuration() and SetMeasurementMode() internal settings of the WiMAX Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the WiMAX Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
@return pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sCINRThresholdInDB100
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SFrequencySettings::dwTraceMeasPer1000Sec
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.
WiMax measurement module for ViCom. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]

Mode 0b000: HO request 0b001: MDHO/FBSS request: Anchor BS update with CID update 0b010: MDHO/FBSS request: Anchor BS update without CID update 0b011: MDHO/FBSS request: Diversity set update with CID update 0b100: MDHO/FBSS request: Diversity set update without CID update 0b101: MDHO/FBSS request: Diversity set update with CID update for newly added BS 0b110: MDHO/FBSS request: Diversity set update with CID update and CQICH allocation for newly added BS 0b111: Reserved
struct SRecommended ... SCurrentBS are elements of members of union UBSHO. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]

UIUC. [8.4.5.4.1 UIUC allocation] in WiMAX spec. 0 Fast-feedback channel 110 Different burst profiles (Data Grant Burst Type) 11 Extended UIUC 2 IE 12 CDMA BR, CDMA ranging 13 PAPR reduction allocation, safety zone, Sounding Zone 14 CDMA Allocation IE 15 Extended UIUC @note Only CDMA BR, CDMA ranging IEs (for UIUC equals to 12) are currently supported.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
Repetition Coding Indication. 0b00: No repetition coding 0b01: Repetition coding of 2 used 0b10: Repetition coding of 4 used 0b11: Repetition coding of 6 used
\@attribute[type="serializable"]

DIUC. [8.4.5.3.1 DIUC allocation] in WiMAX spec. 012 Different burst profiles 13 Gap/PAPR reduction 14 Extended-2 DIUC IE 15 Extended DIUC @note, Only burst profiles IEs (for DIUC between 0 and 12) are currently supported.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]

@note Please refer to spec 802.16-2009: 8.4.5.2 Frame duration codes. Frame duration code: 0b0000 = Reserved 0b0001 = 2.0 ms 0b0010 = 2.5 ms 0b0011 = 4 ms 0b0100 = 5 ms 0b0101 = 8 ms 0b0110 = 10 ms 0b0111 = 12.5 ms 0b1000 = 20 ms 0b1001 - 0b1111= Reserved
Operator ID. Most significant 3 bytes of the Base Station ID. In case of a compressed DL-MAP, only the least significant byte of this 3 byte Operator ID is filled in.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
Uplink Burst Profile is special because it contains an embedded TLV. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Downlink Burst Profile is special because it contains an embedded TLV. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Pointer to a buffer containing the decoded PDU text, as zero terminated ASCII string. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwStringLength" sizeismember="true"]
Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is indented text describing the contents of one completely decoded PDU. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. It is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure. The values from SDemodResult are normally used for input data. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.
Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.

Start time of the radio frame which contained the MAC Management PDU. If the PDU was assembled from multiple fragments, it's the arrival time of the first radio frame. Concatenated PDUs are provided with the same arrival time.

Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored. \@attribute[type="bitfield" size="dwBitCount" sizeismember="true"]
Flags for additional information about the PDU contained. The flags depend on the technology.
Operator ID. Most significant 3 bytes of the Base Station ID. In case of a compressed DL-MAP, only the least significant byte of this 3 byte Operator ID is filled in.

Base Station ID. 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF if unknown. The Base Station ID (BS ID) is a 48-bit (i.e 6 byte) long field identifying the BS. The barBaseStationID array is filled beginning with the most significant byte at index 0 down to the least significant byte at index 5. Example: BS ID = 0x010203040506 barBaseStationID[0] = 0x01 barBaseStationID[1] = 0x02 barBaseStationID[2] = 0x03 barBaseStationID[3] = 0x04 barBaseStationID[4] = 0x05 barBaseStationID[5] = 0x06 This leads to bSectorID = 0x06 in case of an uncompressed DL-MAP dwOperatorID = 0x00010203 and in case of a compressed MAP dwOperatorID = 0x00000003

Unique BTS ID provided by the demodulator. Each time the demodulator is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known BTS, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same BTS could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single BTS.
BCH demodulator results \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Indicates the FEC encoding code used for the DL-MAP in case of OFDMA DL Frame. Prefix format for all FFT sizes except 128
Sub-channel group. Bitmask identifying the subchannel groups present. Bit0 for group 0 .... Bit5 for group 5. Default 0
Downlink Frame Prefix. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Contains information about the single peaks in the Channel Impulse Response. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Array that holds dwCountOfValues elements, each specifying a power delay value in 100th dBm (e.g. a value of -6719 is to be read as -67.19 dBm). Can be SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE when a value could not be measured \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfValues" sizeismember="true"]

A (possibly empty) set of power delay values. This list contains the CIR power values, where each power value has been measured fSamplingTimeInSec seconds after the previous one. The first sample in here has been measured at u64DeviceTimeInNs resp. dwPcTimeStampInMs.
The list may contain invalid values, which denote that at that specific time there was no CIR measurement possible. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Estimated noise level. Power values which are in the vicinity of this value can be considered to be caused or influenced by noise.
Structure containing the actual CIR measurement results combined with delay information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Optional data container that holds information about the channel impulse responses measured in this cycle. The CIR consists of an optional power delay profile, and a list of peaks.
Channel impulse responses are calculated from a 100ms block. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Segment measurement results. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The channel to which all the data relates is specified using this index. The index refers to the position in the SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting array.
The WiMax measurement result for a single channel returned by GetResult(). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom WiMax scanner module. It is a result of the GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
CINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dB. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().
This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be NULL, if no demodulation shall be done. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfRequests" sizeismember="true"]
Unique BTS ID provided by the demodulator. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.
Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).
The mode used for BCH demodulation.
The PDU to be demodulated.
Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting.

There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels.
Example for start measurement: On the first channel DL-MAP shall be decoded, on the the second channel UL-MAP and DCD shall be decoded. UL-MAP shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and DCD shall be decoded on demand. This requires three structures containing the following parameter sets: @code (0, DL_MAP, 0, 0, 0) (1, UL_MAP, REPETITION, 10000, 0) (1, DCD, ON_CMD, 0, 0) @endcode Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel DL-MAP shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): @code (0, 0, CHANNEL_RESET, 0, 3) (1, DL_MAP, ON_CMD, 1000, 4) @endcode Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0. * \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This enumeration defines modes for the BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

BCH demodulation * This enumeration defines the MAC Management PDU types. Use this in the S_PDU_Request structure to specify which PDUs inside the MAC Management message shall be decoded. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This array of structures can be filled with single frequency configurations. Only dwCount entries from this table will actually be used. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits().
\@attribute[type="serializable"]

As soon as a signal was found for a certain BS, then it is traced with the given rate. This will appear as a measurement rate for the scanner. For one measurement we need the receiver for about (5 + 32 * 1000 / SMeasResult::dwFrameRateInHz) milliseconds. E.g. for 50Hz frame rate we need 645ms. So we can measure this channel with not more than 1500mHz (1.5 measurements per second) if we have full receiver capacity for this channel. So a maximum MeasRate for the trace measurement can be achieved when the WiMAX Frame Rate is 500Hz. Then we can get 14.5Hz (dwTraceMeasPer1000Sec = 14500) in case that the receiver time used for synchronization is neglected. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits().

Rate to perform a sync regarding the given constrains. The unit is per 1000 seconds. For one measurement, we need the receiver for about (5 + 2000 / dwFrameRateRangeMinInHz) milliseconds. This is the measurement rate used for sync scanning. The resources used for sync scanning cannot be used for measurement scanning. If we measure a network that doesn't change, this rate could be very low. If we expect changes in the network, we have to set this value to an appropriate higher value. dwSyncTrialsPer1000Sec = 1000 means, one sync trial per second, which is high enough for a drive test.
Delay of the first WiMAX frame after an PPS. It is only used if bGpsPpsSync is TRUE.
TRUE if the measurement results of this channel shall be used for synchronization of the receiver. If FALSE then the measurement results on this channel are ignored for the receiver sync.
TRUE if all signals on the channel are assumed synchronized to the PPS of the GPS.
Maximum frame repetition rate in Hertz.
Minimum frame repetition rate in Hertz.
Possible Frame Rates.
The corresponding Ratios of Cyclic Prefix to useful symbol time. At least one bit shall be set.
Possible CP Ration Masks.
FFT Size mask matching different FFT Size. At least one bit shall be set.
Possible FFT Size Masks.
The nominal bandwidth in Hz.
The center frequency of the channel in Hz.
Configuration of the measurement that is performed on one single frequency. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data container for ViCom WiMax interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.summary: Function to send a command to the GPS receiver. The command is forwarded without any validity check. Any error message from the GPS receiver will be available through the GetResult command. The function uses the same structure as GetResult. The timestamp parameters are not used.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ICViComGpsInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: Returns reference to basic interface object implementation. The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.GnssMode.Type.ALL_SUPPORTED
member.summary: Use as many GNSS systems as supported by the connected receiver. For the most recent versions of R&S TSME6 this includes GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO and BEIDOU as well as augmentation systems (SBAS, QZSS).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.GnssMode.Type.GPS_BEIDOU
member.summary: GPS and BEIDOU. Supported on R&S TSME6 only.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.GnssMode.Type.GPS_GLONASS_GALILEO
member.summary: GPS, GLONASS and GALILEO including augmentation systems (SBAS). Supported on R&S TSME6 only.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.GnssMode.Type.GPS
member.summary: GPS system, supported on R&S TSMW, R&S TSME and R&S TSME6.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.GnssMode
member.summary: Definition of the receiver GNSS modes.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ResetMode.Type.COLDSTART
member.summary: Coldstart (all GNSS information is reset).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ResetMode.Type.WARMSTART
member.summary: Warmstart (only Ephemeris is reset).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ResetMode.Type.HOTSTART
member.summary: Hotstart (all GNSS data is preserved).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ResetMode.Type.NONE
member.summary: No reset.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.GPS.ResetMode
member.summary: Definition of the GPS receiver reset modes.

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.
Function to trigger the GPS receiver to send binary almanac and ephemeris data within the next couple of measurement results, see SMeasResult::SGnssAiding.

Function to send a command to the GPS receiver. The command is forwarded without any validity check. Any error message from the GPS receiver will be available through the GetResult command. The function uses the same structure as GetResult. The timestamp parameters are not used.
@param[in] rMessage The message to be forwarded to the GPS receiver. The timestamp information will not be used.

Returns the settings which apply at the moment.
@return pointer to a structure holding the current configuration. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.
Description of the functions in CViComGpsInterface. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSMX_PPS2,TSME"]
Gnss aiding information.
Dead reckoning information.
Information about the GPS receiver.
Accuracy statistics and information about the position fix.
Velocity information.
List of information about visible satellites.
Position information in WGS84 representation. Only valid with according fix, please see SStatistics::enPositionFix.
List of raw messages contributing to the meas result. \@attribute[filterable="true"]
PC local time when the data has been processed on the computer.
GPS result returned by CViComGpsInterface::GetResult(). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The actual set Ephemeris data for each available satellite vehicle. \@attribute[filterable="true"]
Ephemeris words (3...10, 24 bits of data) for sub frame 3. Only available if dwHandover > 0 and pSubFrame3 is not NULL. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfSubFrame3Elements" sizeismember="true"]
Number of elements available in the pSubFrame3 array.
Ephemeris words (3...10, 24 bits of data) for sub frame 2. Only available if dwHandover > 0 and pSubFrame2 is not NULL. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfSubFrame2Elements" sizeismember="true"]
Number of elements available in the pSubFrame2 array.
Ephemeris words (3...10, 24 bits of data) for sub frame 1. Only available if dwHandover > 0 and pSubFrame1 is not NULL. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfSubFrame1Elements" sizeismember="true"]
Number of elements available in the pSubFrame1 array.
Hand over word of first subframe.
Satellite ID.
Container for Ephemeris related information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The actual set Alamanc data for each available satellite vehicle. \@attribute[filterable="true"]
Almanac words (24 bits of data). Only valid if dwWeekNumber > 0 and pAlmanac is not NULL.
Number of elements available in the pAlmanac array.
Issue date of Almanac (GNSS week number).
Satellite ID.
Container for Almanac related information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Container for GNSS aiding related information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The actual set of sensor measurement data. \@attribute[filterable="true"]

Measurement unit for various sensor types: SensorType::Type::SINGLE_WHEEL_TICK: integer number SensorType::Type::Z_AXIS_GYRO: deg/s SensorType::Type::TEMPERATURE: deg Ceclcius SensorType::Type::DIRECTION: true = backwards / false = forwards
Sensor fault status if not NULL.
Definition of the sensor fault status values.
Sensor time status if not NULL.
Sensor calibration status if not NULL.
Definition of the calibration status values.
Sensor is used if this value is set to true.
Definition of the sensor type values.
Container for sensor related information if enDeadReckoningState is not DeadReckoningState::DISABLED or DeadReckoningState::UNKNOWN. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Sensor fusion status if not NULL.
Definition of the sensor fusion status values.
Container for dead reckoning related information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Number of satellites used for position fix.
Type of the current position fix.
3D speed accuracy estimate in meter per second.
3D position accuracy estimate in meter.
2D position accuracy estimate in meter.
Position dilution of precision.
Vertical dilution of precision.
Horizontal dilution of precision.
Container for accuracy statistics and information about the position fix. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Speed in meter per second (3D).
Heading of motion in degree (2D).
Ground speed in meter per second.
Container for velocity information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Signal quality indicator, e.g. Carrier to Noise ratio C/N0 in dB-Hz. Range: 0...99
Satellite ID.
Global navigation satellite system type.
Container for satellite information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Antenna status.
Antenna power status.
Container for receiver information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the antenna power state values. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the antenna state values. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the position fix types. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Calendar date and time of WGS84 datum in UTC. Only valid if bTimeValid equals true.
Validity flag for UTC time parameter dTime as well dateAndTimeInUtc.
Leap seconds, e.g. time difference of GNSS time and UTC time. GNSS time is ahead of UTC.
Timestamp of WGS84 datum in seconds since midnight (GNSS time).
Timestamp of WGS84 datum in seconds since midnight (UTC time).
Altitude in WGS84 datum in meters above sea level. Limits [-1000, 20000].
Longitude in WGS84 datum; positive values: East, negative values: West. Limits [-180, 180].
Latitude in WGS84 datum; positive values: North, negative values: South. Limits [-90, 90].
Container for positions on the earth in Geo WGS84 representation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Time in seconds since the Epoch (00:00:00 UTC, January 1st, 1970) also known as Unix time. Only valid if not set to -1.
Second of the current minute.
Minute of the current hour.
Hour of the current day.
Current day.
Current month.
Current year.
Container for date and UTC time information. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Array of byte with the message content (either ASCII for NMEA or binary for UBLOX format). If the message shall be treated as text please add the null termination character.
Length of the message in bytes, i.e. length of the pbmessageText array if pbmessageText is not NULL.
GPS message format (protocol type).
Timestamp in ms of the host.
Container for messages from / to the GPS device. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This structure holds the measurement setup that is configured for the connected GPS module. It is a result of the CViComGpsInterface::GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Dead reckoning configuration.
Reset mode which is applied to the GPS receiver on CViComBasicInteface::StartMeasurement().
GPS message format (protocol type). Decoding of GPS messages is not supported for NMEA protocol!
Configuration of the GPS device. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
When set the stored calibration data gets cleared upon start of measurement.
When set the temperature compensation table gets cleared upon start of measurement.
Gyro rotation sense.
Definition of gyro rotation sense modes. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Direction pin polarity.
State of dead reckoning processing.
Definition of the dead reckoning modes. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the receiver GNSS modes. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the GPS receiver reset modes. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Definition of the GPS message format (protocol type). @note: Decoding of GPS messages is not supported for protocols other than UBLOX, e.g. no decoding of position, date, time etc. in NMEA mode! \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of the global navigation satellite system types. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom GPS interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: Returns the current settings of the sweep
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current sweep settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.SSweepSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)

member.param: Contains frequency limits, detector types and hardware configuration information

member.summary: Limits for Parameter SSpectrumSettings::fMaxDeviceMeasRateInHz and SSpectrumSettings::fMaxReportingRateInHz.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.CViComRFPowerScanInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: Returns reference to basic interface object implementation. The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different R&S TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic R&S TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.SMeasResult.ListOfReportingRates
member.summary: List of measured (calculated) reporting rates. The reporting rate informs about the number of scanner results per time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.RFPOWERSCAN.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

Returns the current settings of the sweep
@return pointer to a structure holding the current sweep settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SSpectrumSettings::fMaxDeviceMeasRateInHz and SSpectrumSettings::fMaxReportingRateInHz.
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.
Description of the functions to perform RF power scans. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]
List of measured (calculated) reporting rates. The reporting rate informs about the number of scanner results per time.

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.
Array of level values in dBm. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
Marker frequency in Hz (the marker is set to the spectral line with the highest level)
Count of individual results (0 if the marker is not used)
Result structure for measurements using the marker. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Array of levels in dBm (only valid if the marker is not used) \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
Count of level results in the result array
Result structure for spectrum measurements. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Overflow indicator
Measurement timestamp (PC tic) in ms.
Result structure for all measurements. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom RFPowerScan scanner module. It is a result of the CViComRFPowerScanInterface::GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Marker activation and configuration (see explanation of SMarker structure)
Channel filter sequence setting for the sweep (see explanation of SChannelFilterSequence, SChannelFilterSubsequence and SChannelFilterDefinition)
Time detector setting for the sweep (see explanation of the STimeDetector structure)
Frequency detector setting for the sweep (see explanation of the SFrequencyDetector structure)
Measurement time (see explanation of the SMeasurementTime structure)
Spectrum settings for the sweep (see explanation of the SSpectrumSettings structure)
Raw data reporting: If enabled the FFT results are delivered to the host application without processing (frequency-/time-detector and channel filter)
Upper frequency limit of the sweep range
Lower frequency limit of the sweep range
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this measurement. RFPowerScan tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
The structure Settings contains all parameters of a sweep. Each instance of the interface controls a single sweep. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Flag to request all power values
Flag to activate the marker mode
Marker settings One single marker is available. The marker will be set to the frequency with the highest level. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Width (number of elements) of the subsequence
Spacing of the frequency grid.
First frequency of the subsequence
The channel filter subsequence defines an equally segmented frequency band where the channel filter will be applied \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Count of individual subsequences within the sequence

Magnitude array of the transfer function, the final values of the transfer function will be a linear interpolation of the table. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfFrequencies" sizeismember="true"]
Frequency resolution in the table (first frequency is 0 --> center frequency of the channel)
Count of frequencies: count of entries for the filter definition
The structure SChannelFilterDefinition defines the frequency response of the channel filter (one-sided, filter assumed to be symmetrical) * \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The channel filter sequence contains several subsequences of equally spaced frequency subbands, all subbands use the same channel filter \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Time parameter: eDetectorIntervalType defines how this value should be used
Time interval type according enumerator description
Detector type according enumerator description
Description of the usage of the time interval value. Used to define how the value of the time interval should be used in the level measurement
Detector type in time domain. Used to define the type of time detector used in time domain.
The structure STimeDetector contains the parameters for the level measurement in time domain \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Detector type according enumerator description
Count of spectral lines for the detector
Detector type in frequency domain. Used to define the type of level detector used in frequency domain.
The structure SFrequencyDetector contains the parameters for the level measurement in frequency domain \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Detector type according enumerator description
Measurement time in nsec.
Definition of measurement time Used to define the measurement time independent of the FFT size.
The structure SMeasurementTime contains the parameters to define the measurement time \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Fixed attenuation in dB if auto attenuation is disabled. Only for TSMW receivers.
Auto attenuation flag: 1 = enable auto attenuation, 0 = use fixed attenuation. Only for TSMW receivers.
Preamplifier flag: 1 = enable preamplifier, 0 = disable preamplifier. Only for TSMW receivers.
Level threshold value if the threshold check is enabled: only records with minimum one value above the threshold will be sent to the host.
Level threshold flag: 1 = level threshold check enabled, 0 = level threshold check disabled
FFT-Bandwidth: Blocksize, which will be scanned at once, if auto bandwidth is disabled. The valid range is between 1 MHz and 20 MHz. @note SampleRateInHz = 1.15 * dwBandwidthInHz
Auto bandwidth flag: 1 = auto bandwidth enabled, 0 = auto bandwidth disabled. @note SampleRateInHz = 1.15 * dwBandwidthInHz = 23 MHz
Bandwidth modes: Used to specify FFT-Bandwith.
FFT size.
Window type.
Maximum measurement rate (reading rate on the TSMW).
Maximum result reporting rate.
FFT Size: Used to define the count of samples for the FFT.
FFT window function type: Used to define the window function applied to the samples.
Spectrum settings contains the basic calculation parameters of a a sweep \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom RFPowerScan interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Register a ScannerData listener that will be notified when new data is available. Note that it is important to Unregister the listener again once it is getting deleted, to avoid crashes.
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of a WCDMA measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
Unless specified, the default timeout value to use.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current R&S TSM settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. SIBs may be acquired for certain node bs. PDU demodulation for node bs or for channels may be reset. Only the following SIB (System Information Block) PDU values may be requested:-MIB -> PDU 14 -SIB 1 -> PDU 15 -SIB 2 -> PDU 16 -SIB 3 -> PDU 17 -SIB 4 -> PDU 18 -SIB 5 -> PDU 19 -SIB 6 -> PDU 20 -SIB 7 -> PDU 21 -SIB 8 -> PDU 22 -SIB 9 -> PDU 23 -SIB 11 -> PDU 25 -SIB 12 -> PDU 26 -SIB 13 -> PDU 27 -SIB 13.1 -> PDU 28 -SIB 13.2 -> PDU 29 -SIB 13.3 -> PDU 30 -SIB 13.4 -> PDU 31 -SIB 14 -> PDU 32 -SIB 15 -> PDU 33 -SIB 15.1 -> PDU 34 -SIB 15.4 -> PDU 37 -SIB 15.5 -> PDU 38 -SIB 17 -> PDU 40 -SIB 18 -> PDU 41 -SIB SB1 -> PDU 42 -SIB SB2 -> PDU 43 -SIB 5bis -> PDU 53 applicable as of UMTS Rel. 6
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetChannelState(System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetChannelState returns the current status of the configurable settings from the channel.
member.param: Specifies the 0-based channel index to be queried.
member.return: Returns an object of SChannelState which contains the current state for the channel. The items in SChannelState can be modified during a running measurement using the ModifyChannel method. SChannelState and ModifyChannel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.ModifyChannel(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelState!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.AddChannel(System.Double)
member.summary: AddChannel is used to create additional channels during a running measurement. The measurement settings from channel index 0, as configured by SetConfiguration(), are used for the new channel. @note This method can not be called in the idle state (i.e. IsMeasurementStarted() must return TRUE) @note Each channel frequency can only be added once. Attempting to add a channel frequency multiple times will return the index that is already present.
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodulationSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: CViComWcdmaInterfaceData::SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. BCH demodulation settings. The selection of new frequencies causes default settings for the BCH demodulation. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the LTE Layer 3 PDUs that should be demodulated. Different sets of PDUs may be read from different BCH channels.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetDemodThresholdLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sCINRThresholdInDB100. The resulting demod threshhold limits are specified for the MeasurementMode::HIGH_DYNAMIC setting. The minimum limit for MeasurementMode::HIGH_SPEED is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetChannelCountLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.CViComWcdmaInterface
member.summary: WCDMA measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all WCDMA related measurement tasks.
