member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodulationSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: CViComWcdmaInterfaceData::SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. BCH demodulation settings. The selection of new frequencies causes default settings for the BCH demodulation. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the LTE Layer 3 PDUs that should be demodulated. Different sets of PDUs may be read from different BCH channels.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface.GetDemodThresholdLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sCINRThresholdInDB100. The resulting demod threshhold limits are specified for the MeasurementMode::HIGH_DYNAMIC setting. The minimum limit for MeasurementMode::HIGH_SPEED is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface.GetChannelCountLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.ICViComWcdmaInterface
member.summary: WCDMA measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all WCDMA related measurement tasks.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the UMTS standard ( 3GPP TS 25.331 V6.9.0 (2006-03) ), which can be found under the following location "http://www.3gpp.org/ftp/Specs/2006-03/Rel-6/25_series/". It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF". In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): -Formatted exactly according to the standard. -Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value. For instance, a SIB3 PDU will be decoded as follows: value<sp></sp>SysInfoType3<sp></sp>::={<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>sib4indicator<sp></sp>FALSE,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>cellIdentity<sp></sp>'11011011<sp></sp>01110110<sp></sp>01011001<sp></sp>1101'B,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>cellIdentity[16<sp></sp>Bit]<sp></sp>26013,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>cellSelectReselectInfo<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>mappingInfo<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>rat<sp></sp>gsm,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>mappingFunctionParameterList<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>functionType<sp></sp>linear,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>mapParameter1<sp></sp>1,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>mapParameter2<sp></sp>1,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>upperLimit<sp></sp>1<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>}<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>}<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>}<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>},<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>cellSelectQualityMeasure<sp></sp>cpich-Ec-N0<sp></sp>:<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>q-HYST-2-S<sp></sp>1,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>q-HYST-2-S[dB]<sp></sp>2<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>},<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>modeSpecificInfo<sp></sp>fdd<sp></sp>:<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-Intrasearch<sp></sp>7,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-Intrasearch[dB]<sp></sp>14,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-Intersearch<sp></sp>3,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-Intersearch[dB]<sp></sp>6,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-SearchHCS<sp></sp>2,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-SearchHCS[dB]<sp></sp>5,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>rat-List<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>{<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>rat-Identifier<sp></sp>gsm,<sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp><sp></sp>s-SearchRAT<sp></sp>2,<sp></s member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If m_dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request for the Layer 3 Decoder.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.ListOfCPichCirs
member.summary: Result list of C-PICH CIRs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.psAverageInbandPowerInDBm100
member.summary: CIR for the P-Sync sequence. This CIR is not specific for a special C-PICH but for the P-SCH channel which is common to all node b. If a CIR measurement had no success (e.g. there is no WCDMA signal on air) then we get at least the received power of the specified channel. The pointer to this power value is valid (!= NULL) if a power measurement was performed.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.sInvalidPowerInDBm100
member.summary: The power values of the CIR are given in 0.01dB resolution as 16 bit signed integer values in the range of (-327.67..327.67dBm). Some power values of a CIR may be below the noise limit or have not been measured. In this case the integer gets the invalid power value 0x8000 = -32768 = -2^15 = -327.68dBm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.dwCirSamplingRateInHz
member.summary: Sometimes it is more convenient to operate with the reciprocal of the CIR resolution. This is the CIR sampling rate = 2^16/10ms.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.dwCirResolutionInFemtoSeconds
member.summary: The CIR is given as a discrete power delay spectrum. The resolution (time distance of adjacent power values) is 10ms/2^16. This value is given as an integer constant in femto seconds (10^-15 sec). It is 38400/2^16 = 0.5859375 times the chip distance and about 0.15 micro seconds.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: If a PDU was measured then the pointer to the PDU result for this PDU measurement is valid (!= NULL)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: This value provides a R&S TSM device time reported in ns. In general, this is the start time of the CIR measurement. In case of a PDU result, this is the time, when the start of the first radio frame of the most recently received segment arrived at the receiver (R&S TSM device). Please see SFN_Info:dwSystemFrameNumber, in case of a PDU result.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.dwPcTimeStampInMs
F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: Channel index to which the measurement belongs. Each result is for only one of the selected RF channels. The channel index counts from 0 and corresponds to the array index in SChannelSettings::pdTableOfFrequencyInMHz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.ListOfPeaks
member.summary: Peak result list.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.fStdDevTimeDriftInPpm
member.summary: The measured standard deviation of the time drift, given in parts per million (ppm). fAverageTimeDriftInPpm for more information.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.fAverageTimeDriftInPpm
member.summary: The measured average time drift of the NodeB with respect to the TSMx receiver timing, given in parts per million (ppm). The drift is comprised of two parts: -Drift associated with the relative motion between the NodeB and TSMx receiver. -Difference in the clock rates between the NodeB and TSMx receiver. If the TSMx receiver is synchronized with GPS, the drift gives an indication of clock rate error in the NodeB. To convert to nanoseconds per second, multiply the value by 1000.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.bExceededDriftLimit
member.summary: TRUE if the average time drift limit fAverageTimeDriftInPpm exceeded the threshold SChannelSettings::fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm, FALSE if the drift is below threshold or if threshold is not used (fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm = 0).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.wRmsDelaySpreadInChip100
member.summary: RMS delay spread value in an accuracy of 0.01 chip time = 2.6041ns. Only available if not 0.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.sISCPInDBm100
member.summary: Interference signal code power for spreading factor 256. (C-PICH spreading)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.sRSCPInDBm100
member.summary: Integral measured power for the C-PICH signal. (Composition of all peaks)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.sInbandPowerInDBm100
member.summary: Power in the RF band during the CIR measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.psCodePowerInDBm100
member.summary: CIR power values in 0.01dBm in time distance dwCirResolutionInFemtoSeconds. @attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfCodePowerValues" sizeismember="true"]

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.dwCountOfCodePowerValues
member.summary: The length of the CIR depends on distance between minimum and maximum delayed signal components.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.dwTimeDelayInCirSamples
member.summary: the first CIR signal psCodePowerInDBm100[0] has arrived the receiver dwTimeDelayInCirSamples/dwCirSamplingRateInHz seconds delayed from u64DeviceTimeInNs this value can be used to display the time delay between different CIRs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.ExtendedSC
member.summary: The identifier for this measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SMaxPeak.dwRadioFrameNumber
member.summary: Virtual Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to each radio frame received. The RFN counting is started for each new combination of Channel and ExtendedSC, i.e. dwChannelIndex, SExtendedSC::wSC, SExtendedSC::wIndicator. See explanation for SExtendedSC.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SMaxPeak.dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec
member.summary: Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. According to 3GPP TS25.211 Chapter 5, the WCDMA FDD radio frame (P-CPICH) has 10 ms length. To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the radio frame length (+/- 10 ms / 2 => 5 ms), the provided dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec must be processed according to he following principle: double dFrameDelay_ms = ( (1000dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 5 ms) modulo 10 ms ) - 5 ms @note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SMaxPeak.pMaxPeakInfo
member.summary: Pointer to the maximum element of the CIR Peak list. This value is not optional, it is a pointer to avoid copying data.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SMaxPeak
member.summary: Parameters of the maximum peak. This result will only be provided, if the peak list is not empty, PPS has been acquired and the Time of Arrival feature has been enabled (i.e. 0 < SSettings::dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs). In addition, it will take about 100 s from start of measurement, before the first results are provided. @note : This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.psDopplerShiftInHz
member.summary: The Doppler shift is measured only in MEAS_MODE_HIGH_DYNAMIC. For MEAS_MODE_HIGH_SPEED the pointer is NULL;

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.sPeakPowerInDBm100
member.summary: This power includes short term reflections and may be different to the power in the CIR graph at the same position.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.dwTimeDelayInCirSamples
member.summary: Signal of the peak has arrived the receiver dwTimeDelayInCirSamples/dwCirSamplingRateInHz seconds delayed from u64DeviceTimeInNs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.SSCHPowerValues.sSSCHPowerInDBm100
member.summary: code power for one S-SCH code

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.SSCHPowerValues.sPSCHPowerInDBm100
member.summary: code power for one P-SCH code

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.SSCHPowerValues.sInbandPowerInDBm100
member.summary: As the arrival time of the P-SCH and the S-SCH is different from the arrival time of the used C-PICH signal for CIR measurements we have an inband power different from SCPichCir::sInbandPowerInDBm100

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo.SSCHPowerValues
member.summary: Structure for code power values of synchronisation channels. This values are only valid, if a new synchronisation to this C-PICH signal was possible. If this values are invalid, then the measurement had be taken only because of a previous measurement of the same Node B. In this case the pointer to this structure is NULL.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SPeakInfo
member.summary: structure which contains results for separated peak values in the CIR

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir.SBchCellIdentification.wLAC

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SCPichCir
member.summary: For most code power measurements and for P-CPICH CIR measurements not only the absolute code power value (in 0.01dBm) is reported but in addition the absolute total inband power value (InbandPower) belonging to the code power measurement is reported. This makes it possible to calculate the Ec/Io for the measured code power by subtracting the InbandPower which belongs to the code power.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SPSyncCir.sCodePowerInDBm100

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8 than some tail bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] should be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.ExtendedSC
member.summary: Scrambling code and indicator of the channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwTimeOfLastSegInMs
member.summary: This is the PC time of the first radio frame of the most recently received segment. It corresponds to the device time (u64DeviceTimeInNs) and contains the same value as dwPcTimeStampInMs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwTimeOfFirstSegInMs
member.summary: This is the PC time, when the first radio frame of the first segment has been received.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwRadioFrameNumber
member.summary: (Virtual) Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to the first radio frame of the most recently received segment, i.e. this RFN indicates the same radio frame as the SFN (dwSystemFrameNumber) from a source identified by dwChannelIndex and ExtendedSC. See explanation for SMaxPeak::dwRadioFrameNumber.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwSystemFrameNumber
member.summary: According to the 3GPP standard, the WCDMA System frame number (SFN) is provided modulo 4096. This is the SFN of the most recently measured BCCH BCH segment, which contributed to the PDU. The device time, when the start of the first radio frame of the most recently received segment arrived at the receiver, is stored in u64DeviceTimeInNs.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info
T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult
member.summary: BCH demodulator results If the Time of Arrival feature is enabled and available (i.e. 0 < SSettings::dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs), the virtual Radio Frame Number will be added to the PDU result. The relation between the SFN and the RFN is given by the following equations: The offset between virtual RFN and real SFN can be calculated by Delta = ( 4096 + SFN - (RFN mod 4096) ) You can add or subtract integral multiples of 4096, because the complete set of System Information Messages is repeated after 4096 radio frames. Due to this, any of the possible Delta values provides a correct relation between SFN and RFN, but the time of the repetition is arbitrary. If you want to find the correct relation in time, you must calculate the absolute Time of arrival (ToA) and add or subtract integral multiples of 40.96 s, till you get the same ToA calculated from RFN as was reported for the PDU. This value is constant for all PDUs provided by the same base station sector (cell). To verify the relation for any PDU result you can calculate SFN = (RFN + Delta) mod 4096 @note : If a SIB is assembled from more than one segment, the PC time interval of segment collection is given.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SExtendedSC.wIndicator
member.summary: 0, 1, ... see explanation above

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SExtendedSC.wSC
member.summary: Scrambling code, one of: 0, 16, ..., 16 511.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult.SExtendedSC
member.summary: Scrambling codes (SC) are measured and used to identify the Node B which is using the SC. If C-PICH signals generated with the same SC have been received then the PN-Scanner normally relates this signal to each other with the assumption that this signals have been transmitted from the same Node B. But in the case of different frame timing (outside a range for reflections) or if the measurements have been acquired at different times (with more than a few minutes delay), the assumption that both signals have been transmitted from the same Node B is wrong or may be uncertain. To indicate whether received signals with the same SC at the same RF channel are reliably related (transmitted from the same Node B) the PN-Scanner attaches an indicator to each measured SC. If this indicator is different for the same SC, the signals may be transmitted from the same Node B, but this is not certain. This uncertainty can be resolved by Cell Identity measurements (SIB3 demodulation).

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SMeasResult
member.summary: This structure holds a measurement result from the result buffer. Please refer to the manual for a detailed discussion of how to interpret the results.

Except of frequency settings all other settings have default values. This structure bundles these settings and will be returned as result from the GetSettings() method.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodulationSettings.dwMaxNodeBHoldTimeInSec
member.summary: Time limit the scanner remembers an already measured NodeB (channel, SC, SCId). If a NodeB defined by channel, SC and SCId was not received for the here specified time, the combination channel, SC and SCId will not be used anymore. This causes a restart of all demodulation requests for this NodeB.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (100100 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(0,<sp></sp>SIB4,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB5,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>100,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the node b identified by SC 375 SC ID 0 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the node b identified by SC 429 SC ID 0 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (10100ms): (0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>BTS_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>375,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>BTS,<sp></sp>10,<sp></sp>429,<sp></sp>0) Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0. If any PDU besides MIB, SB1 and SB2 shall be decoded, SIB3 needs to be requested as well.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.BTS_OLD_FORCE
member.summary: Equal to BTS_FORCE but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.BTS_OLD
member.summary: Equal to BTS but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: All demodulation results for each BTS on the specified channel will be deleted and the demodulation for this channel starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.BTS_RESET
member.summary: All demodulation results for a special BTS will be deleted and the demodulation for this BTS starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.BTS_FORCE
member.summary: Equal to BTS but the limitation in receiver resource usage will be ignored and the demodulation will be be done until the PDU has been demodulated or timeout occurred.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: The demodulation is only for a BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the delay time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command requests the demodulation. Only to be used in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose. PDUs configured with this setting can be decoded using one of BTS, BTS_FORCE, BTS_OLD, DEMOD_BTS_OLD_HIGH modes.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: The PDU is demodulated only once for each BTS. Only to be used in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.bDriftScanning
member.summary: Setting bDriftScanning to TRUE will enable WCDMA drift scanning to track drifting NodeBs. NodeBs with similar drifts will be grouped together; however, there is a limit on the number of groups that can be tracked. If the limit is reached, a logging message is displayed in the message tracer file.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm
member.summary: When a NodeB is detected to be drifting in excess of this threshold, the value SMeasResult::SCPichCir::bExceededDriftLimit is set to TRUE. The threshold is set in units of parts per million (ppm). 1 ppm = 1000 ns/sec. @note The flag bDriftScanning must be enabled in order to set this value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.pTableOfFrequencySetting
member.summary: Pointer to an array containing the frequencies of the selected channels. The number of members in the array is defined by dwCount (above). For value range see SReceiver::SSupportedFrequencies.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.dwCount
member.summary: Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs
member.summary: Length of the sliding window for Time of Arrival averaging in ms. Values in the near past of the current value contribute more to the average than older values. Values older than dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs will contribute significantly less to the average value. If > 1, this value is treated as double Sigma threshold of a Gaussian distribution in time, on which the averaging is based. If 1, results are provided without averaging. If 0, feature deactivated, no ToA processing and no results. This is the default!

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.WCDMA.SChannelSettings.dwMeasRatePer1000Sec
member.summary: The desired measurement rate value. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits(). The limits are dependent from the currently set eMeasurementMode.

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

Register a ScannerData listener that will be notified when new data is available. Note that it is important to Unregister the listener again once it is getting deleted, to avoid crashes.
@param[in] pListener The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement.
SIBs may be acquired for certain node bs. PDU demodulation for node bs or for channels may be reset.
Only the following SIB (System Information Block) PDU values may be requested: - MIB -> PDU 14 - SIB 1 -> PDU 15 - SIB 2 -> PDU 16 - SIB 3 -> PDU 17 - SIB 4 -> PDU 18 - SIB 5 -> PDU 19 - SIB 6 -> PDU 20 - SIB 7 -> PDU 21 - SIB 8 -> PDU 22 - SIB 9 -> PDU 23 - SIB 11 -> PDU 25 - SIB 12 -> PDU 26 - SIB 13 -> PDU 27 - SIB 13.1 -> PDU 28 - SIB 13.2 -> PDU 29 - SIB 13.3 -> PDU 30 - SIB 13.4 -> PDU 31 - SIB 14 -> PDU 32 - SIB 15 -> PDU 33 - SIB 15.1 -> PDU 34 - SIB 15.4 -> PDU 37 - SIB 15.5 -> PDU 38 - SIB 17 -> PDU 40 - SIB 18 -> PDU 41 - SIB SB1 -> PDU 42 - SIB SB2 -> PDU 43 - SIB 5bis -> PDU 53 applicable as of UMTS Rel. 6
@param[in] rDemodRequests When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sCINRThresholdInDB100. The resulting demod threshhold limits are specified for the MeasurementMode::HIGH_DYNAMIC setting. The minimum limit for MeasurementMode::HIGH_SPEED is equal to the returned default value of the SRange container object.
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
@return reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.
WCDMA measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all WCDMA related measurement tasks. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]

Result from the Layer 3 Decoder.
The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the UMTS standard ( 3GPP TS 25.331 V6.9.0 (2006-03) ), which can be found under the following location "http://www.3gpp.org/ftp/Specs/2006-03/Rel-6/25_series/". It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF".
In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): 1. Formatted exactly according to the standard. 2. Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.
For instance, a SIB3 PDU will be decoded as follows:
@code value SysInfoType3 ::= { sib4indicator FALSE, cellIdentity '11011011 01110110 01011001 1101'B, cellIdentity[16 Bit] 26013, cellSelectReselectInfo { mappingInfo { { rat gsm, mappingFunctionParameterList { { functionType linear, mapParameter1 1, mapParameter2 1, upperLimit 1 } } } }, cellSelectQualityMeasure cpich-Ec-N0 : { q-HYST-2-S 1, q-HYST-2-S[dB] 2 }, modeSpecificInfo fdd : { s-Intrasearch 7, s-Intrasearch[dB] 14, s-Intersearch 3, s-Intersearch[dB] 6, s-SearchHCS 2, s-SearchHCS[dB] 5, rat-List { { rat-Identifier gsm, s-SearchRAT 2, s-HCS-RAT 1, s-HCS-RAT[dB] 3, s-Limit-SearchRAT 2 } }, q-QualMin -18, q-RxlevMin -58, q-RxlevMin[dBm] -115 }, q-Hyst-l-S 1, q-Hyst-l-S[dB] 2, t-Reselection-S 2, hcs-ServingCellInformation { hcs-PRIO 2, q-HCS 0, t-CR-Max notUsed : NULL }, maxAllowedUL-TX-Power 24 }, cellAccessRestriction { cellBarred notBarred : NULL, cellReservedForOperatorUse notReserved, cellReservationExtension notReserved, accessClassBarredList { notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred, notBarred } } } @endcode \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Request for the Layer 3 Decoder. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.
Result list of C-PICH CIRs.

Virtual Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to each radio frame received. The RFN counting is started for each new combination of Channel and ExtendedSC, i.e. dwChannelIndex, SExtendedSC::wSC, SExtendedSC::wIndicator. See explanation for SExtendedSC.

Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival.
According to 3GPP TS25.211 Chapter 5, the WCDMA FDD radio frame (P-CPICH) has 10 ms length.
To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the radio frame length (+/- 10 ms / 2 => 5 ms), the provided dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec must be processed according to he following principle: double dFrameDelay_ms = ( (1000*dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 5 ms) modulo 10 ms ) - 5 ms
@note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.
Pointer to the maximum element of the CIR Peak list. This value is not optional, it is a pointer to avoid copying data.
Peak result list.

Structure for code power values of synchronisation channels. This values are only valid, if a new synchronisation to this C-PICH signal was possible. If this values are invalid, then the measurement had be taken only because of a previous measurement of the same Node B. In this case the pointer to this structure is NULL. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
structure which contains results for separated peak values in the CIR \@attribute[type="serializable"]

If the BCH demodulator has already demodulated signal of the node b we assume for the ExtendedSC then we get a valid pointer to this structure. If no demodulation result is available then the pointer to this structure is NULL. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

For most code power measurements and for P-CPICH CIR measurements not only the absolute code power value (in 0.01dBm) is reported but in addition the absolute total inband power value (InbandPower) belonging to the code power measurement is reported. This makes it possible to calculate the Ec/Io for the measured code power by subtracting the InbandPower which belongs to the code power. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This array contains the measured power values
Maximum number of CIR values in measurement
These are the actual CIR measurements. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

CIR for the P-Sync sequence. This CIR is not specific for a special C-PICH but for the P-SCH channel which is common to all node b.
If a CIR measurement had no success (e.g. there is no WCDMA signal on air) then we get at least the received power of the specified channel. The pointer to this power value is valid (!= NULL) if a power measurement was performed.

The power values of the CIR are given in 0.01dB resolution as 16 bit signed integer values in the range of (-327.67..327.67dBm). Some power values of a CIR may be below the noise limit or have not been measured. In this case the integer gets the invalid power value 0x8000 = -32768 = -2^15 = -327.68dBm.
Sometimes it is more convenient to operate with the reciprocal of the CIR resolution. This is the CIR sampling rate = 2^16/10ms.

The CIR is given as a discrete power delay spectrum. The resolution (time distance of adjacent power values) is 10ms/2^16. This value is given as an integer constant in femto seconds (10^-15 sec). It is 38400/2^16 = 0.5859375 times the chip distance and about 0.15 micro seconds.

Optional information about radio frame numbers and times. Each element is only valid, if its value is not SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE.
@note: If you want to use scheduling information from MIB or Scheduling Blocks (SB1, SB2) together with dwSystemFrameNumber, you must take into account, that the SFN start value of the scheduling information is related to the first segment, whereas SFN and RFN reported here are related to the most recently received segment (i.e. the last segment) of the PDU.

Channel index to which the measurement belongs.
Each result is for only one of the selected RF channels. The channel index counts from 0 and corresponds to the array index in SChannelSettings::pdTableOfFrequencyInMHz.

Scrambling codes (SC) are measured and used to identify the Node B which is using the SC. If C-PICH signals generated with the same SC have been received then the PN-Scanner normally relates this signal to each other with the assumption that this signals have been transmitted from the same Node B. But in the case of different frame timing (outside a range for reflections) or if the measurements have been acquired at different times (with more than a few minutes delay), the assumption that both signals have been transmitted from the same Node B is wrong or may be uncertain. To indicate whether received signals with the same SC at the same RF channel are reliably related (transmitted from the same Node B) the PN-Scanner attaches an indicator to each measured SC. If this indicator is different for the same SC, the signals may be transmitted from the same Node B, but this is not certain. This uncertainty can be resolved by Cell Identity measurements (SIB3 demodulation). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This structure holds a measurement result from the result buffer. Please refer to the manual for a detailed discussion of how to interpret the results. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed and with the functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterfaceData change basic settings. Except of frequency settings all other settings have default values.
This structure bundles these settings and will be returned as result from the GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

Time limit the scanner remembers an already measured NodeB (channel, SC, SCId). If a NodeB defined by channel, SC and SCId was not received for the here specified time, the combination channel, SC and SCId will not be used anymore. This causes a restart of all demodulation requests for this NodeB.
Threshold for demodulation trials in 0.01dB. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().
This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
@brief Array of SDemodRequest, counter is dwCountOfRequests above \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfRequests" sizeismember="true"]

There must be one instance of this structure for each demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels.
Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (100*100 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: @code (0, SIB3, 0, 0, 0, 0) (0, SIB4, 0, 0, 0, 0) (1, SIB3, 0, 0, 0, 0) (1, SIB5, REPETITION, 100, 0, 0) (1, SIB7, ON_CMD, 0, 0, 0) @endcode Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the node b identified by SC 375 SC ID 0 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the node b identified by SC 429 SC ID 0 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (10*100ms): @code (0, 0, BTS_RESET, 0, 375, 0) (1, SIB7, BTS, 10, 429, 0) @endcode Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.
If any PDU besides MIB, SB1 and SB2 shall be decoded, SIB3 needs to be requested as well. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This enumeration defines modes for the demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This enumeration defines a translation table from SIB to PDU. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to define what SIB shall be decoded. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Setting bDriftScanning to TRUE will enable WCDMA drift scanning to track drifting NodeBs. NodeBs with similar drifts will be grouped together; however, there is a limit on the number of groups that can be tracked. If the limit is reached, a logging message is displayed in the message tracer file.

When a NodeB is detected to be drifting in excess of this threshold, the value \ref SMeasResult::SCPichCir::bExceededDriftLimit is set to TRUE. The threshold is set in units of parts per million (ppm). 1 ppm = 1000 ns/sec. \note The flag bDriftScanning must be enabled in order to set this value.

Pointer to an array containing the frequencies of the selected channels. The number of members in the array is defined by dwCount (above). For value range see SReceiver::SSupportedFrequencies. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]

Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks.
For value range see GetChannelCountLimits(). *

Length of the sliding window for Time of Arrival averaging in ms. Values in the near past of the current value contribute more to the average than older values. Values older than dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs will contribute significantly less to the average value. If > 1, this value is treated as double Sigma threshold of a Gaussian distribution in time, on which the averaging is based. If 1, results are provided without averaging. If 0, feature deactivated, no ToA processing and no results. This is the default!
The desired measurement rate value. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits(). The limits are dependent from the currently set eMeasurementMode.
Measurement mode settings.
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz.
The selection of new frequencies (with SetConfiguration) automatically resets the BCH demodulator, so that it demodulates the default SIBs. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This defines the different measurement modi. For the TSML device, only the HIGH_SPEED mode can be set. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Center frequency of the channel in Hz.
This defines the frequency in Hz. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Struct containing the channel measurement settings that can be modified during a running measurement \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom WCDMA interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Register a ScannerData listener that will be notified when new data is available. Note that it is important to Unregister the listener again once it is getting deleted, to avoid crashes.
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(System.String)
member.summary: Issue a request to the V2X message decoder to decode the contents of the PDCP PDU byte buffer contained in pduByteBuffer. If the data has been decoded successfully, the method creates the XML string on the heap and returns a pointer to it. The first byte in pduByteBuffer should contain the region with remaining bytes being the ITS message. The ITS message may contain other protocol headers such as IEEE1609.3 header, IEEE1609.2 header, etc. that will be processed by the decoder. @note ITS message decoding requires a specific version of Wireshark to be installed. Will error if it is not found.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an V2X measurement and holds the message data that shall be decoded.
member.return: A pointer to the decoded ITS message in XML format, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. !! Attention !! : The returned pointer is only valid until RetrieveTextForPDU is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.ResetConfiguration
member.summary: Resets the configuration for V2X scanning.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.SetITSMessageDecoding(System.Boolean)
member.summary: SetITSMEssageDecoding will indicate if the ITS messages should be decoded by ViCom or not. @note Regardless of the choice, the raw ITS message will still be reported. @note ITS message decoding is disabled by default.
member.param: Set to true to enable ViCom ITS message decoding capabilities. Set to false to disable ViCom ITS message decoding capabilities.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.CViComV2xInterface.RemoveChannel(System.UInt32)
member.summary: RemoveChannel is used remove a channel to V2X for measurements. @note This method can only be called in the idle state (IsMeasurementStarted() must return false)
member.param: Channel index to remove from ViCom
member.return: Returns true if channel was successfully removed and false if the channel did not exist or was unable to removed.

member.summary: In case the channel index for a configuration is lost, it can be retrieved using GetChannelIndex and the frequency.
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
member.return: Returns the channel index associated with the selected frequency, otherwise will return a INVALID_DWORD value indicating that the frequency was not found.

member.summary: This is nullptr if no PSSCH information is available.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.rsRssiDbm
member.summary: Reference Signal Received Signal Strength Indicator in dBm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.rsrpDbm
member.summary: Reference Signal Received Power in dBm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.rsCinrDb
member.summary: Reference Signal Carrier to Interference and Noise Ratio in dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.ITSMessageResult.itsMessage
member.summary: The ITS message. Depending on which SViComList is called used can contain information on the Raw or Decoded version of the ITS message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.retransmissionIndex
member.summary: If the retransmission index = 0/1, then the repetition is after/before the main transmission.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.freqResourceLocation
member.summary: This is our well known RIV number and is explained in TS36.213 Section 14.1.1.4C. The legal number of sidelink subchannels = N_SL_SubCH = 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, 20.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.resourceReservation
member.summary: Set to 0 for Transmission Mode (TM) 3. For TM4, the Resource Reservation interval (= 20, 50, 100, 200, 300, ... 1000 msec) is divided by 100 to produce an index X into TS36.213 Table 14.2.1-2. The content of that index is the Resource Reservation. The Resource Reservation field indicates when and whether the next message is sent.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.MCS
member.summary: The Modulation and Coding Scheme. See TS36.213 Table 7.1.7.1-1 and Table 7.1.7.2.1-1.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.timeGap
member.summary: The TimeGap is the absolute difference between the index of the Subframe of the current transmission and the index of the subframe of the retransmission, used to set the SFgap. See TS36.212, TS36.213 and TS36.321.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.SCIResult.priority
member.summary: A 3 bit quantity indicating the quality of service. The higher quality the service is, the higher it's priority is compared to other services.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult.peakPathDelayInNSec
member.summary: Approximate flight time of the path with the largest magnitude in nanoseconds.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult.BER
member.summary: Bit error rate. Value is provided by Turbo Decoder Algorithm. BER represented as a ratio.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult.sourceID
member.summary: The MAC source ID provided in the MAC SL-SCH header. This ID temporarily defines the V2X transmitter. If there is no MAC PDU sourceID will be invalid.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult.rsrpDbm
member.summary: Reference Signal Received Power in dBm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult.rsCinrDb
member.summary: Reference Signal Carrier to Interference and Noise Ratio in dB.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult.PSSCHResult
member.summary: The shared channel result. Holds decoded V2x messages. Will only be present if channel has been decoded.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult.PSCCHResult
member.summary: The control channel result. Contains location and minor information.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SMeasResult
member.summary: The V2X measurement result for a single channel returned by CViComV2xInterface::GetResult().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.subframeBitMapSize
member.summary: Determines the length in bits of subframeBitMap.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.startRBForPscchPool
member.summary: Indicates the lowest RB index of the PSCCH pool. Only used if adjacentPscchPssch is false. startRB-PSCCH-Pool-r14. Ref 3GPP TS36.331

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.startRBForSubChannel
member.summary: Indicates the lowest RB index of the subchannel with the lowest index startRB-Subchannel-r14. Ref 3GPP TS36.331

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.numberOfSubChannels
member.summary: The number of subchannels in the corresponding resource pool. numSubchannel-r14. Ref 3GPP TS36.331

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.sizeOfSubChannel
member.summary: Number of Physical Resource Blocks (PRB) of each subchannel in the corresponding resource pool. A subchannel is a certain number of adjacent resource blocks. Adjacency = true {n5, n6, n10, n15, n20, n50, n75, n100} Adjacency = false {n4, n5, n6, n8, n9, n10, n12, n15, n16, n18, n20, n30, n48, n72, n96} If adjacentPscchPssch is true, then the PSSCH and PSCCH are located right next to one another in frequency. If false, they can be seperated in frequency. Meaning there can be a gap of some number of resource blocks in between them. sizeSubchannel-r14. Ref 3GPP TS36.331

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.offsetIndicator
member.summary: Indicates offset of the first subframe (0-10239) of the subframe pool within the standard range of 1024 direct frames (DFN=0 to DFN=1039) sl-OffsetIndicator-r14. Ref 3GPP TS36.331

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.adjacentPscchPssch
member.summary: This parameter indicates whether the PSCCH and PSSCH entities are located next to one another in frequency (true) or may have a resource block gap in between them (false).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_100
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 100 bit for FDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_60
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 60 bit for TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_50
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 50 bit for TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_40
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 40 bit for TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_30
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 30 bit for TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_20
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 20 bit for FDD/TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_16
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 16 bit for FDD/TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters.SubframeBitmapSize.Type.BIT_10
member.summary: Number of bits sl-Subframe-r14 in the bitmap, 10 bit for TDD.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.SPoolParameters
member.summary: The pool parameters define the subframe pool and resource block pool. The subframe pool defines the subframes where V2X messages may appear, whereas the resource block pool determines within which resource blocks the V2X messages may appear. The subframe pool is a sequence of subframes T[n] = [ T[0], T[1], T[2], ... T[N-1] ], where the index n = 0 ... N-1 and N is the number of total subframes in the subframe pool.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.RegionFlag.Type.REGION_CHINA
member.summary: China (CN)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.RegionFlag.Type.REGION_EUROPE
member.summary: Europe (EU)

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.RegionFlag.Type.REGION_NORTH_AMERICA
member.summary: North American (NA)

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.V2X.RegionFlag
member.summary: Indicator used to determine which region V2X will be operating in.

This code should allow creation of a callback from C++ into .NET, while the .NET side runs inside an AppDomain Info was taken from http://www.lenholgate.com/blog/2009/07/error-cannot-pass-a-gchandle-across-appdomains.html Unfortunatelly the solution works on function-callbacks. We do not know yet how to use it on callback interfaces.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.
member.return: if listener has been removed from the list of registered listeners or not

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Register a ScannerData listener that will be notified when new data is available. Note that it is important to Unregister the listener again once it is getting deleted, to avoid crashes.
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.
member.return: if listener has been appended to the list of registered listeners or not

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an TD-SCDMA measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetFrequencyTable(), SetMeasurementMode() and SetDemodulationSettings() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver(), SetResultBufferDepth()of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. PDUs may be acquired for certain eNodeBs. PDU demodulation for eNodeBs or for channels may be reset.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.
member.return: in case of success true otherwise False

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SDemodulationSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. BCH demodulation settings. The selection of new frequencies causes default settings for the BCH demodulation.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

When the function is called, this pointer contains the values that the application wants to set, and when the function returns, it contains the values that were actually set. For details see SDemodulationSettings and SDemodRequests.
member.return: in case of success true otherwise False

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.GetMeasRateLimits
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.GetDemodThresholdLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sEcToIoThresholdDB100
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.GetChannelCountLimits
member.summary: Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSMW applications. The purpose is to control basic TSMW functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.CViComTdScdmaInterface
member.summary: TD-SCDMA measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all TD-SCDMA related measurement tasks.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.ICViComTdScdmaInterface
member.summary: TD-SCDMA measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all TD-SCDMA related measurement tasks.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderResult.pcPduText
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the decoded PDU text, as zero terminated ASCII string.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderResult.dwStringLength
member.summary: Number of decoding result text bytes in the buffer (incl. terminating '\0').

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the standard (3GPP TS 36.331). It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF". In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): -Formatted exactly according to the standard. -Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. Is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.ListOfSignals
member.summary: The actual set of signals associated with the current channel specified by the dwChannelIndex member.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: The time when the signal was started to being measured on the device, with a higher resolution than the default PC clock. This time is relative to the last restart of the device.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: PC local time when the signal was measured (or was started to being measured) on the device.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: The channel to which all the data relates is specified using this index. The index refers to the position in the SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting array.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStopTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the last time in ms of signals used for this message. All IQ signals used to produce this demodulation result are in between dwStartTimeInMs and dwStopTimeInMs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStartTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the first time in ms of signals used for this message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwFirstBtsId
member.summary: The demodulator fills this parameter with the BTS ID the scanner assigned to this BTS first. If later on, the scanner uses a different BTS ID, but after demodulation it is detected that it is the same eNodeB, the demodulator fills this value with the first BTS ID the scanner used. Example: The scanner has measured a eNodeB with ID = 10 and the demodulator has demodulated it successfully. 20 minutes later the scanner found signals of a eNodeB with ID = 55. After demodulating, the demodulator finds out (by comparing unique BTS information from decoding), that it is the same eNodeB as the one with ID = 10. In this case, dwFirstBtsId will be set to 10.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.wSC
member.summary: Scrambling code provided by the scanner as SSignals::wScramblingCode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. Each time the scanner is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known eNodeB, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same eNodeB could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single cell.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SDemodResult
member.summary: BCH demodulator results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.ListOfTimeSlots
member.summary: The actual set of time slot measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.pdwDwPtsTimeOffsetInNs
member.summary: Time offset of DwPTS in ns with respect to the device time (SMeasResult::u64DeviceTimeInNs), if pdwDwPtsTimeOffsetInNs is not NULL. This time is the Time of Arrival of the DwPTS radio signal, i.e. the start of the sync chips, which follow Time Slot 0 (TS0) after a 32 chip guard period. This means, the difference between this value and ToA of TS0 (dwTS0TimeOffsetInNs) is 700 microseconds.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.dwTS0TimeOffsetInNs
member.summary: Time offset of time slot 0 in ns with respect to the device time (SMeasResult::u64DeviceTimeInNs).

member.summary: The scrambling code.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.dwScannerBtsIdent
F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.ListOfPeaks
member.summary: List of CIR peaks found in the signal.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.wScramblingCode
member.summary: The scrambling code.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.dwScannerBtsIdent
F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.dwRadioFrameNumber
member.summary: Virtual Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to each radio frame received. The RFN counting is started for each new combination of Channel and ExtendedSC, i.e. dwChannelIndex, SExtendedSC::wSC, SExtendedSC::wIndicator. See explanation for SExtendedSC.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec
member.summary: Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. According to 3GPP TS25.221 Chapters 5, 5A and 5B Frame structure, the TD-SCDMA radio frame (10 ms) consists of two 5 ms subframes for each complete radio frame. Each Subframe can be seen as a radio frame, therefore we must use the half radio frame length (5 ms) for the ToA (Time of Arrival) offset to PPS calculation. The time difference between DwPTS and the latest PPS pulse received can be calculated by double dDwPTS_OffsetToPpsInSec = dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 0.000675 without the DwPTS Guard Period. If you include the duration of the DwPTS Guard period, you must calculate double dDwPTS_OffsetToPpsInSec = dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 0.000700, see explanation of pdwDwPtsTimeOffsetInNs. To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the length considered (+/- 5 ms / 2 => 2.5 ms), the provided dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec must be processed according to he following principle: double dFrameDelay_ms = ( (1000dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 5 ms) modulo 10 ms ) - 5 ms @note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.pMaxPeakInfo
member.summary: Pointer to the maximum element of the CIR Peak list. This value is not optional, it is a pointer to avoid copying data.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.TDSCDMA.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak
member.summary: Parameters of the maximum peak. This result will only be provided, if the peak list is not empty, PPS has been acquired and the Time of Arrival feature has been enabled (i.e. 0 < SSettings::dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs). In addition, it will take about 100 s from start of measurement, before the first results are provided. @note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.summary: The mode used for BCH demodulation.
