members.member: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted according to the appropriate CDMA / EVDO standard. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Request for the Layer 3 Decoder. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

The measured GPS PPS Pulse time difference in ns. This value is valid, if bGpsPpsWasAvailable is TRUE and if the eOffsetEstimationMethod is OFFSET_ESTIMATION_METHOD_3. The range is -1ms (-1000000).. 999ms (999000000). It shows the GPS arrival time for the case that the measurement results (delays) are correct.
If a time delay of a BTS signal is known, than the measurement error of the PN-Scanner result can be calculated. The same error applies to this value. E.g. PN_Offest 271 was measured. The frame of this signal is transmitted 271 * 64/1228800sec = 14114.58us after a frame with offset 0. Assume the distance to the BTS is 5km. So a measurement result of 14114.58us + 5000m / (300m/us) = 14114.58us + 16.67us = 14131.31us is the expected measurement value. If for instance a delay of 14141.31us was measured as a delay value for this BTS then the measurement result has an error of +10us.
Now we can reduce both the delay value and the PPS delay value by 10us to get correct results.
The corrected value times 0.01 can be used to be set in the SPPSSettings::iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns in the start command to calibrate the GPS delay.

At least one F-Sync demodulation and GPS PPS were used for the CDMA2000 time line estimation. The PN offset values for pilot signals can be estimated from arrival time as long as no F-Sync demodulation for this pilots are successful. Transmit time has now GPS accuracy. To enable the GPS time based offset estimation method PPS synchronisation has to be used for the receiver and SPPSSettings::iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns is in a valid range and PPS pulses are fed in the receiver. The accuracy of the time line estimation directly depends on SPPSSettings::iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns.

At least one F-Sync demodulation was successful but GPS PPS is not available or not used for time line estimation. The PN offset values for pilot signals will be estimated from of the arrival time as long as no F-Sync demodulation for this pilots are successful. The transmit time was estimated by several received pilots using internal algorithms. The scanner remains in this state if PPS synchronisation is not used for the receiver or if SPPSSettings::iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns is not in a valid range or if no PPS pulses are fed in the receiver.

No F-Sync demodulation for any BTS was not yet successfully finished, therefore all reported PN-offset values are set to wInvalidPNOffset. The transmit time is estimated by receive time by an internal algorithm. For a CDMA2000 channel the scanner is in this state only short time normally.

If the F-SYNC channel of any receiver pilot signal is not yet demodulated a time based PN-Offset estimation method is used by the scanner. For this estimation the CDMA 2000 time line has to be synchronised with the internal receiver time. The time based PN-Offset estimation needs at least one F-SYNC channel to be demodulated for both, the PPS synchronised method and the CDMA2000 network synchronised method.
The offset estimation method specifies how a time based PN offset measurement value was derived and how reliable the result is.
Information for the time line estimation used for arrival times and time estimation of PN-Offset \@attribute[type="serializable"]
If a message could be demodulated then the pointer to the MsgResult for this measurement is valid (!= NULL) \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Bit error rate measured Given as Count of received bits with error and count of all received bits Can be invalid.

Sync Channel Demodulation Result * SyncChannelDemodulationResult: The contents of the synchronization message are described in standard TIA-2000.5-D. see spec C.S0005-D 3.7.2.3.2.26 \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Result list of F-PICH CIRs.
Peak result list.
The doppler shift. If invalid, the pointer is NULL;
This power includes short term reflections and may be different to the power in the CIR graph at the same position.
Signal of the peak has arrived the receiver dwTimeDelayInCirSamples/dwCirSamplingRateInHz seconds delayed from u64DeviceTimeInNs.
The identifier for this measurement, NULL if not available.
structure which contains results for separated peak values in the CIR \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Integral measured power for the F-PICH signal (composition of all peaks).
Power in the RF band during the CIR measurement.
CIR power values in 0.01dBm in time distance dwCirResolutionInFemtoSeconds. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfCodePowerValues" sizeismember="true" filterable="true"]
The length of the CIR depends on distance between minimum and maximum delayed signal components.

The offset of the radio frame arrival time from the time it was sent from the base station. It uses the even GPS PPS pulse and the PN Offset value to determine the time offset. The radio frame beginning is calculated using the maximum CIR peak.
3 CDMA radio frames build up one CDMA super frame with 80 ms length, therefore one radio frame has a length of 80/3 ms = 26.6666666 ms.
To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the radio length (+/- 26.666666 ms / 2), you must add this half RF length value, apply a full RF length modulo calculation and then subtract the half length value: double dFrameDelay_ms = ( (1000*dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 5 ms) modulo 10 ms ) - 5 ms
In addition, it will take about 100 s from start of measurement, before the first results are provided.
@note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

The first CIR signal psCodePowerInDBm100[0] has arrived the receiver dwTimeDelayInCirSamples/dwCirSamplingRateInHz seconds delayed from u64DeviceTimeInNs this value can be used to display the time delay between different CIRs.

For most code power measurements and for F-PICH CIR measurements not only the absolute code power value (in 0.01dBm) is reported but in addition the absolute total inband power value (InbandPower) belonging to the code power measurement is reported. This makes it possible to calculate the Ec/Io for the measured code power by subtracting the InbandPower which belongs to the code power. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Tsmu Meas Time Exact time when the CIR measurement was taken. This can be used to analyze the fading situation.

If a CIR measurement had no success (e.g. there is no CDMA2000 signal on air) then we get at least the received power of the specified channel. The pointer to this power value is valid (!= NULL) if a power measurement was performed.

The power values of the CIR are given in 0.01dB resolution as 16 bit signed integer values in the range of (-327.67..327.67dBm). Some power values of a CIR may be below the noise limit or have not been measured. In this case the integer gets the invalid power value 0x8000 = -32768 = -2^15 = -327.68dBm.
Sometimes it is more convenient to operate with the reciprocal of the CIR resolution. This is the CIR sampling twice the chip rate.

The CIR is given as a discrete power delay spectrum. The resolution (time distance of adjacent power values) is half the chip distance. This value is given as an integer constant in femto seconds (10^-15 sec). It is 10^15/(2 * 1228800) = 406901042.
If available, the device time in ns is reported, otherwise NULL.

The start time of the RF measurement which was used to produce the result.
The dwPcTimeStampInMs is a conversion of the device time to the PC system time obtained with the GetTickCount() function. The adjustment of possible time drift between internal device time and GetTickCount() as well as the resolution of GetTickCount() causes a conversion error of a few milliseconds. dwPcTimeStampInMs may be used to synchronize PN-Scanner results with other measurement data in the system or to determine the age of the PN-Scanner result = GetTickCount() - dwPcTimeStampInMs

Channel index to which the measurement belongs.
Each result is for only one of the selected RF channels. The channel index counts from 0 and corresponds to the array index in SChannelSettings::pdTableOfFrequencyInMHz.

The PN-Offset was found by a time estimation. The circumstances (reliability etc.) of the time estimation are described in STimeEstimationResult. Only this or bOffsetSourceIsSyncChannelDemodulation is set.
Source of the PN-Offset was a demodulation of the sync channel of this base station (even if it was long before we did this measurement). So the PN Offset value is correct.

The SExtendedPNOffset structure identifies a basestation in the system and provides PN-Offset measurement results for this basestation.
Measurement results with equal values {channel, ID} are very likely from the same physical BTS. As long as the arrival time of a measured pilot signal fits the 80/3 ms frame pattern of a previously measured pilot signal the ID of the previously measured signal is reused for this measured signal. If two pilot signals transmitted from the same BTS have been measured at different locations a new ID value is used for the recent signal if the previous pilot signal measurement was taken long ago or due to strong reflections a fit of the frame timing is not assumed.
In contrast to UMTS SC the PN-Offset in the measurement results is not used to indicate that results belong to the same BTS, as the PN-Offset is time-estimated or demodulated. E.g. two results for the same channel {ID = 156, PN-Offset = 30 (time estimated)} and {ID = 156, PN-Offset = 32 (demodulated)} belong to the same BTS. In this case the PN-Offset time estimation was wrong and may be corrected in a post process using this ID. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This structure holds a measurement result from the result buffer. Please refer to the manual for a detailed discussion of how to interpret the results. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed and with the functions SelectReceiver(), SetTimebaseSynchronisationMode() of CViComBasicInterfaceData change basic settings. Except of frequency settings all other settings have default values.
This structure bundles these settings and will be returned as result from the GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This is the range the short sync will use to calculate the timing estimation when synchronizing with EVDO channels. During such a sync phase, synchronization will be performed around the expected point in time with the specified radius. There are significant processing thresholds all 160 chips (39km). We recommend 160 chips (39km) for downtown areas and 320 chips (78km) for urban areas.

If this is set to true, then the CDMA 2000 demodulation is stopped after the first complete demodulation of a sync channel. That helps saving time and it is not required. Once a synchronization is available, the time estimation can be performed.

Measurement rate for EVDO measurements. All channels together will be measured with this rate, i.e. one channel will be measured with an average of ChannelCount/dwMeasRatePer1000Sec measurements per 1000 sec.
The valid ranges are defined in the SMeasurementRate struct.

As an additional option, the CDMA 2000 interface can measure and demodulate EVDO channels as well. How this is done can be controlled by the parameters made available in this structure.
Which EVDO channels shall be measured is specified as part of the SFrequencySetting structure vector that is contained in the SChannelSettings structure.
@note To use EVDO scanning without scanning any CDMA channel, you must at least activate BCH Demodulation for EVDO_SYNC message.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
Threshold for EVDO demodulation trials in 0.01dB. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().
Threshold for CDMA demodulation trials in 0.01dB. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().
This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
\@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfRequests" sizeismember="true"]

There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different message ids can be measured on different channels.
Example for start measurement: On the first channel the system parameters and the channel list messages shall be decoded, on the the second channel the neighbor list additionally. For the channel with index 1, the channel list shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (100*100 ms) and the neighborlist shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: @code {0, { Pdu::SYS_PARAMS, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, ONCE, 0, 0}, {0, { Pdu::CHAN_LIST, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, ONCE, 0, 0}, {1, { Pdu::SYS_PARAMS, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, ONCE, 0, 0}, {1, { Pdu::CHAN_LIST, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, REPETITION, 100, 0}, {1, { Pdu::NEIGHBOR_LIST, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, ON_CMD, 0, 0}, {2, { Pdu::SYNC, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, ONCE, 0, 0}, @endcode Example during measurement: On channel 0 the system parameter message demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS with the ID 260 and on the the second channel the neighbor list demodulation shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 116 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (10*100ms): @code {0, { Pdu::SYS_PARAMS, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, BTS_RESET, 0, 260}, {1, { Pdu::NEIGHBOR_LIST, C2K_CH_TYPE_ALL }, BTS, 10, 116} @endcode @note You are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

This structure is used to configure message demodulation requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. demodulation is requested on demand or to reset previous intermediate results of demodulation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Equal to BTS_FORCE but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Equal to BTS_FORCE but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Equal to BTS_FORCE but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

Equal to BTS but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Equal to BTS but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Equal to BTS but previously measured messages may be used for the result. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

All demodulation results for a special BTS will be deleted and the demodulation for this BTS starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
All demodulation results for a special BTS will be deleted and the demodulation for this BTS starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
All demodulation results for a special BTS will be deleted and the demodulation for this BTS starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

Equal to BTS but the limitation in receiver resource usage will be ignored and the demodulation will be be done until the PDU has been demodulated or timeout occurred.
Equal to BTS but the limitation in receiver resource usage will be ignored and the demodulation will be be done until the PDU has been demodulated or timeout occurred.
Equal to BTS but the limitation in receiver resource usage will be ignored and the demodulation will be be done until the PDU has been demodulated or timeout occurred.
This enumeration defines modes for the demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Detail information on what kind of channel was used to demodulate a message, or which shall be used to demodulate one. This depends on whether this is used in the measurement setup or in the result structures.
@see PduSpec for further details \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Here you can find a list of messages that can be demodulated by the CDMA 2000 scanner. The values in this enumeration can be used as in- and output parameters to specify which kind of message shall or has been demodulated. In many cases, this is combined with a channel filter specifying on which channel the message occurred.
@see etChannelType and PduSpec for the combined usage \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Maximum speed of the test vehicle to adjust fading channel limitation in the measurement algorithms.
To calculate a value from miles per hour to kilometer per hour, use the formula shown below: v[km/h] = 0.621371192237334 * v[m/h]; \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Usage of fast demodulation if new pilots have been detected. This is the preferred mode, since it combines a high accuracy and a processing saving detection method.

Sync channel has to be demodulated for each new pilot (if the PN-Scanner has found a new pilot). This is a very time consuming tasks, since the software constantly has to perform a demodulation for new pilots.
Sync channel demodulation mode settings \@attribute[type="serializable"]

PPS Pulse The PPS (pulse per second) signal from an external GPS receiver fed to the PULSE IN connector at the rear panel of the device is used for synchronization. This signal provides maximum accuracy.
If the iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns is valid and PPS synchronisation is used for the receiver than we use the PPS for time synchronization. See also comments to STimeEstimationResult::lMeasuredPPSDelayInNs to find the correct value. If the iDelayOfPPSFallingEdgeIn100ns is invalid, than the PPS is not used for time synchronization even if a PPS is available. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Pointer to an array containing the frequencies of the selected channels. The number of members in the array is defined by dwCount (above).
Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits(). *
The desired measurement rate value. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits().
Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. Scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
If this shall be demodulated as EVDO channel, then this has to be set to true.
512 TRUE/FALSE values. TRUE is if the Offset is used in the network, FALSE if not. This limitation is used for the offset estimation by arrival time. It is not used for demodulation.
Center frequency of the channel
Maximum number of PN Offset Arbitrary Limits per frequency*
This defines the frequency in Hz and a table, where each single PN offset can be specified to be measure or not. If this is an EVDO channel is also set here. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Struct containing the channel measurement settings that can be modified during a running measurement \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Data containers used for ViCom LTE interface. Contains measurement configuration and result structures.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ResultDataListener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data. RegisterResultDataListener
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Register a ScannerData listener that will be notified when new data is available. Note that it is important to Unregister the listener again once it is getting deleted, to avoid crashes. For FastACD, there is more than a single ResultDataListener. FastACD comes with the default ResultDataListener to process a FastACD result. Depending on the ACD result, it can potentially have additional results specific to the technology the ACD result is associated with. When technology specific results are needed with FastACD, the other ResultDataListener must be used. @note To avoid crashes, it is important to call UnregisterDataListener prior to deleting the interface.
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.GetLteSettingsFrom(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns information that can be used to configure a technology specific scanning interface. Functions may be called during measurement or after a measurement.
member.param: The frequency from a result from FastACD. Used to determine which SFrequencySetting to return.
member.return: SFrequencySetting based on frequency and technology provided. A nullptr is returned if the specified frequency has not been detected or if the technology specific information required to fill in SFrequencySetting has not been received yet.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.ResetConfiguration
member.summary: Clears configured technologies and configured bands.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.RemoveBand(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.Technology.Type,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes a band from the measurement
member.param: The technology that the band is associated with.
The band used for a measurement. Can either be a custom frequency band or a technology specific frequency band.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.AddCustomFrequencyBand(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.Technology.Type,System.Double,System.Double,System.UInt32)
member.param: The technology in which this new frequency range will be applied to
The start frequency of the range in Hz
The stop frequency of the range in Hz
When 0, a band identifier will be generated by ViCom. When non zero, the custom frequency band will be assigned to the band specified.
member.return: A generated band identifier to associate with the custom frequency band.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.AddCustomFrequencyBand(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.Technology.Type,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: The technology in which this new frequency range will be applied to
The start frequency of the range in Hz
The stop frequency of the range in Hz
When 0, a band identifier will be generated by ViCom. When non zero, the custom frequency band will be assigned to the band specified.
member.return: A generated band identifier to associate with the custom frequency band.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.AddBand(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.Technology.Type,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Add a technology specific frequency band to ViCom. @note This function handles technology specific frequency bands by supplying a band number. Refer to AddCustomFrequencyBand() to create custom frequency bands where start and stop frequency values are used. <simplesect kind="par"> Setting the technology value to Technology::CDMA implies CDMA2000, which includes 1xRTT, 1X Advanced, and 1xEV-DO. FastACD will search for both CDMA and EVDO channels in the band(s) requested; however, CDMA and EVDO channel detections will be reported to ViCom as separate results. <simplesect kind="par"> When the technology is set to Technology::GSM, use the table below to set the band number as there is no standard numerical value assigned to the bands in the 3GPP specification for GSM. The values follow the Roman numerals as shown in section <bold>2 Frequency bands and channel arrangement</bold> of the specification. Refer to TS 45.005 version 15.1.0 Release 15 for further information. GSM bands using dynamic ARFCNs are not supported as indicated in the band list below. GSM 380 1 (Unsupported) GSM 410 2 (Unsupported) GSM 450 3 GSM 480 4 GSM 710 5 (Unsupported) GSM 750 6 (Unsupported) GSM 810 7 (Unsupported) GSM 850 8 P-GSM 900 9 E-GSM 900 10 R-GSM 900 11 DCS 1800 13 PCS 1900 14 ER-GSM 900 15
member.param: An indicator used to assign the band to a specific technology, this avoids overlap with with technologies that have similar bands.
A band number associated with the technology specified.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.SelectFrontEnd(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Allows manual selection of the front end. Used when more than one front-end is connected. If a front end is not specified, will default to using SRFPort::RF_1 also known as front end one. When using AFE, this will indicate which frontends are allowed to be used by AFE. All other frontends available will be ignored by AFE. With AFE, if not specified AFE will attempt to use all all available front ends of a receiver for the measurement. Can be used as a bit mask, to select multiple front ends with AFE.
member.param: Frontend that should be used. Filled using SRFPort structure.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSM applications. The purpose is to control basic TSM functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
member.return: reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.ViComFastACDInterface
member.summary: This class can be used to automatically detect channels without knowing the corresponding radio frequencies. Note: All parameters are set by default. Functions only need to be called for minor tweaking! Note: Front end selection is not available for FastACD at this moment. Front end selection will be added with the next release. When using multiple receivers, FE1 will automatically be assigned.

member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an IoT measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
The time in milliseconds that the function should wait before returning an error, if the result buffer is empty.
member.return: One measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.ICViComNrInterface.GetBasicInterface
member.summary: The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSME applications. The purpose is to control basic TSME functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderResult.pcPduText
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the decoded PDU text, as zero terminated ASCII string.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderResult.dwStringLength
member.summary: Number of decoding result text bytes in the buffer (incl. terminating '\0').

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the standard (3GPP TS 36.331). It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF". In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): -Formatted exactly according to the standard. -Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. Is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: Pointer to demodulation result. If nullptr, no demodulation result is present.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored.

member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStopTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the last time in ms of signals used for this message. All IQ signals used to produce this demodulation result are in between dwStartTimeInMs and dwStopTimeInMs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStartTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the first time in ms of signals used for this message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwFirstBtsId
member.summary: The demodulator fills this parameter with the BTS ID the scanner assigned to this BTS first. If later on, the scanner uses a different BTS ID, but after demodulation it is detected that it is the same eNodeB, the demodulator fills this value with the first BTS ID the scanner used. Example: The scanner has measured a eNodeB with ID = 10 and the demodulator has demodulated it successfully. 20 minutes later the scanner found signals of a eNodeB with ID = 55. After demodulating, the demodulator finds out (by comparing unique BTS information from decoding), that it is the same gNodeB as the one with ID = 10. In this case, dwFirstBtsId will be set to 10.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::Beam::dwScannerBtsIdent. Each time the scanner is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known gNodeB, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same eNodeB could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single cell.

member.summary: Data container that holds information about the channel impulse responses measured in this cycle. The CIR consists of an optional power delay profile, and a list of peaks.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Ssb.fSsbSinrInDB
member.summary: Primary and secondary synchronization signal, PBCH and DM-RS reference signal received power (xSS-PBCH-RSRP), is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that primary, secondary sync signals, PBCH and demodulation reference signals configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth (max. 20 MHz).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Ssb.fSsbRsrqInDB
member.summary: Primary and secondary synchronization signal, PBCH and DM-RS reference signal received quality (xSS-PBCH-RSRP) is defined as the ratio of NPBCH-RSRP / NR carrier RSSI, where N is the number of resource blocks in the NR carrier RSSI measurement bandwidth. The measurements in the numerator and denominator shall be made over the same set of resource blocks. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Ssb.fSsbRsrpInDBm
member.summary: Primary and secondary synchronization signal, PBCH and DM-RS reference signal received power (xSS-PBCH-RSRP), is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that primary, secondary sync signals, PBCH and demodulation reference signals configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth (max. 20 MHz).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Ssb.dDeviceTimeInS

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Ssb
member.summary: Container for measurements based on the complete SSB consisting of primary (PSS) and secondary sync (SSS), PBCH and DM-RS signals.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SssPbch.fSssPbchSinrInDB
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal and PBCH signal-to-noise and interference ratio (SSS-PBCH SINR), is defined as the linear average over the power contribution (in [W]) of the resource elements carrying secondary synchronization signals, PBCH and demodulation reference signals (configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth, max. 20 MHz) divided by the linear average of the noise and interference power contribution (in [W]) over the resource elements carryingsecondary synchronization, PBCH and demodulation reference signals. Primary synchronization signals are excluded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SssPbch.fSssPbchRsrqInDB
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal and PBCH reference signal received quality (SSS-PBCH-RSRQ) is defined as the ratio of NPBCH-RSRP / NR carrier RSSI, where N is the number of resource blocks in the NR carrier RSSI measurement bandwidth. The measurements in the numerator and denominator shall be made over the same set of resource blocks. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SssPbch.fSssPbchRsrpInDBm
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal and PBCH reference signal received power (SSS-PBCH-RSRP), is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that secondary sync signals, PBCH and demodulation reference signals configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth (max. 20 MHz). Primary sync signals are excluded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SssPbch.dDeviceTimeInS
member.summary: Timestamp of the SS/PBCH block used for the secondary synchronization signal and PBCH reference signal (SSS-PBCH) measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SssPbch
member.summary: Container for measurements based on secondary sync (SSS) and PBCH signals.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.DmRs.fDmRsSinrInDB
member.summary: Demodulation reference signal-to-noise and interference ratio, is defined as the linear average over the power contribution (in [W]) of the resource elements carryingdemodulation reference signals (configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth, max. 20 MHz) divided by the linear average of the noise and interference power contribution (in [W]) over the resource elements carrying demodulation reference signals.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.DmRs.fDmRsRsrqInDB
member.summary: Demodulation reference signal received quality (PBCH-DMRS-RSRQ) is defined as the ratio of NPBCH-RSRP / NR carrier RSSI, where N is the number of resource blocks in the NR carrier RSSI measurement bandwidth. The measurements in the numerator and denominator shall be made over the same set of resource blocks. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.DmRs.fDmRsRsrpInDBm
member.summary: Demodulation reference signal received power (PBCH-DMRS-RSRP), is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that carry demodulation reference signals within the PBCH configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth (max. 20 MHz).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.DmRs.dDeviceTimeInS
member.summary: Timestamp of the SS/PBCH block used for demodulation reference signal (DM-RS) measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.DmRs
member.summary: Container for measurements based on demodulation reference signals (DM-RS).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.pMib
member.summary: Measurement results for MIB based on PBCH signals if pMib is not nullptr.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.fPbchSinrInDB
member.summary: PBCH SINR signal-to-noise and interference ratio, is defined as the linear average over the power contribution (in [W]) of the resource elements carryingPBCH signals (configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth) divided by the linear average of the noise and interference power contribution (in [W]) over the resource elements carryingPBCH reference signals. DM-RS excluded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.fPbchRsrqInDB

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.fPbchRsrpInDBm
member.summary: PBCH reference signal received power (PBCH-RSRP), is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that carry PBCH signals configured for RSRP measurements within the considered PBCH bandwidth (max. 20 MHz). DM-RS excluded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.Mib.dwRawPbchBits
member.summary: 32 bits of PBCH payload. MSB (0x8000000) is Bit 0 of PBCH payload, LSB (0x00000001) is bit 31 of PBCH payload. In case Bit 0 (choice bit) is not set, Bit 1 to 23 contain the MIB.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.Pbch.Mib
member.summary: Container for MIB measurements based on PBCH signals, see 3GPP TS 38.331. The raw PBCH bits are only measured once per SS/PBCH block.

member.summary: Container for measurements based on PBCH signals.

member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal error vector magnitude (SSS-EVM) in [dB]. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SSync.fSssSinrInDB
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal-to-noise and interference ratio (SSS-SINR), is defined as the linear average over the power contribution (in [W]) of the resource elements carrying secondary synchronization signals divided by the linear average of the noise and interference power contribution (in [W]) over the resource elements carrying secondary synchronization signals within the same frequency bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SSync.fSssRsrqInDB
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal reference signal received quality (SSS-RSRQ) is defined as the ratio of NSS-RSRP / NR carrier RSSI, where N is the number of resource blocks in the NR carrier RSSI measurement bandwidth. The measurements in the numerator and denominator shall be made over the same set of resource blocks. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.SSync.fSssRsrpInDBm
member.summary: Secondary synchronization signal reference signal received power (SSS-RSRP) is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that carry secondary synchronization signals (SSS).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SMeasResult.Signals.Beam.PSync.fPssRsrqInDB
member.summary: Primary synchronization signal reference signal received quality (PSS-RSRQ) is defined as the ratio of NSS-RSRP / NR carrier RSSI, where N is the number of resource blocks in the NR carrier RSSI measurement bandwidth. The measurements in the numerator and denominator shall be made over the same set of resource blocks. If not valid set to FLT_MAX.

member.summary: Primary synchronization signal reference signal received power (PSS-RSRP) is defined as the linear average over the power contributions (in [W]) of the resource elements that carry primary synchronization signals (PSS).

member.summary: The set of frequencies that shall be measured.

member.summary: Index to SConnectedReceiverTable::Receiver of the currently selected receiver.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SSettings
member.summary: This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom Nr scanner module. It is a result of the CViComNrInterface::GetSettings() method.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodulationSettings.sStartMeasurementRequests
member.summary: The requests for the general start measurement command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodulationSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodulationSettings.sSINRThresholdDB100
member.summary: SINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dB. For SINR All resource elements of the SS/PBCH block excluding the PSS symbol, so SSS, DM-RS and PBCH RE's in the measured bandwidth are included. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodulationSettings
member.summary: This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.pDemodRequests
member.summary: Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be nullptr, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.dwCountOfRequests
member.summary: Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.wRepetitionTimeOutInMs
member.summary: Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.eDemodulationMode
member.summary: The mode used for BCH demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.ePDU
member.summary: The PDU to be demodulated.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::pTableOfFrequencySetting.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(0,<sp></sp>SIB4,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB5,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>10000,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 SC 5 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): (0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>CHANNEL_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>3,<sp></sp>5)(1,<sp></sp>PDU_FOR_SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>1000,<sp></sp>4,<sp></sp>5)@note You are responsible to manage memory, when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION_PER_BEAM
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionTimeOutInMs. Results are provided for each SSB index / beam. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.ONCE_PER_BEAM
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel once for each SSB index / beam. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If wRepetitionTimeOutInMs is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionTimeOutInMs. Results are provided for the strongest SS/PBCH block only. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command for demodulation requests the demodulation. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. Results are provided for the strongest SS/PBCH block only. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequests structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel
member.summary: In the RS-CINR calculation a channel model is used to specify limits for maximum Doppler frequency and maximum delay spread. This model is used to separate reference signal power and interference power. If the model allows less freedom (maximal possible variation) to Doppler frequency and delay spread the RS-CINR result accuracy may be improved. The measurement accuracy may not be guaranteed if true signal propagation parameters exceed the limits specified in the channel model!

member.summary: Synchronization rate value if not set to SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE. Value Range: 100...5000, default 1000. This parameter overrides dwMeasRatePer1000Sec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SFrequencySetting.CellDefiningSSB.AdvancedSettings.enSfnRepetitionPeriod
member.summary: According to 3GPP SFN increases with each radio frame. For setups including a signal generator this is often not true, as the SFN sequence repeats after a specific number of radio frames. In order to provide correct signal detection the PBCH decoder needs to know that the SFN repeats after the given number of radio frames, thus a mismatch will lead to decreased signal detection. The minimum SFN must be a multiple of the given number. So in case that 64 Frames are generated the SFNs shall run from 0...63 or 64...127 or 128...191 or ... or 960...1023.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.NR.SFrequencySetting.CellDefiningSSB.AdvancedSettings.enSSBMapping

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that receive notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

SetTgSpectrumConfiguration is used to update the time gated spectrum settings during an active measurement.
@param[in] spectrumSettings Contains the definition which spectrum settings shall be applied. This is only allowed for measurements with active time gated spectrum. Not supported yet!

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sSINRThresholdDB100
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSME applications. The purpose is to control basic TSME functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
@return reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.
NR measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all NR related measurement tasks. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an LTE measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
The time in milliseconds that the function should wait before returning an error, if the result buffer is empty.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. PDUs may be acquired for certain eNodeBs. PDU demodulation for eNodeBs or for channels may be reset.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.GetChannelState(System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetChannelState returns the current status of the configurable settings from the channel.
member.param: Specifies the 0-basd channel index to be queried.
member.return: Returns an object of SChannelState which contains the current state for the channel. The items in SChannelState can be modified during a running measurement using the ModifyChannel method. SChannelState and ModifyChannel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.ModifyChannel(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.AddChannel(System.Double,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.FrameStructureType.Type)
member.summary: AddChannel is used to create additional channels during a running measurement. The measurement settings from channel index 0, as configured by SetConfiguration(), are used for the new channel. @note This method can not be called in the idle state (IsMeasurementStarted() must return TRUE) @note Each channel combination can only be added once. Attempting to add a combination multiple times will return the index that is already present.
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
Frame structure for the channel (TDD/FDD).
member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterface.SetConfiguration(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodulationSettings!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: CViComLteInterfaceData::SChannelSettings contains the count of channels or frequencies and the table of frequencies in MHz. The frequency or channel index is counted from zero and referenced in other data e.g. BCH demodulation settings. The selection of new frequencies causes default settings for the BCH demodulation. This function also sets the general BCH demodulation properties, including the LTE Layer 3 PDUs that should be demodulated. Different sets of PDUs may be read from different BCH channels.
member.param: Contains the definition which frequencies shall be measured. SChannelSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.
Contains the definition which PDUs of BCH shall be measured. SDemodulationSettings for a more detailed description on those settings.

member.summary: LTE measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all LTE related measurement tasks.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.UnregisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.summary: Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
member.param: The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.RegisterResultDataListener(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.CViComLteInterfaceDataProcessor)
member.param: The object that shall be notified when new measurement data is available. This must not be null. If the listener has already been registered to the interface, it will not be registered a second time. Instead, an error will be indicated.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.RetrieveTextForPDU(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Issue a request to the Layer 3 Decoder to decode the PDU contained by rSL3DecoderRequest. If the data has been decoded successfully within the time given by dwTimeOutInMs, the method creates the SL3DecoderResult and the buffer within on the heap, fills in the Layer 3 Decoder result and returns a pointer to it.
member.param: Contains the data that was the result of an LTE measurement and holds the PDU data that shall be decoded.
The time in milliseconds that the function should wait before returning an error, if the result buffer is empty.
member.return: one measurement result on the heap, if the function succeeded. Otherwise NULL. Attention: The returned pointer is only valid until this function is called again.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.GetSettings
member.summary: By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
member.return: pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.IssueDemodRequests(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: Use this function to issue commands (PDU requests, reset commands) for the BCH demodulator during measurement. PDUs may be acquired for certain eNodeBs. PDU demodulation for eNodeBs or for channels may be reset.
member.param: When the function is called, this pointer contains the request parameters. For details see SDemodRequests.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.GetChannelState(System.UInt32)
member.summary: GetChannelState returns the current status of the configurable settings from the channel.
member.param: Specifies the 0-basd channel index to be queried.
member.return: Returns an object of SChannelState which contains the current state for the channel. The items in SChannelState can be modified during a running measurement using the ModifyChannel method. SChannelState and ModifyChannel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.ModifyChannel(RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst)
member.summary: ModifyChannel is used to modify configurable channel settings during a running measurement. SChannelState for items that can be modified.
member.param: sChannelState contains the modified settings to be changed in the channel.

member.name: M:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.ICViComLteInterface.AddChannel(System.Double,RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.FrameStructureType.Type)
member.summary: AddChannel is used to create additional channels during a running measurement. The measurement settings from channel index 0, as configured by SetConfiguration(), are used for the new channel. @note This method can not be called in the idle state (IsMeasurementStarted() must return TRUE) @note Each channel combination can only be added once. Attempting to add a combination multiple times will return the index that is already present.
member.param: Center frequency in Hertz for the channel.
Frame structure for the channel (TDD/FDD).
member.return: If success, the 0-based channel index for new channel is returned. If failure, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned indicating an invalid channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderResult.pcPduText
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the decoded PDU text, as zero terminated ASCII string.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderResult.dwStringLength
member.summary: Number of decoding result text bytes in the buffer (incl. terminating '\0').

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the LTE standard (3GPP TS 36.331). It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF". In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): -Formatted exactly according to the standard. -Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. Is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRatesTotal
member.summary: Measurement rate for all LTE channels. In the case of one channel is measured with 5 and another one with 2 per second we expect an total meas rate of 7. If ListOfSignals has elements then the given measurement rate values correspond to narrowband measurements. Otherwise they are wideband.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRates
member.summary: Measurement rate for the given LTE channel (dwChannelIndex). List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. If ListOfSignals has elements then the given measurement rate values correspond to narrowband measurements. Otherwise they are wideband.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbActiveAntennaMask
member.summary: Bits 0 to 3 are set to indicate that antenna port 0 to antenna port 3 are active if pbActiveAntennaMask is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.wPhysicalCellId
member.summary: The physical Cell ID, which can take one from the values defined by [0;503].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: < Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.bIsLteM

member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStopTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the last time in ms of signals used for this message. All IQ signals used to produce this demodulation result are in between dwStartTimeInMs and dwStopTimeInMs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStartTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the first time in ms of signals used for this message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwFirstBtsId
member.summary: The demodulator fills this parameter with the BTS ID the scanner assigned to this BTS first. If later on, the scanner uses a different BTS ID, but after demodulation it is detected that it is the same eNodeB, the demodulator fills this value with the first BTS ID the scanner used. Example: The scanner has measured a eNodeB with ID = 10 and the demodulator has demodulated it successfully. 20 minutes later the scanner found signals of a eNodeB with ID = 55. After demodulating, the demodulator finds out (by comparing unique BTS information from decoding), that it is the same eNodeB as the one with ID = 10. In this case, dwFirstBtsId will be set to 10.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. Each time the scanner is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known eNodeB, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same eNodeB could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single cell.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SENodeBInformation.bEndcIsSupported
member.summary: Indicates if dual connectivity with 5GNR (ENDC) is supported. Note: This is an indication if ENDC is supported by any PLMN on the eNodeB. FALSE - 0 TRUE - 1 UNKNOWN - SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SENodeBInformation.bDssIsSupported
member.summary: Indicates if Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS) of LTE and 5GNR is supported. FALSE - 0 TRUE - 1 UNKNOWN - SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SENodeBInformation.bLteMIsSupported
member.summary: Indicates if LTE-M (LTE Cat-M1) is supported. FALSE - 0 TRUE - 1 UNKNOWN - SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SENodeBInformation
member.summary: Summary information about the eNodeB configuration, such LTE-M, Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS), etc. Each element is only valid, if its value is not set to an INVALID value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwRadioFrameNumber
member.summary: (Virtual) Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to current PDU, i.e. this RFN indicates the same radio frame as the SFN. See explanation for SMaxPeak::dwRadioFrameNumber.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info.dwSystemFrameNumber
member.summary: The is the 10 bit System Frame Number. According to 3GPP TS 36.331, the LTE MIB provides the 8 most significant bits of the System Frame Number (SFN). As indicated in 3GPP TS 36.211[21, 6.6.1], the 2 least significant bits of the SFN are acquired implicitly in the P-BCH decoding, i.e. timing of 40ms P-BCH TTI indicates 2 least significant bits (within 40ms P-BCH TTI, the first radio frame : 00, the second radio frame : 01, the third radio frame : 10, the last radio frame : 11).

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.SSFN_Info
member.summary: Optional information about system radio frame numbers. Can only be valid for MIB PDU. Each element is only valid, if its value is not SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.dwScannerBtsIdent
F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix.pComplexCoefficient
member.summary: < Complex coefficient of the H matrix in sqrt(mW). Complex coefficients are stored column by column. Which means the pComplexCoefficient array effectively stores the transposed matrix H'. For MxN MIMO and H with M rows and N columns [ h11 h12 . . . h1N ] [ h21 h22 . . . h2N ] H = . . . . [ . . . . ] . . . . [ hM1 hM2 . . . hMN ] the coefficient hij, for i in {1...M}, j in {1...N}, is available by way of pComplexCoefficient[ (i-1) + (j-1)M ]. For example: [ h11 h12 h13 h14 ] H = [ h21 h22 h23 h24 ] => pComplexCoefficient array: [ h11 h21 h12 h22 h13 h23 h14 h24 ] If 2x2 and 2x4 MIMO measurements are enabled, only the 2x4 matrix is returned, since the 2x2 matrix is a subset of the 2x4 matrix. E.g. the first four coefficients represent the 2x2 case [ h11 h21 h12 h22 ]. Similarly, if 4x4 MIMO measurements are enabled, only the 4x4 matrix is returned.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix.dwCountOfComplexCoefficients
member.summary: Number of values available in pComplexCoefficient if pComplexCoefficient is not NULL.

member.summary: Optional condition number for the channel matrix (H matrix) if pwConditionNumber4x4MimoInDB100 is not NULL. The condition number has the format 100 10 lg( max eigenvalue / min eigenvalue ).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix.pwConditionNumber2x4MimoInDB100
member.summary: Optional condition number for the channel matrix (H matrix) if pwConditionNumber2x4MimoInDB100 is not NULL. The condition number has the format 100 10 lg( max eigenvalue / min eigenvalue ).

member.summary: Optional rank for the channel matrix (H matrix) if pRank is not NULL. The estimated rank of H ~H with respect to the CINR for 2x4 MIMO measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix.pbRankFor2x2Mimo
member.summary: Optional rank for the channel matrix (H matrix) if pRank is not NULL. The estimated rank of H ~H with respect to the CINR for 2x2 MIMO measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix.psChannelMatrixCinrInDB100
member.summary: Optional CINR value used in the channel matrix (H matrix) if psChannelMatrixCinrInDB100 is not NULL.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SMimoResult.SChannelMatrix
member.summary: Optional container for channel matrices (H matrix) if pChannelMatrix is not NULL. The total measurement count resp. the number of available MIMO channel matrices is wRBNumberOfBts wNumberOfMeasTimes. E.g. wRBNumberOfBts == 50 and wNumberOfMeasTimes == 4 means this BTS has a system bandwidth of 50 RBs and there are 4 channel matrices for every resource block, in total 200 matrices. The matrix ordering is first measured matrix first and lower RB number (lower frequency) first, e.g. [ H_RB0_T0 H_RB1_T0 ... H_RBn_T0 H_RB0_T1 H_RB1_T1 H_RBn_T1 ... ] with RBx is a RB index and Tx is a time index.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.ListOfTddInterferer
member.summary: List of TDD interference analysis results for the current channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.ListOfPowerValues
member.summary: List of power values measured for the current channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.pCir
member.summary: This is NULL if no CIR information is available

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.fStdDevTimeDriftInPpm
member.summary: The measured standard deviation of the time drift, given in parts per million (ppm). fAverageTimeDriftInPpm for more information.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.fAverageTimeDriftInPpm
member.summary: The measured average time drift of the eNodeB with respect to the TSMx receiver timing, given in parts per million (ppm). The drift is comprised of two parts: -Drift associated with the relative motion between the eNodeB and TSMx receiver. -Difference in the clock rates between the eNodeB and TSMx receiver. If the TSMx receiver is synchronized with GPS, the drift gives an indication of clock rate error in the eNodeB. To convert to nanoseconds per second, multiply ppm by 1000, 1.0 ppm = 1000 ns/sec.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.bExceededDriftLimit
member.summary: TRUE if the average time drift limit fAverageTimeDriftInPpm exceeded the threshold SChannelSettings::fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm, FALSE if the drift is below threshold or if threshold is not used (fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm = 0).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.pfSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB
member.summary: P-SYNC to S-SYNC ratio that has been measured. The result is within the interval given in SFrequencySetting::SSyncToPSyncRatio. This is an optional value and only valid if the pointer is not equal to NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.enFrameStructureType
member.summary: Type of the channel: FDD or TDD

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.bNumberOfSymbolsPerSlot
member.summary: Number of LTE symbols per slot. Can either be 6 or 7 symbols.
