member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfPSyncQualityInDB
member.summary: P-SYNC quality derived from the pfCinrPSyncInDB. Only available if pfPSyncQualityInDB is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfPSyncRssiInDBm
member.summary: Comprises the linear average of the total received power observed only in OFDM symbols containing P-SYNC Signals over the center 62 resource elements, including co-channel serving and non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise etc. Only available if pfPSyncRssiInDBm is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfPSyncPowerInDBm
member.summary: Calculated from fPowerInDBm and SSignals::pfSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB. P-SYNC power of this special eNodeB. Only available if pfPSyncPowerInDBm is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfSSyncQualityInDB
member.summary: S-SYNC quality derived from the pfCinrSSyncInDB. Only available if pfSSyncQualityInDB is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfSSyncRssiInDBm
member.summary: Optional value. Comprises the linear average of the total received power observed only in OFDM symbols containing S-SYNC Signals over the center 62 resource elements, including co-channel serving and non-serving cells, adjacent channel interference, thermal noise etc.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfAmpBasedCinrSSyncInDB
member.summary: Optional CINR of the S-SYNC based on amplitude noise. Only available if pfAmpBasedCinrSSyncInDB is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfAmpBasedCinrPSyncInDB
member.summary: Optional CINR of the P-SYNC based on amplitude noise. Only available if pfAmpBasedCinrPSyncInDB is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfCinrSSyncInDB
member.summary: Optional CINR of the S-SYNC. Only available if not NULL and value > 0 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pfCinrPSyncInDB
member.summary: Optional CINR of the P-SYNC signal. As the P-SYNC is not unique for a special eNodeB, this value is based on the combined signal received from all eNodeB's using the same P-SYNC. Only available if not NULL and value > 0 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.fCinrInDB
member.summary: This is either the CINR of the S-SYNC only or an averaged CINR of P-SYNC and S-SYNC. This depends on the value of the pfCinrPSyncInDB and pfCinrSSyncInDB. If both are not available, this is S-SYNC CINR only. The number of symbols from which the CINR is calculated is determined in the same way as described for fPowerInDBm. Otherwise, it's the averaged value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.fPowerInDBm
member.summary: Power of S-SYNC signal. The power of the P-SYNC signal can be calculated from this using the pfSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB. This will give us the P-SYNC power of this special eNodeB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue.pdwTimeFromStartOfBlockInNs
member.summary: Offset of the OFDM symbol that has been used to retrieve the power value. If NULL, a complete LTE block has been used.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SPowerValue
member.summary: Power values measured on the S-SYNC. The power is either retrieved from the complete LTE block (19-20 OFDM symbols), or from a single OFDM symbol. The former case is true when the pdwTimeFromStartOfBlockInNs is not set.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pRefSignalCirResults
member.summary: Reference signal CIR results if pRefSignalCirResults is not NULL. Bit 0 to 3 of bDetectedTransmitAntennaPorts is set when the CIR has been measured for the corresponding antenna port 0 to 3.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.dwCountOfRefSignalCirResults
member.summary: Number of values available in pRefSignalCirResults array if pRefSignalCirResults is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pwSpecialSubframe6Config
member.summary: Configuration of a TD-LTE special subframe at position 6 if pwSpecialSubframe6Config is not NULL. E.g. for configuration 0 bit 0 (1<<0) is set. Configuration 0 to 9 are possible.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pwSpecialSubframe1Config
member.summary: Configuration of a TD-LTE special subframe at position 1 if pwSpecialSubframe1Config is not NULL. E.g. for configuration 0 bit 0 (1<<0) is set. Configuration 0 to 9 are possible.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pNarrowbandRSRPinDBm100
member.summary: Narrowband RSRP result with subband resolution if pNarrowbandRSRPinDBm100 is not NULL. For description of the result order and resolution see bRsCinrMeasResultConfig.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pNarrowbandRsCinrValues
member.summary: < Narrowband RS-CINR result if pNarrowbandRsCinrValues is not NULL. For description of the result order see bRsCinrMeasResultConfig.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.dwCountOfNarrowbandRsCinrValues
member.summary: Number of values available in pNarrowbandRsCinrValues array if pNarrowbandRsCinrValues is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.bRsCinrMeasResultConfig
member.summary: Narrowband RS-CINR measurements taken for antenna port 0 to 3. The bits SFrequencySetting::wCENTER_RSCINR_xxx are set if the specific measurement was done. The results are stored in the pNarrowbandRsCinrValues array. The number and order of the results is defined by taken measurements indicated in this byte array. Lower antenna port results are stored first (highest priority), lower subbandwidth first, subbands with lower center frequency first. E.g. 6x180kHz (wCENTER_RSCINR_6x180KHZ) before 3x360kHz (wCENTER_RSCINR_3x360KHZ).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.sPBCHbasedRSRQinDB100
member.summary: RSRQ value based on sCenterRSRPinDBm100 and the total inband power in resource blocks used to transmit the PBCH within the 100 ms IQ data block analysed with the scanner. SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE, if no reference signal measurement was done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.sPBCHbasedRSRPinDBm100
member.summary: Gives the RSRP value based on the reference signal power measurement of the 6 innermost resource blocks (1MHz BW around center frequency at symbols used for the PBCH) in 0.01 dBm. SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE, if no reference signal measurement was done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.bNumberOfSymbolsUsedForRSRQ
member.summary: Number of symbols used for RSRQ measurements. 0, if no reference signal measurement was done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.pbUpDownLinkConfig
member.summary: Optional Up- / Downlink configuration used for the TD-LTE RSRP measurement if pbUpDownLinkConfig is not NULL. E.g. for Up- / Downlink configuration 2 bit 2 (1<<2) is set. Configuration 0 to 6 are supported for TDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.bDetectedTransmitAntennaPorts
member.summary: Detected transmit antenna ports of the eNodeB. Bit 0 to Bit 3 is set when the corresponding antenna port 0 to 3 is detected by the scanner. 0, if no reference signal measurement was done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal.bAntennaMaskUsedForRSRP
member.summary: If 0, no reference signal measurement was done and sPBCHbasedRSRPinDBm100 and sPBCHbasedRSRQinDB100 are not valid. Bit 0 to Bit 1 is set when the corresponding antenna 0 to 1 was used for RSRP measurement. Regarding TS36.214 only antenna port 0 and 1 is used for RSRP measurement.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SReferenceSignal
member.summary: Reference Signal measurement results. Only available if measurements have been activated using SFrequencySetting::wNarrowbandRefSignalMeasMode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.pMaxPeak
member.summary: Maximum peak in the Channel Impulse Response if pMaxPeak is not NULL. This result will only be provided, if the peak list is not empty, PPS has been acquired and the Time of Arrival feature has been enabled (i.e. 0 < SSettings::dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs). In addition, it will take about 100 s from start of measurement, before the first results are provided. @note : This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.ListOfPeaks
member.summary: List of CIR peaks found in the signal.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.pPowerDelayProfile
member.summary: Optional power profile measurement further detailing the CIR measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: Time when the first CIR sample has been measured, related to the device internal clock.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: Calculated time of the first CIR sample based on start of the operating system (GetTickCount()).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.dwRadioFrameNumber
member.summary: Virtual Radio Frame Number (RFN) assigned to each radio frame received. The RFN counting is started for each new combination of Channel, Physical Cell ID and BTS ID, i.e. dwChannelIndex, wPhysicalCellId, dwBtsId.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec
member.summary: Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival (TOA) and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. According to 3GPP TS36.211 Chapter 4, the LTE FDD & TDD radio frames have 10 ms length. In case of LTE FDD, the following must be considered: According to 3GPP TS36.211 Chapter "4.1 Frame structure type 1", the LTE FDD Frame can be treated as one complete radio frame. To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the radio frame length (+/- 10 ms / 2 => 5 ms), the provided dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec must be processed according to he following principle: double dFrameDelay_ms = ( (1000dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec + 5 ms) modulo 10 ms ) - 5 ms. In case of LTE TDD, the following must be considered: According to 3GPP TS36.211 Chapter "4.2 Frame structure type 2", the LTE TDD Frame consists of two 5 ms subframes for each complete radio frame. Therefore, if you want to calculate the radio frame delay, you must use the half radio frame length (5 ms). To determine the frame delay as value within +/- half of the length considered (+/- 5 ms / 2 => 2.5 ms), you must add this half length value, apply a 5 ms modulo calculation and then subtract the half length value. If you do so, you get the correct offset values: Example: Assume you got two measurement values, 5.2 and 9.8 ms. The offset to PPS has to be calculated as ( (5.2 ms + 2.5 ms) modulo 5 ms) - 2.5 ms ==> 0.2 ms delay ( (9.8 ms + 2.5 ms) modulo 5 ms) - 2.5 ms ==> -0.2 ms delay, i.e. 0.2 ms ahead. @note This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak.pMaxPeakInfo
member.summary: Pointer to the maximum element of the CIR Peak list. This value is not optional, it is a pointer to avoid copying data.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SMaxPeak
member.summary: Contains information about the maximum peak in the Channel Impulse Response.

member.summary: Delay in seconds related to the first sample. This normally provides a higher resolution than the sampling time from the power delay measurement results (see above).

member.summary: Contains information about the single peaks in the Channel Impulse Response.

member.summary: Sampling time for a CIR measurement. This is also the time between two CIR measurements.

member.summary: Estimated noise level. Power values which are in the vicinity of this value can be considered to be caused or influenced by noise.

member.summary: array that holds dwCountOfValues elements, each specifying a power delay value in 100th dBm (e.g. a value of -6719 is to be read as -67.19 dBm). Can be SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE when a value could not be measured

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.SPowerDelayProfileValues.dwCountOfValues
member.summary: number of elements available in the psValuesInDBm100 array

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile.SPowerDelayProfileValues
member.summary: A (possibly empty) set of power delay values. This list contains the CIR power values, where each power value has been measured fSamplingTimeInSec seconds after the previous one. The first sample in here has been measured at u64DeviceTimeInNs resp. dwPcTimeStampInMs. The list may contain invalid values, which denote that at that specific time there was no CIR measurement possible.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir.SPowerDelayProfile
member.summary: Structure containing the actual CIR measurement results combined with delay information.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals.SCir
member.summary: Optional data container that holds information about the channel impulse responses measured in this cycle. The CIR consists of an optional power delay profile, and a list of peaks. Channel impulse responses are calculated from a 100ms block.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult.SSignals
member.summary: Actual power values measured for a single server

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SMeasResult
member.summary: The LTE measurement result for a single channel returned by CViComLteInterface::GetResult().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_COMPLEX_VALUE.fImag
member.summary: Imaginary part of the complex number.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_COMPLEX_VALUE.fReal
member.summary: Real part of the complex number.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_COMPLEX_VALUE
member.summary: Complex value used for channel matrix values of MIMO measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE.ConfidenceInterval95PercentOfsRsCinrInDB100
member.summary: The confidence interval for 95% for the value sRsCinrInDB100. The 95% confidence interval corresponds to the 2 sigma distance in a Gaussian distribution.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE.ConfidenceInterval68PercentOfsRsCinrInDB100
member.summary: The confidence interval for 68% for the value sRsCinrInDB100. The 68% confidence interval corresponds to the 1 sigma distance in a Gaussian distribution.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE.sRsCinrInDB100
member.summary: Subband RS-CINR meas result in 0.01 dB or SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE if invalid. The value is the maximum likelihood result of the measured probability function for the RS-CINR value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE.sLinAverageREpowerInDBm100
member.summary: Average power of all resource elements used for sRsCinrInDB100. The average calculation is done in Watt not in dB. SDefs::INVALID_SHORT_VALUE if invalid.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE
member.summary: Container for subband RS-CINR meas results used for narrowband / wideband RS-CINR measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RATIO_CONFIDENCE_INTERVALL.bDeviationToHigherRatioInDB10
member.summary: 0..25.4 dB distance from maximum likelihood value. SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE is used when the confidence interval is bigger.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RATIO_CONFIDENCE_INTERVALL.bDeviationToLowerRatioInDB10
member.summary: 0..25.4 dB distance from maximum likelihood value. SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE is used when the confidence interval is bigger.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.S_LTE_RATIO_CONFIDENCE_INTERVALL
member.summary: Confidence interval of a value. The value is inside the interval with a defined probability (confidence probability). The interval is defined from (maximum likelihood value - bDeviationToLowerRatioInDB10) to (maximum likelihood value + bDeviationToHigherRatioInDB10). The maximum likelihood value has to be given outside this structure. Used in S_LTE_RS_CINR_VALUE.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SSettings
member.summary: This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViComLTE scanner module. It is a result of the CViComLteInterface::GetSettings() method.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodulationSettings.sStartMeasurementRequests
member.summary: The requests for the general start measurement command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodulationSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodulationSettings.sSINRThresholdDB100
member.summary: SINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dBm. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodulationSettings
member.summary: This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.pDemodRequests
member.summary: Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be NULL, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.dwCountOfRequests
member.summary: Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.wRepetitionTimeOutInMs
member.summary: Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.eDemodulationMode
member.summary: The mode used for BCH demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.ePDU
member.summary: The PDU to be demodulated.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::pTableOfFrequencySetting.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(0,<sp></sp>SIB4,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB5,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>10000,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): (0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>CHANNEL_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>3)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>1000,<sp></sp>4) Note that you are responsible to manage the memory when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). Note: All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command for demodulation requests the demodulation. Only to be used in start measurement. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the LTE / LTE-M BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.Pdu
member.summary: This enumeration defines IDs for the LTE Layer 3 PDUs. Use this in the SDemodRequest structure to specify which PDUs shall be decoded.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.bDriftScanning
member.summary: Setting bDriftScanning to TRUE will enable LTE drift scanning in ViCom to track drifting eNodeBs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.fDriftWarningThresholdInPpm
member.summary: When an eNodeB is detected to be drifting in excess of this threshold, the value SMeasResult::SSignals::bExceededDriftLimit is set to TRUE. The threshold is set in units of parts per million (ppm). 1 ppm = 1000 ns/sec. @note The flag bDriftScanning must be enabled in order to set this value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.pTableOfFrequencySetting
member.summary: This array of structures can be filled with single frequency configurations. Only dwCount entries from this table will be used.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.dwCount
member.summary: Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.bTddInterferenceKpiThresholdInPct
member.summary: Configuration for TDD interference analysis. Disabled for bTddInterferenceKpiThresholdInPct == 0. If > 0 detailed reports for cells having an interference KPI value above or equal to the specified one are provided in SMeasResult::SSignals::ListOfTddInterferer. This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver. Also PDU::SIB1 has to be requested for channels with interference analysis.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs
member.summary: Length of the sliding window for Time of Arrival averaging in ms. Values in the near past of the current value contribute more to the average than older values. Values older than dwToaAvgWindowLengthMs will contribute significantly less to the average value. If > 1, this value is treated as double Sigma threshold of a Gaussian distribution in time, on which the averaging is based. If 1, results are provided without averaging. If 0, feature deactivated, no ToA processing and no results. This is the default!

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SMbmsRsCinrChannelModel.dwSpeedInKmPerHour
member.summary: The maximum speed (velocity) of the measurement platform in km / h. The relative platform to base station velocity gives the rise to the maximum Doppler frequencies in Hz: (CenterFrequency in Hz) dwSpeedInKmPerHour / ( 3.6 3e8 )

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SMbmsRsCinrChannelModel.dwMaxSpeedInKmh
member.summary: Maximum speed, 250 km/h.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SMbmsRsCinrChannelModel.dwMinSpeedInKmh

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SMbmsRsCinrChannelModel.dwOutdoorMaxSpeedInKmh

member.summary: The maximum expected delay spread (time difference of arrival) between the signal received from different RF paths.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SMbmsRsCinrChannelModel.dwMaxDelaySpreadInNs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel.dwDelaySpreadInNs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel.dwMaxDelaySpreadInNs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel.dwMinDelaySpreadInNs
member.summary: Minimum delay spread, 0.5 us.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel.dwIndoorDelaySpreadInNs

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel.dwOutdoorDelaySpreadInNs
member.summary: Typical 3 us for outdoor environments.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings.SRsCinrChannelModel
member.summary: In the RS-CINR calculation a channel model is used to specify limits for maximum Doppler frequency and maximum delay spread. This model is used to separate reference signal power and interference power. If the model allows less freedom (maximal possible variation) to Doppler frequency and delay spread the RS-CINR result accuracy may be improved. The measurement accuracy may not be guaranteed if true signal propagation parameters exceed the limits specified in the channel model!

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelSettings
member.summary: This structure holds the measurement setup for the LTE measurement. It basically consists of the set of frequencies that shall be measured.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.enDssMode
member.summary: DSS configuration control mode. Specifies how the DSS configuration is determined by the LTE scanner.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.enSSyncToPSyncRatioType
member.summary: Specify what kind of S-SYNC to P-SYNC ratios are specified in the SSyncToPSyncRatio member, either the list of ratio values or a range. A power ratio is specified in dB. A value of 0 means that both signals have the same power, a value of 3 means the S-SYNC has a signal power which is about two times stronger than the on the P-SYNC.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocks
member.summary: Number of resource blocks to use for this channel, if BandwidthCtrlMode is set to BW_KNOWN. E.g. 50 RB's for 10 MHz channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor20000kHzChBw
member.summary: 20 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor15000kHzChBw
member.summary: 15 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor10000kHzChBw
member.summary: 10 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor5000kHzChBw
member.summary: 5 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor3000kHzChBw
member.summary: 3 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNumberOfResourceBlocksFor1400kHzChBw
member.summary: 1.4 MHz LTE channel bandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.enBandwidthCtrlMode
member.summary: Bandwidth control mode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wSpecialSubframe6ConfigurationMask
member.summary: This value is used for RSRP and RSRQ measurements in TDD configurations. When no bit is set than no RSRP measurement is done in TDD networks. Else we try the given special subframe configuration specified by the bits set. E.g. when special subframe configuration 2 and 4 is possible in the network than bit 2 (1<<2) and 4 (1<<4) shall be set. Configuration 0 to 9 are supported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wSpecialSubframe1ConfigurationMask
member.summary: This value is used for RSRP and RSRQ measurements in TDD configurations. When no bit is set than no RSRP measurement is done in TDD networks. Else we try the given special subframe configuration specified by the bits set. E.g. when special subframe configuration 2 and 4 is possible in the network than bit 2 (1<<2) and 4 (1<<4) shall be set. Configuration 0 to 9 are supported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wAllSpecialSubFrameConfigurations
member.summary: Special subframe configuration 0 to 9.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.bUpDownLinkMask
member.summary: This value is used for RSRP and RSRQ measurements in TDD configurations. When no bit is set than no RSRP measurement is done in TDD networks. Else we try the given uplink-downlink configuration specified by the bits set. E.g. when uplink-downlink configuration 2 and 4 is possible in the network than bit 2 (1<<2) and 4 (1<<4) shall be set. Configuration 0 to 6 are supported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.bAllUpDownLinkConfigurations
member.summary: Uplink-downlink configuration 0 to 6.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNarrowbandRefSignalMeasMode
member.summary: Narrowband Reference Signal measurement modes. Used to configure if narrowband RSRP/Q and RS-CINR measurements shall be done or not. 0 means no measurements. Measurements are performed only if enMbmsConfigCtrlMode is set to MBMS_NOT_PRESENT. Note that the carrier sections are only than on resource block boundaries, when the total number of resource blocks is even (e.g. in 10 MHz or 20MHz). If the number of resource blocks is odd (e.g. in 5MHz bandwidth) the boundary of the measurement sections are in the middle of a resource block. That gives a reason to use sub band notation in kHz rather than Resource Block notation. For other measurements see defines above. wNARROWBAND_RSRP_RSRQ is used to generally activate narrowband RSRP/Q and RS-CINR measurements. Any combination of wCENTER_RSCINR_xxx is allowed. As the 1 MHz input filter is designed for SYNC signal measurements we produce some internal interference with this filter. This interference can be taken into account for the RS-CINR measurement. Therefore optionally set one of the two w1MHZ_FILTERN_NOISE_FOR_xxx defines. The narrwoband RS-CINR measurement is a requirement for wideband RS-CINR measurements. Therefore set a least wNARROWBAND_RSRP_RSRQ | wCENTER_RSCINR_6x180KHZ if you want to do wideband RS-CINR measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wNARROWBAND_RSRP_RSRQ
member.summary: Enable narrowband RSRP/Q and RS-CINR measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wCENTER_RSCINR_6x180KHZ
member.summary: The reference carrier narrowband RS-CINR is measured in 6 sections within the innermost 1080 kHz band of the LTE channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wCENTER_RSCINR_3x360KHZ
member.summary: The reference carrier narrowband RS-CINR is measured in 3 sections within the innermost 1080 kHz band of the LTE channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wCENTER_RSCINR_2x540KHZ
member.summary: The reference carrier narrowband RS-CINR is measured in 2 sections within the innermost 1080 kHz band of the LTE channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.wCENTER_RSCINR_1x1080KHZ
member.summary: The reference carrier narrowband RS-CINR is measured in 1 section within the innermost 1080 kHz band of the LTE channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.w1MHZ_FILTER_NOISE_FOR_6RB
member.summary: Filter noise reduction for the narrowband RS-CINR calculation assuming a narrowband LTE signal (BW = 1.4 MHz / 6 RBs). This is done only for RS-CINR values > 20 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.w1MHZ_FILTER_NOISE_FOR_15RB
member.summary: Filter noise reduction for the narrowband RS-CINR calculation assuming a wideband LTE signal (BW >= 3 MHz). This is done only for RS-CINR values > 20 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwAvgBlockCountPer1000Sec
member.summary: Averaged measurement rate in 0.001 Hertz. The device attempts to perform the desired number of measurements, but it is not guaranteed that the number of measurements is performed each second. In general, the device tries to achieve the desired rate averaged over a longer period of time. For default value and range see GetMeasRateLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.enFrameStructureType
member.summary: Frame structure type of the channel aka duplex mode: FDD or TDD

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwSymbolsPerSlotMask
member.summary: Number of OFDM symbols per slot. Can be any combination of dwLTE_xSYMBOLS constants as defined above. Must not be 0.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwDefaultSymbolsPerSlot
member.summary: Default symbol configuration that should be used to set dwSymbolsPerSlotMask if no details are known about the network to be measured upfront.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwLTE_7SYMBOLS
member.summary: 7 OFDM Symbols

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwLTE_6SYMBOLS
member.summary: 6 OFDM Symbols

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dCenterFrequencyInHz
member.summary: The center frequency on which the LTE signals shall be measured. For value range see SReceiver::SSupportedFrequencies.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the scanner for this channel. This is only used for narrowband measurement tasks, not for wideband measurements / demodulation. Narrowband scanner tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.DssMode.Type.DISABLED
member.summary: Disable DSS tolerant mode. In this mode the scanner immediately starts to measure on LTE reference signals. Only to be used in case there's no DSS deployment on the configured channel. If unsure enable DSS tolerant mode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.DssMode.Type.ENABLED
member.summary: Enable DSS tolerant mode. In this mode the scanner will not start to measure on LTE reference signals until a SIB2 has been decoded. SIB2 contains information which LTE subframes are used for NR signals.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.DssMode
member.summary: DSS configuration control modes. Specifies how the DSS configuration is determined by the LTE scanner.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SLteMSettings.wLteMMeasMode
member.summary: LTE-M measurement modes. Used to configure which types of measurements will be performed. Set to 0 to disable LTE-M scanner measurements on this channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SLteMSettings.wLTE_M_RS_MEAS
member.summary: Enable LTE-M reference signal measurements with the receiver front end selected for narrowband measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SLteMSettings
member.summary: Configuration for LTE-M measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsSettings.dwMaxSubframeRatePer1000Sec
member.summary: Maximum allowed eMBMS subframe measurement rate in units of 0.001 Hz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsSettings.wMbmsMeasMode
member.summary: eMBMS measurement modes. Used to configure which types of measurements will be performed. Set to 0 to disable eMBMS scanner measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsSettings.wMBSFN_RS_MEAS
member.summary: Enable MBSFN area reference signal measurements with the receiver front end selected for narrowband measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsSettings
member.summary: Configuration for eMBMS measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bRadioFrameAllocationOffset
member.summary: The frame offset to determine the start of an MBSFN broadcast. The range of valid values is [0, 7].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bRadioFrameAllocationPeriod
member.summary: The count of radio frames that occur from the first frame of an MBSFN broadcast to the first frame of the following MBSFN broadcast. MBSFN broadcasts contain one or four frames, as indicated by bOneFrameOrFourFrames. The set of valid values is {1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32}.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bOneFrameOrFourFrames
member.summary: Indicates if the dwSubframeAllocationBitMap contains the MBSFN subframe mapping for one frame or four consecutive frames. The set of valid values is {1, 4}.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.dwSubframeAllocationBitMap
member.summary: Indicates which subframes in an MBSFN frame are allocated for MBSFN. If bOneFrameOrFourFrames is 1, then dwSubframeAllocationBitMap is a 6-bit value (that is, the value is masked by 0x3F == 0b111111) that indicates which subframes in one MBSFN frame are allocated for MBSFN. For FDD and 'oneFrame', subframes #1, #2, #3, #6, #7, and #8 can be allocated for MBSFN. Respectively, positions 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, and 0 (where position 0 refers to the least significant bit) of dwSubframeAllocationBitMap indicate which of these subframes are actually allocated for MBSFN. For TDD and 'oneFrame', subframes #3, #4, #7, #8, and #9 can be allocated for MBSFN, and, similarly, positions 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1 of dwSubframeAllocationBitMap indicate which of these subframes are actually allocated for MBSFN. For TDD, the bit in position 0 is ignored. If bOneFrameOrFourFrames is 4, then dwSubframeAllocationBitMap is a 24-bit value (that is, the value is masked by 0xFFFFFF == 0b111111111111111111111111) that indicates which subframes in four consecutive MBSFN frames are allocated for MBSFN. The 'fourFrames' cases are similar to the 'oneFrame' cases above, except each of the four 6-bit chunks of the 24-bit value indicates which subframes are allocated for MBSFN for one of the four MBSFN frames. The most significant 6-bit chunk corresponds to the first frame, and so on.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bMcchModificationPeriod
member.summary: Indicates the minimum count of radio frames that must occur between transmissions of MCCH information for the contents of the transmissions to be different. The set of valid values is {512, 1024}.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bMcchRepetitionPeriod
member.summary: Specifies the interval between transmissions of MCCH information in radio frames. The set of valid values is {32, 64, 128, 256}.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bSignallingMCS
member.summary: Indicates the Modulation and Coding Scheme (MCS) used for applicable subframes in the MBSFN area. The set of valid values is {2, 7, 13, 19}.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bSfAllocInfoBitMap
member.summary: Indicates which subframes carry MCCH information for applicable radio frames. bSfAllocInfoBitMap is a 6-bit value (that is, the value is masked by 0x3F == 0b111111). For FDD, subframes #1, #2, #3, #6, #7, and #8 may carry MCCH information. Respectively, positions 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, and 0 (where position 0 refers to the least significant bit) of bSfAllocInfoBitMap indicate which of these subframes actually carry MCCH information. For TDD, subframes #3, #4, #7, #8, and #9 may carry MCCH information, and, similarly, positions 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1 of bSfAllocInfoBitMap indicate which of these subframes actually carry MCCH information. For TDD, the bit in position 0 is ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bMcchOffset
member.summary: The frame offset to determine the initial radio frame containing MCCH information. The range of valid values is [0, 7].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bNotificationIndicator
member.summary: Indicates the position of the bit corresponding to the MBSFN area in the MCCH information change notification. Value 0 corresponds with the least significant bit and so on. The range of valid values is [0, 7].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bNonMbsfnRegionLength
member.summary: The count of symbols present in each MBSFN subframe that constitute the non-MBFSN region. The range of valid values is [1, 2].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig.bMbsfnAreaId
member.summary: MBSFN area ID. The range of valid values is [0, 255].

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMbmsManualConfig
member.summary: Configuration for MBMS. This is only used if SFrequencySetting::enMbmsConfigCtrlMode is set to MBMS_CONFIG_MANUAL. Additional information for these fields can be found in 3GPP TS 36.331 section 6.3.7. See MBSFN-AreaInfo, MBMS-NotificationConfig, and MBSFN-SubframeConfig.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.bEnableThroughputEstimation
member.summary: Enables throughput estimation to get results for estimated channel capacity and estimated CQI.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.sMinRsCinrInDB100
member.summary: The minimum required reference signal CINR value in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) for the eNodeB to enable the measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wMaxRsrpDiffToBestCellInDB100
member.summary: The maximum difference (distance) allowed in subband RSRP in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) from the best received eNodeB to enable the measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.sMinCenterRsrpInDBm100
member.summary: The minimum required subband RSRP value in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) for the eNodeB to enable the measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.bMaxCountOfeNodeBs
member.summary: Maximum number of eNodeB's per channel index for which MIMO measurements shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.sCinrThresholdForRankInDB100
member.summary: Minimum CINR for a MIMO layer to be included in the rank calculation in 0.01 dB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.dwMimoResultMaskFor2x2
member.summary: MIMO result selection masks for 2x2, 2x4 and 4x4 MIMO measurements. Can be any combination of dwMIMO_RES_xxx constants as defined above.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.dwMIMO_RES_RANK
member.summary: Enables the return of the theoretical rank of the H matrix with respect to a specified CINR ratio for the minimum rank. For 2x2, 2x4 and 4x4 MIMO measurements each rank value is returned.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.dwMIMO_RES_COND_NUMBER
member.summary: Enables the return of the condition numbers for all measured H matrices. A condition number is returned for each of the enabled 2x2, 2x4 and 4x4 MIMO measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.dwMIMO_RES_CHAN_MATRIX
member.summary: Enables the return of the MIMO channel matrix (H matrix) If 2x2 and 2x4 MIMO measurements are enabled, only the 2x4 matrix is returned, since the 2x2 matrix is a subset of the 2x4 matrix. Similarly, if 4x4 MIMO measurements are enabled, only the 4x4 matrix is returned.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wTimeResolutionInMs
member.summary: Defines the time interval between MIMO measurements which are calculated per resource block at a give time position within the captured IQ data. For example wTimeResolutionInMs of 5ms and 50ms of captured IQ data leads to up to 10 results. For TDD the time resolution has to be a multiple of the 10 ms LTE frame duration. Set to 0 for only one result per IQ acquisition.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wMimoMeasMode
member.summary: MIMO measurement configuration. Use wMIMO_MODE_xxx constants defined above. Set to 0 if no MIMO measurement should be done. Use SFrequencySettings::wNarrowbandRefSignalMeasMode to enable narrowband RS-CINR, as these results are required for MIMO!

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wMIMO_MODE_4x4
member.summary: Enable 4x4 MIMO measurements for an eNodeB as soon as transmit antenna port 0, 1, 2 and 3 have been detected by the scanner.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wMIMO_MODE_2x4
member.summary: Enable 2x4 MIMO measurements for an eNodeB as soon as transmit antenna port 0, 1, 2 and 3 have been detected by the scanner.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings.wMIMO_MODE_2x2
member.summary: Enable 2x2 MIMO measurements for an eNodeB as soon as transmit antenna port 0 and 1 have been detected by the scanner.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SMimoSettings
member.summary: Configuration for MIMO measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Specify which TSMW FE should be used for RSSI measurements. For TSMW this could either be SRFPort::RF_1 or SRFPort::RF_2 or both.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRssiMeasMode
member.summary: Rssi measurement configuration. Can be any combination of wRSSI_xxx_MODE constants as defined above. 0 means no measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRSSI_TDD_GP_MODE
member.summary: The TDD guard period (GP) measurements are done as soon as the uplink downlink configuration for the channel is available. Please activate SIB1 and SIB2 demodulation for best accuracy.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRSSI_DL_ALL_TS_MODE
member.summary: One RSSI measurement for each downlink slot (0.5ms) will be performed over a whole frame (10ms). This measurement is synchronized with frame boundary of the strongest detected LTE cell. This measurement can be used for both FDD and TDD networks.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRSSI_TDD_DL_MODE
member.summary: The TDD uplink RSSI and spectrum measurements are done as soon as the uplink downlink configuration for the channel is available.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRSSI_TDD_UL_MODE
member.summary: The TDD downlink RSSI and spectrum measurements are done as soon as the uplink downlink configuration for the channel is available.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings.wRSSI_NORMAL_MODE
member.summary: The RSSI and spectrum measurements are done for a certain time range without respect to frame configuration (e.g. uplink down- link for TDD)

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SRssiSettings
member.summary: Configuration for full-channelbandwidth RSSI and spectrum measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.bTransmitAntennaSelectionMask
member.summary: Specifies a set of transmit antenna ports to use for the measurements. At least one bit has to be set. E.g. for transmit antenna port 0 and 3, bit 0 (1<<0) and 3 (1<<3) shall be set.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Specify which FE should be used for wideband RS/CINR measurements and MIMO measurements. In case of SMimoSettings::wMimoMeasMode != 0 at least two front ends have to be specified. For TSMW this could either be SRFPort::RF_1 or SRFPort::RF_2 or both.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.sMinRsCinrInDB100
member.summary: The minimum required reference signal CINR value in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) for the eNodeB to enable the subband measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wMaxRsrpDiffToBestCellInDB100
member.summary: The maximum difference (distance) allowed in subband RSRP in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) from the best received eNodeB to enable the subband measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.sMinCenterRsrpInDBm100
member.summary: The minimum required subband RSRP value in 0.01 dB (obtained from the narrowband LTE scanner) for the eNodeB to enable the subband measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.bMaxCountOfeNodeBs
member.summary: Maximum number of eNodeB's per channel index for which wideband RS-CINR, RSRP / Q measurements shall be done. This limitation is only valid for subband measurements, e.g. when wSUBBAND_MEASUREMENTS is set.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.bForceNoGap
member.summary: If set to true, then wNumberOfRBsInSubband gets adjusted to avoid gaps between subbands. If wNumberOfRBsInSubband is not a divider of the total number of resource blocks in the LTE bandwidth, then possible gaps between subbands around the DC subcarrier are eliminated by automatically increasing the subbandwidth.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wNumberOfRBsInSubband
member.summary: Number of resource blocks to specify the subband size for the wideband RS-CINR calculation if wSUBBAND_MEASUREMENTS is set. For LTE-FDD channel types 1 resource block is recommended. In LTE-TDD configurations with a low number of downlink subframes wNumberOfRBsInSubband > 1 may improve the accuracy of the wideband RS-CINR measurement results. E.g. in LTE-TDD some subframe configurations have only 2 DL subframes per frame. In this case, the subband will need to be wider to gather enough reference signals for an equivalent accuracy in the wideband RS-CINR measurement as in LTE-FDD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wMaxRBsInSubband
member.summary: Maximum resource blocks for wNumberOfRBsInSubband.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wMinRBsInSubband
member.summary: Minimum resource blocks for wNumberOfRBsInSubband.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.dwAvgBlockCountPer1000Sec
member.summary: Averaged measurement rate in Hertz. The device attempts to perform the desired number of measurements, but it is not guaranteed that the number of measurements is performed each second. In general, the device tries to achieve the desired rate averaged over a longer period of time. For default value and range see GetWbMeasRateLimits().

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wWidebandRsCinrMeasMode
member.summary: Wideband Reference Signal measurement modes. Used to configure if wideband RS-CINR measurements shall be done or not. 0 means no measurements. Use SFrequencySettings::wNarrowbandRefSignalMeasMode to enable narrowband RS-CINR, as these results are required for wideband RS-CINR! Subband measurements are not possible for signals having S-SYNC CINR < -5 dB!

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wSUBBAND_MEASUREMENTS
member.summary: Enable additional subband measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings.wWIDEBAND_RS_CINR
member.summary: Enable wideband RS-CINR measurements.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SWidebandRsCinrSettings
member.summary: Configuration for wideband RS-CINR measurements.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.MbmsConfigCtrlMode.Type.MBMS_NOT_PRESENT
member.summary: MIMO scanner measurements are performed on all subframes.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.MbmsConfigCtrlMode.Type.MBMS_CONFIG_MANUAL
member.summary: The MBMS configuration is determined by the values set in SFrequencySetting::MbmsManualConfig.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.MbmsConfigCtrlMode.Type.MBMS_CONFIG_AUTO
member.summary: The MBMS configuration for each cell is determined by the SIB2 and SIB13 detected for that cell. Demodulation requests for SIB2 and SIB13 must be configured manually in this case. Minimally, requests should have eDemodulationMode set to DemodMode::ONCE, which will cause the first MBMS configuration detected to be used for the remainder of the measurement. Prior to MBMS configuration detection, MIMO scanner measurements are only performed on subframes guaranteed to be non-MBFSN subframes. This mode ignores values set in SFrequencySetting::MbmsManualConfig.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.MbmsConfigCtrlMode
member.summary: MBMS configuration control mode. Specifies how the MBMS configuration is determined by the MIMO, MBMS and LTE-M scanners.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings.sMaxSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB
member.summary: Maximum allowed value for _StructRatioList::afSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB and _StructRatioRange::fUpperRatioInDB

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings.sMinSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB
member.summary: Minimum allowed value for _StructRatioList::afSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB and _StructRatioRange::fLowerRatioInDB

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings._StructRatioRange.fUpperRatioInDB
member.summary: The highest ratio that shall apply to the relation between P-SYNC and S-SYNC. Possible values are in between fLowerRatioInDB and fUpperRatioInDB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings._StructRatioRange.fLowerRatioInDB
member.summary: The lowest ratio that shall apply to the relation between P-SYNC and S-SYNC. Possible values are in between fLowerRatioInDB and fUpperRatioInDB.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings._StructRatioList.dwValueCount
member.summary: A value between 1 and 6, specifying how many of the values stored in afSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB array shall be used.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings._StructRatioList.afSSyncToPSyncRatioInDB
member.summary: 1 to 6 valid power ratios; The values need not to be ordered because ordering is done internally.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioType.Type.RatioRange
member.summary: use settings stored in SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings::RatioRange

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioType.Type.RatioList
member.summary: use settings stored in SSyncToPSyncRatioSettings::RatioList

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.SSyncToPSyncRatioType
member.summary: To improve the synchronization speed of the LTE scanner, it is possible to define power ratios between the S-SYNC and the P-SYNC channel. These ratios are used to find the two channels in the signal that has been measured. One way is to define up to 6 fixed ratios for the power ratio between the P-SYNC and the S-SYNC channel. The list of these values is used to find such a constellation of S-SYNC and P-SYNC on the carrier. There is no interpolation or similar applied to them, each value is tested if a matching sequence can be found. The other possibility is to define a range in which the power ratio must reside. This is the more general approach if less information about the network(s) measured is known upfront. Note that the scanner will also synchronize if those values are of no help, but it'll take somewhat longer to do so.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.BandwidthCtrlMode.Type.BW_FROM_MIB_ONCE_EACH_CELL
member.summary: This mode uses the MIB from each detected cell ID to determine the bandwidth for that cell. This mode handles the scenario where different cell IDs on the same channel frequency may have different bandwidth configurations. Note: This mode is less efficient and requires more resources than modes LTE_BW_FROM_MIB_ONCE or LTE_BW_KNOWN, therefore if it is known that all cells have the same bandwidth configuration, it is recommend that one of the other modes be used.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.BandwidthCtrlMode.Type.BW_FROM_MIB_ONCE
member.summary: This mode uses the MIB from the first detected cell ID to determine the bandwidth for all eNodeB's on this channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.BandwidthCtrlMode.Type.BW_KNOWN
member.summary: The number of eNobeB resource blocks is taken from wNumberOfResourceBlocks. This mode shortens the delay to first measurement results, as no MIB needs to be decoded up-front.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting.BandwidthCtrlMode
member.summary: Bandwidth control modes. Used to configure if the number of resource blocks to use for wideband, MIMO and LTE-M measurements on this channel shall be determined from a MIB or are known before.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SFrequencySetting
member.summary: Configuration of the measurement that is performed on one single frequency.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.dMbmsScannerRateInHz
member.summary: eMBMS measurement rate in Hertz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.dWidebandScannerRateInHz
member.summary: Wideband measurement rate in Hertz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.dNarrowbandScannerRateInHz
F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.bIsEnabled
member.summary: TRUE - this channel is currently active. FALSE - all channel measurements are switched off (measurement rates below are preserved for future use).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: The channel index for this measurement settings information.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState.ALL_ENABLED_CHANNELS
member.summary: Used in dwChannelIndex to change measurement rates for all active channels can only be used while bIsEnabled is enabled, and only affects currently enabled channels.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.SChannelState
member.summary: Struct containing the channel measurement settings that can be modified during a running measurement

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.FrameStructureType.Type.TDD
member.summary: Time Division Duplex Mode.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.FrameStructureType.Type.FDD
member.summary: Frequency Division Duplex Mode.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.LTE.FrameStructureType
member.summary: Definition of the channel type.

members.member:
Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

By means of the functions: SetConfiguration() internal settings of the PN-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the PN-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
@return pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sSINRThresholdDB100
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SMbmsSettings::dwMaxSubframeRatePer1000Sec
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SWidebandRsCinrSettings::dwAvgBlockCountPer1000Sec
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SFrequencySettings::dwAvgBlockCountPer1000Sec
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different device applications. The purpose is to control basic device functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
@return reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.
LTE measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all LTE related measurement tasks. \@attribute[type="interface" supportedDevices="TSME"]

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.channels
member.summary: List of channel measurement results for each channel detected by ACD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.measurementStatus
member.summary: Measurement status indicator MeasurementStatus

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.acdResultTimeStampInMs
member.summary: PC local time when the ACD result was processed.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.additionalChannelInfo
member.summary: List of different bandwidth parts associated with a channel. Each bandwidth part comes with the bandwidth, start/stop/center frequencies and a flag to indicate what the bandwidth part is. ChannelInfoFlag for more information on which channel information types are supported.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.bandsAndChannels
member.summary: List of frequency bands and channel numbers for this channel. For technologies that support overlapping frequency bands, where a RF channel frequency can belong to more than one band, an entry for each band ID and channel numbers is provided. For example, LTE Multi Frequency Band Indicator (MFBI) @note If the technology assigns a priority order to the bands, the entries in the list will be the sorted so that the first entry has highest priority, followed by bands in descending priority. BandIdAndChannelNumber for more information.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.bandConfirmed
member.summary: True if the band information has been confirmed, False otherwise. For some technologies (i.e. LTE), band information is verified from broadcast message decoding. For technologies with a known band, this will always be True. bandsAndChannels.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.networkOperators
member.summary: List of network operator identifiers (MCC/MNC) for this channel. For technologies that distinguish between primary and secondary network operators (i.e. LTE), the first entry in the list will be the primary identifier, followed by entries for any secondary identifiers. NetworkOperator for more information.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.channelDirection
member.summary: Indicates if the channel is a downlink, uplink, or time division duplex (TDD) channel.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.rssiInDBm
member.summary: Measured received signal strength indicator (RSSI) value in dBm.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.bandwidthConfirmed
member.summary: For technologies that have variable channel bandwidths (i.e. LTE), this indicates if the bandwidth has been confirmed. For technologies with a known bandwidth, this will always be True.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.bandwidthInHz
member.summary: Bandwidth of the channel, in Hz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.frequencyInHz
member.summary: Channel frequency in Hz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.technology
member.summary: Technology indicator for this ACD measurement result. Only one technology is reported in each measurement result. For scanning on multiple technologies, separate results are returned.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.chanResultTimeStampInMs
member.summary: Timestamp of when this channel was measured last. GetTickCount() is used to provide the value, which is the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system was started. The value wraps after 49.7 days.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.ChannelInfo.stopFrequency
member.summary: Stop frequency in Hertz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.ChannelInfo.centerFrequency
member.summary: Center frequency in Hertz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.ChannelInfo.startFrequency
member.summary: Start frequency in Hertz.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.ChannelInfo.bandWidth
member.summary: Bandwidth in Hertz.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.FastACD.SMeasResult.SChannel.ChannelInfo
