members.member: Definition of raw packet types. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderResult.pcPduText
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the decoded PDU text, as zero terminated ASCII string.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderResult.dwStringLength
member.summary: Number of decoding result text bytes in the buffer (incl. terminating '\0').

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderResult
member.summary: Result from the Layer 3 Decoder. The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the standard (3GPP TS 36.331). It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF". In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): -Formatted exactly according to the standard. -Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderRequest.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to a buffer containing the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, there are remaining bits, which shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderRequest.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits for this PDU.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderRequest.ePDU
member.summary: PDU contained.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SL3DecoderRequest
member.summary: Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. Is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.pDemodResult
member.summary: Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.ListOfSignals
member.summary: The actual set of signals associated with the current channel specified by the dwChannelIndex member.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.ListMeasurementRatesTotal
member.summary: List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.u64DeviceTimeInNs
member.summary: The time when the signal was started to being measured on the device, with a higher resolution than the default PC clock. This time is relative to the last restart of the device.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.dwPcTimeStampInMs
member.summary: PC local time when the signal was measured (or was started to being measured) on the device.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: The channel to which all the data relates is specified using this index. The index refers to the position in the SChannelSettings::pTableOfFrequencySetting array.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.bOperationMode
member.summary: Indicates operational mode Inband - 1 Guardband - 2 Standalone - 3 UNKNOWN - SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbActiveAntennaMask
member.summary: Bits 0 to 1 are set to indicate that antenna port 0 to antenna port 1 are active if pbActiveAntennaMask is not NULL.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.wPhysicalCellId
member.summary: The physical Cell ID, which can take one from the values defined by [0;503].

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.pbBitStream
member.summary: Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBitCount
member.summary: Number of bits the PDU consists of.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.ePDU
member.summary: PDU that has been demodulated

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStopTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the last time in ms of signals used for this message. All IQ signals used to produce this demodulation result are in between dwStartTimeInMs and dwStopTimeInMs.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwStartTimeInMs
member.summary: This is the first time in ms of signals used for this message.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwFirstBtsId
member.summary: The demodulator fills this parameter with the BTS ID the scanner assigned to this BTS first. If later on, the scanner uses a different BTS ID, but after demodulation it is detected that it is the same eNodeB, the demodulator fills this value with the first BTS ID the scanner used. Example: The scanner has measured a eNodeB with ID = 10 and the demodulator has demodulated it successfully. 20 minutes later the scanner found signals of a eNodeB with ID = 55. After demodulating, the demodulator finds out (by comparing unique BTS information from decoding), that it is the same eNodeB as the one with ID = 10. In this case, dwFirstBtsId will be set to 10.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. Each time the scanner is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known eNodeB, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same eNodeB could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single cell.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SDemodResult
member.summary: BCH demodulator results

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SSignals.dFrameArrivalOffsetToBlockInS
member.summary: Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival (TOA) and u64DeviceTimeInNs. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. This feature does not require a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver. If not valid set to DBL_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SSignals.dFrameToaOffsetToPpsInSec
member.summary: Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival (TOA) and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver. If not valid set to DBL_MAX.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SSignals.wPhysicalCellId
member.summary: Physical Cell ID 0 - 503.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SMeasResult.SSignals.dwScannerBtsIdent

member.summary: List of the reference signals.

member.summary: Measured Narrowband Reference Signal Received Power in dBm.

member.summary: CINR of narrowband synchronization signal in dBm.

member.summary: Structure of the primary and secondary synchronization signals

member.summary: The set of frequencies that shall be measured.

member.summary: This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom NB-IoT scanner module. It is a result of the CViComIoTInterface::GetSettings() method.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodulationSettings.sStartMeasurementRequests
member.summary: The requests for the general start measurement command.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodulationSettings.dwFrontEndSelectionMask
member.summary: Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodulationSettings.sSINRThresholdDB100
member.summary: SINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dBm. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodulationSettings
member.summary: This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process.

member.summary: Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be NULL, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.summary: Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwBtsId
member.summary: Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.wRepetitionTimeOutInMs
member.summary: Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.eDemodulationMode
member.summary: The mode used for BCH demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.ePDU
member.summary: The PDU to be demodulated.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest.dwChannelIndex
member.summary: Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests.SDemodRequest
member.summary: There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels. Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: (0,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(0,<sp></sp>SIB4,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB3,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB5,<sp></sp>REPETITION,<sp></sp>10000,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0)(1,<sp></sp>SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>0) Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 SC 5 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): (0,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>CHANNEL_RESET,<sp></sp>0,<sp></sp>3,<sp></sp>5)(1,<sp></sp>PDU_FOR_SIB7,<sp></sp>ON_CMD,<sp></sp>1000,<sp></sp>4,<sp></sp>5)@note You are responsible to manage memory, when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.SDemodRequests
member.summary: This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode.Type.CHANNEL_RESET
member.summary: Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode.Type.BTS
member.summary: The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode.Type.REPETITION
member.summary: After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode.Type.ON_CMD
member.summary: The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command for demodulation requests the demodulation. If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode.Type.ONCE
member.summary: Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. Only to be used in start measurement.

member.name: T:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.IOT.DemodMode
member.summary: This enumeration defines modes for the BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequests structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done.

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.SResultCounters.dwCountOfBufferedResults

member.name: F:RohdeSchwarz.ViCom.Net.SReceiverSettings.fAgcTimeConstantInMs
member.summary: The AGC time constant defines how long a measured input power in RF spectrum scan is valid to control internal attenuation / gain settings in the receiver. The validity is floating and decrements exponentially (linear in dB). After the given time the power in Watt degrades by 1/e i.e. 4.34 dB in logarithmic scale. The measured RF spectrum is used to find RF board settings to protect the receiver against intermodulation on high input power. This results in lower sensitivity (higher noise figure) during high input power reception. The 30 sec default value is good for normal drive test. With this value the receiver is sensitive in rural areas and well protected against intermodulation in urban areas with very high transmitter density. Applies to TSME / TSME6 receivers only. Can only be set for the very first link to a TSME / TSME6. Limits: 1ms to 60 sec, default: 30 sec

This code should allow creation of a callback from C++ into .NET, while the .NET side runs inside an AppDomain Info was taken from http://www.lenholgate.com/blog/2009/07/error-cannot-pass-a-gchandle-across-appdomains.html Unfortunatelly the solution works on function-callbacks. We do not know yet how to use it on callback interfaces.

Unregister a formerly registered ScannerData listener to remove it from the list of objects that shall get notification about new measurement data.
@param[in] pListener The listener that shall be unregistered. If NULL or if the listener is not found in the list of registered objects, an error is indicated.

By means of the functions SetConfiguration() internal settings of the NB-IoT-Scanner may be changed. The functions SelectReceiver() of CViComBasicInterface change basic settings. Except for frequency settings all other settings have default values. By means of this function you can retrieve the NB-Scanner settings which apply at the moment for measurements to be started or during running measurements. Note that the result, like all other results too, is only for reading. To change settings the functions mentioned above should be used.
@return pointer to a structure holding the current device settings. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SFrequencySettings::dwMeasRatePer1000sec.
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SDemodulationSettings::sSINRThresholdDB100
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

Limits for Parameter SChannelSettings::dwCount
@return pointer to a structure holding the limits for this setting. In case of failure, NULL. The returned value is valid as long as no other interface method is called.

The basic interface is a part of any application specific ViCom interface. It is used for different TSMW applications. The purpose is to control basic TSMW functions, which are not specific for a certain measurement. See CViComBasicInterface for specification of basic interface functions.
@return reference to the BasicInterface object that can be used to control basic functions like StartMeasurement() and StopMeasurement() et al.
IoT measurement module for ViCom. Offers the configuration and result receiving methods for all IoT related measurement tasks. \@attribute[type="interface"]

If StartMeasurement fails then additional messages received from the receiver can be retrieved with GetMessagesDuringStartMeasurement().
@return Pointer to a list of SMessage objects, containing message information if operation succeeded.

This is possible if all preconditions have been met e.g frequencies have been selected, and a previous measurement has been stopped successfully. A sucessful stop can be checked with the HasMeasurementStopped() function below.

Not supported yet! When many receivers are connected to the control computer, an application can use this function to trigger the identify functionality which leads to flashing LEDs on the receiver front panel.
If SelectReceiver was not called once before, the receiver at the index 0 is used by default.
@return the character based version information of the interface, or NULL if an error occurred. The result specifies the version of the ViCom interface that implements the interface.
@return the version of the interface, or NULL if an error occurred. The result specifies the version of the ViCom interface that implements the interface.

ViCom data processors are listeners which can be registered at an ViCom interface to retrieve different kind of data.

Result from the Layer 3 Decoder.
The string returned via this structure is formatted using the ASN.1 notation of the standard (3GPP TS 36.331). It contains one completely decoded PDU terminated by CR+LF. Data subsets (i.e. Information Elements) within the string are headed by "CR+LF+{", indented via spaces and terminated by "}+CR+LF".
In addition to the standard, some Information Elements are added twice (see example cellIdentity below): 1. Formatted exactly according to the standard. 2. Formatted with unit or format description between square brackets ("[" "]") and representing a reasonable value.
\@attribute[type="serializable"]
Request data container for the Layer 3 Decoder. Is used to decode a demodulation result into a human-readable structure. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Pointer to demodulation result. If NULL, no demodulation result is present.
Bits 0 to 1 are set to indicate that antenna port 0 to antenna port 1 are active if pbActiveAntennaMask is not NULL.
The physical Cell ID, which can take one from the values defined by [0;503].

Pointer to (dwBitCount + 7) / 8 bytes which contain the PDU bits. The first bit is stored in the bit 7 of pbBitStream[0]. If dwBitCount is not a multiple of 8, the trailing bits in the last byte pbBitStream[(dwBitCount + 7) / 8 - 1] shall be ignored. \@attribute[type="bitfield" size="dwBitCount" sizeismember="true"]
Number of bits the PDU consists of.
PDU that has been demodulated
This is the last time in ms of signals used for this message. All IQ signals used to produce this demodulation result are in between dwStartTimeInMs and dwStopTimeInMs.
This is the first time in ms of signals used for this message.

The demodulator fills this parameter with the BTS ID the scanner assigned to this BTS first. If later on, the scanner uses a different BTS ID, but after demodulation it is detected that it is the same eNodeB, the demodulator fills this value with the first BTS ID the scanner used. Example: The scanner has measured a eNodeB with ID = 10 and the demodulator has demodulated it successfully. 20 minutes later the scanner found signals of a eNodeB with ID = 55. After demodulating, the demodulator finds out (by comparing unique BTS information from decoding), that it is the same eNodeB as the one with ID = 10. In this case, dwFirstBtsId will be set to 10.

Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. Each time the scanner is not sure whether the signal it could demodulate belongs to an already known eNodeB, it sets a new identifier here. I.e. the same eNodeB could have multiple dwBtsIds, but each dwBtsId relates always to a single cell.
BCH demodulator results \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The actual set of signals associated with the current channel specified by the dwChannelIndex member.

Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival (TOA) and u64DeviceTimeInNs. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. This feature does not require a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver. If not valid set to DBL_MAX.

Time difference between Radio Frame Time of Arrival (TOA) and the latest PPS pulse received. The time, when the maximum CIR peak has been received, is used as Radio Frame Time of Arrival. This feature requires a GPS antenna to be connected to the receiver. If not valid set to DBL_MAX.
Physical Cell ID 0 - 503.

Internal ID assigned from the scanner to that specific station. Different stations will become different IDs assigned to them, but if the scanner cannot identify a cell exactly, it also might assign different IDs to the same station.
@note This is unique only within one measurement. Do not use it when combining the results of different measurements
Structure of the reference signals \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Structure of the primary and secondary synchronization signals \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Actual measurement values for a single server. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

List of measurement rates rates and other values in relation to the measurement rate for one or more time intervals of measurement rate calculation. The measurement rate is the ratio of all measurements of the same type of measurement at the time the measurement signals have been picked from the air. So the time of arrival at the host application is not used. And equal measurements at different RF channels are put together.
The time when the signal was started to being measured on the device, with a higher resolution than the default PC clock. This time is relative to the last restart of the device.
PC local time when the signal was measured (or was started to being measured) on the device.
The channel to which all the data relates is specified using this index. The index refers to the position in the SChannelSettings::pTableOfFrequencySetting array.
The NB-IoT measurement result for a single channel returned by CViComIotInterface::GetResult(). \@attribute[type="serializable"]
This structure holds all the measurement setup that is configured in the ViCom NB-IoT scanner module. It is a result of the CViComIoTInterface::GetSettings() method. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
The requests for the general start measurement command.
Receiver front end to be used by the demodulator for this channel. If no demodulation shall be provided, this shall be set to 0. Demodulation tasks are not allowed to contain multiple FE's.
SINR threshold for demodulation, given in 1/100 dBm. For default value and range see GetDemodThresholdLimits().
This structure is used to configure the BCH demodulation process. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Pointer to an array of demodulation requests. Must be NULL, if no demodulation shall be done. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfRequests" sizeismember="true"]
Unique BTS ID provided by the scanner as SSignals::dwScannerBtsIdent. This ID is used by the BCHDemodulator to demodulate a specific BTS, when the bDemodulationMode is set to ON_CMD.
Repetition time out in ms (only used if bDemodulationMode == REPETITION).
The mode used for BCH demodulation.
The PDU to be demodulated.
Index of the frequency in SChannelSettings::aTableOfFrequencySetting.

There must be one instance of this structure for each BCH demodulation request, therefore different PDUs can be measured on different channels.
Example for start measurement: On the first channel SIBs 3 and 4 shall be decoded, on the the second channel SIBs 3, 5 and 7 shall be decoded. SIB 5 shall be decoded repeatedly every 10 seconds (10000 ms) and SIB 7 shall be decoded on demand. This requires five structures containing the following parameter sets: @code (0, SIB3, 0, 0, 0, 0) (0, SIB4, 0, 0, 0, 0) (1, SIB3, 0, 0, 0, 0) (1, SIB5, REPETITION, 10000, 0, 0) (1, SIB7, ON_CMD, 0, 0, 0) @endcode Example during measurement: On channel 0 PDU demodulation shall be completely reset for the BTS identified by ID 3 and on the the second channel SIB 7 shall be decoded for the BTS identified by ID 4 SC 5 with a timeout for the request of 1 sec (1000ms): @code (0, 0, CHANNEL_RESET, 0, 3, 5) (1, PDU_FOR_SIB7, ON_CMD, 1000, 4, 5) @endcode @note You are responsible to manage memory, when you use SetDemodulationSettings(). All parameters which are not necessary for a certain request shall be set to 0. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Number of demodulation requests. Must be 0, if no demodulation shall be done.

This structure is used to configure PDU requests. It is used in start measurement requests and it is used to issue BCH demodulation requests during measurement, e.g. SIB requests on demand or to reset SIB demodulation. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
All demodulation results for each BTS on the specified channel will be deleted and the demodulation for this channel starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
All demodulation results for each BTS on the specified channel will be deleted and the demodulation for this channel starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
Delete all demodulation results for all BTS at the specified channel. Restart demodulation for this channel as specified in the command. This can be requested only during a running measurement.
All demodulation results for each BTS on the specified channel will be deleted and the demodulation for this channel starts as specified in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. This can be requested only during a running measurement.

The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If wRepetitionTimeOutInMs is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
The demodulation is only for a BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
The demodulation is only for a special BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in the start measurement frame. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
The demodulation is only for a BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.
Demodulate the PDU only for a specific BTS. The BTS is specified in the S_PDU_Request::dwBtsId field. This demodulation mode is only valid during a running measurement (i.e. on demand).
The demodulation is only for a BTS. This can be requested only during a running measurement and when the PDU was also requested in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests. If dwTimeOutOrRepetitionDelayIn100ms is different from 0 then the demodulation is only tried during the given time.

After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionTimeOutInMs. Results are provided for the strongest SS/PBCH block only. Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the delay time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the delay time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms Only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the repetition time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms. This is only to be used in start measurement.
After each successful demodulation a new one will be started automatically after the delay time specified in wRepetitionDelayIn100ms Only to be used in start measurement.

The PDU is only demodulated if an extra command for demodulation requests the demodulation.

If this is used, then no PDU is decoded until it is explicitly requested. The method IssueDemodRequests can be used for that purpose.

Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. Only to be used in start measurement.
Demodulate the PDU for each BTS at the specified channel only once. Only to be used in start measurement.

Sync channel has to be demodulated only once for time synchronization. This has to be done for each RF band, but processing power is saved for other tasks in that mode.
The PDU is demodulated only once for each BTS. Only to be used in SDemodulationSettings::sStartMeasurementRequests.

This enumeration defines modes for the BCH demodulation. Use this in the SDemodRequests structure to specify when the demodulation of this PDU shall be done. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

This array of structures can be filled with single frequency configurations. Only dwCount entries from this table will be used. \@attribute[type="array" size="dwCount" sizeismember="true"]
Number of frequency configurations that shall be used from the pTableOfFrequencySetting to perform the measurement tasks. For value range see GetChannelCountLimits().
This structure holds the measurement setup for the NB-IoT measurement. It basically consists of the set of frequencies that shall be measured. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
If set, this channel will discontinue all processing after sending at least one valid BTS result.

Avg. Meas. Rate in milli Hz. This is used for all NB-IoT scanner measurements reported in BtsSignals and PrimarySyncSignals and SecondarySyncSignals.

\@attribute[type="array" size="dwCountOfReceivers" sizeismember="true"]

Information on a connected GPS antenna. If true the receiver has a GPS antenna connected. The open- / short-circuit detection did not detect any errors. Only available in combination with TSME6 receivers.

Container for receiver temperatures. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
List of frequency bands supported by the receiver. Each sub band is specified in Hz.
measurement capabilities of the device.

This defines what special capabilities the receiver has. This value is a or-combination of the constants defined below. For each capability, there is another application interface that can be used to access the specific functionality. For example, if dwFlagForRFPowerScan flag is set, then the ViComRFPowerScanInterface can be used for that receiver.
Version of the installed hardware inclusive FPGA configuration code, to be read as an 8 digit decimal integer Example: TSMW FW Version 1.15.0.0 => dwHardwareVersion = 0x010F0000
Version of the application software, to be read as an 8 digit decimal integer.
Model number of the receiver.
Serial number of the receiver.
Defines the receiver type. The command set of this interface is compatible with certain receiver types.
Index of the used network interface if not SDefs::INVALID_DWORD_VALUE
Version of the internet protocol for TSMW and TSME.
Automatically configured TSME6 IP address using Auto-IP feature. Possible range is: 169.254.0.1 to 169.254.255.254. Only valid if at least one byte is different to SDefs::INVALID_BYTE_VALUE.
TSMW and TSME receiver are connected via IEEE 802.3 Ethernet bus. The address is formated in a dot-decimal like notation, e.g. the first array element is the first octet of the address.
For each receiver connected to the system, one such structure is filled. dwCountOfReceivers contains how many instances of this structure are available. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
There can not be more than 8 receivers connected to one PC at a time.

When the system is asked for how many devices are connected, this structure is the result. This contains - version information - hardware information - driver information about every receiver that was connected before and are still active.
@note The table does not contain receivers of various types. E.g. if the system is asked for connected devices on a TSMW, the connected receiver table will not contain any receivers other than TSMW! \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Specifies operation modes for the TSME6 pre-selection stage. \@attribute[type="serializable"]

The AGC time constant defines how long a measured input power in RF spectrum scan is valid to control internal attenuation / gain settings in the receiver. The validity is floating and decrements exponentially (linear in dB). After the given time the power in Watt degrades by 1/e i.e. 4.34 dB in logarithmic scale. The measured RF spectrum is used to find RF board settings to protect the receiver against intermodulation on high input power. This results in lower sensitivity (higher noise figure) during high input power reception. The 30 sec default value is good for normal drive test. With this value the receiver is sensitive in rural areas and well protected against intermodulation in urban areas with very high transmitter density. Applies to TSME / TSME6 receivers only. Can only be set for the very first link to a TSME / TSME6. Limits: 1ms to 60 sec, default: 30 sec *
Definition of special receiver settings. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
Definition of operating modes for special receiver ports. Only a subset of the following settings might be supported by specific receiver ports in STSMPort::ePort. \@attribute[type="serializable"]
